story: My little sister has a rare bone disease called fibrous dysplasia. It affects people in many different ways. Her case specifically is dealing with abnormal bone growth behind her eye causing pressure to her nerves in her eye. Over the past few years it has caused one eye to grow out a little farther than the other and her eyesight has become progressively worse. If not treated soon she could lose vision in that eye as well as her hearing on that side of her head. She will be getting surgery soon but due to the rarity of this procedure and the delicate nature of the procedure the surgery will be quite expensive and risky. We are praying that everything will go well. In addition she will also have to have plastic surgery after the procedure to get her face looking the same again. With me going to college and having two other younger siblings, this is a lot to handle for my mom and stepdad. It's even worse because we never understood what was happening to her. We thought she just couldn't see well and glasses would help her. And that her eyes were just a bit uneven. My little sister is the best sister anyone could ask for. I want very much to help her so she can live a normal, happy life. Please donate, even the smallest amounts help! I will be posting more and posting pictures of when she goes into surgery. In the very least, please keep her in your prayers.

story:
Gail, the Ultimate Fighter

My aunt Gail has put her boxing gloves back on for another time to continue her fight that began over 8 years ago with Ovarian Cancer. As an active member of her church, local community and online community of those also affected by Ovarian Cancer, Gail has shown great strength and bravery, and has used her experiences to give support back to others.

Her fight takes her to Houston, TX, where at MD Anderson Cancer Center she has begun a new clinical trial. Her treatment requires her to travel from Murray, KY twice a month. This involves driving 2 hours to Nashville and taking a plane to Houston. 

How You Can Help

Your monetary contributions will allow Gail to focus on her recovery while giving her the financial means to continue the trial. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can help beyond financial support! Please share this campaign with everyone you know!

story:
My son was born with an extremely rare birth condition known as Caudal Regression Syndrome. His pain and suffering derive from multiple birth defects. He was born a few months premature with an imperforate anus (no anus present), deformities to his genital area, multiple hernias, an underdeveloped stomach, two holes in his heart, is missing a few ribs and a tailbone, but most critically; he was born with only 1/4 of a kidney which they call a multicystic dysplastic kidney. Since birth, he has been literally hospitalized for over 2/3's of his life. This is due to his numerous surgeries and illnesses.
 
He now has started dialysis treatments and is on the road to transplantation. He is home more often now. Things are starting to settle down a little for our family.
 
WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:
 
We travel over 300 miles round-trip weekly for his multiple doctors appointments. We are asking for help to be able to purchase an economical vehicle 12K and any funds raised thereafter will go to cover the expenses we will incurr for a time period between 6 months to a year when he will be ready for his kidney transplants. His transplants will be performed  either in California, Colorado, or Washington which are the 3 states approved by our insurance.
 
OUR GIFTS TO YOU FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION:

There are no words I can say to you that will convey just how much your help will mean to me and will improve the lives of my family. Although it is not much, all we can offer in exchange for your contribution are gifts from our talents.
 
CAN'T HELP WITH MONEY? YOU STILL CAN HELP IN A BIG WAY:

We know that in today's economy, there are so many families out there struggling to make ends meet. We know this and understand. For those of you who would like to help us in some way but don't know how? You can greatly help us out by sharing our Link to our campaign here on Indiegogo with friends or people of interest in any of your social networks like Facebook or Twitter. Also, by clicking on any "LIKE" button on any and all of our pages where you see a "LIKE" button, you will help share our story.
 

 




Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Your donation will help not one, not two, but THREE great causes.

Matt last cut his hair on October 28, 2010 to support my mother, Brenda, on her first day of chemotheraphy. He shaved his head down to the bare nub as a sign of solidarity and it's been growing back ever since.

On June 2, the 2nd Annual "For Love of Luke" Memorial Golf Tournament will raise funds in support of Sick Kids Hospital and Perinatal Bereavement Services of Ontario. Organized by Matt's cousin, Simone, the event raised an incredible $25,000 in its first year. This year's event promises to be even more successful.

Matt's first haircut in over a year and a half will be auctioned off as part of the "For Love of Luke" evening events, and I'm raising funds to win the auction and support these two great charities. Matt's also donating his hair to Locks of Love to help with their efforts in making hairpieces for children in Canada and the United States.

While I have set the fundraising target to $500.00, I've challenged myself to raise as much as possible before the event date. If you prefer to donate cash, please contact me directly to make arrangements. Regardless of whether the auction is won or lost, every dollar raised will be donated to the event and its supported charities.

Your donation will help three very worthy organizations! Together we can finally CUT MATT'S HAIR.

story:
Constance Pokorny was struck by a presumed drunk driver while attending a benefit for The Aids Taskforce of Greater Cleveland called Dancing in the Streets.  The car smashed through the barricades and struck Constance her boyfriend Mitch Andelmo and others.  Mitch unfortunately passed away.  Constance is currently out of the ICU.  She is recovering at home and continues receiving medical care for the severe injuries she recieved.  She will have a long road ahead to recover from this horrific event.

Please take a moment to donate and help offset her medical expenses.

story:
Dear friends, we invite you to become partners in making health and sustainable living information accessible to all!

Work Completed To Date

The Lazarus Health Project is entering Phase 2 of its mandate to create an interactive, entertaining, online video-based education tool for all age groups, that will be free of charge.

Phase 1 involved putting the basic hardware in place, such as production equipment and postproduction software. The Project has generated over a hundred hours of footage, from interviews to patient stories to instructional material. We created a simple yet useful wordpress website with more than a dozen edited video shorts, and we have been building relationships with social change groups both locally and internationally. The vision has been getting clearer and clearer and we are very excited to take things to the next level, with your help.

Why This Matters

Reclaiming our right to vibrant health is more crucial than ever.  Chronic and degenerative illness rates are on the rise. More of us can expect to get cancer and other debilitating conditions than ever before. Most of this increase is due to degradation in our food supply (leading to a nutrient-deficient diet), poor lifestyle choices as well as increased exposure to pollutants and environmental toxins.

There is an overwhelming amount of health information online, much of it narrowly focused or slanted towards a particular regimen or prescribed set of rules to follow. In addition, most health resources seem to be promoting products, practitioners, or solutions for profit. We aim to remain bias-free, both financially and ideologically, to serve an eclectic community of health practitioners and health-seekers and to integrate various tested and credible sources of information.

What's Next and How You Can Help

We are at a turning point! We are now ready to launch Phase 2, the official Lazarus Health Project web site, and need your help. This is an ambitious undertaking and reflects our vision of a comprehensive online resource that will guide users through an interactive health education experience. Our web site will be designed around 8 core principles of health.

We will create an overview clip on each of these areas. We have already completed Nourish Yourself , we have 7 more to go and are well on our way with several of them! In addition, we will be generating a host of other short-format clips to be posted under the 8 categories, but also cross-linked to the other clips. That is why we need your support!

From Nuts-and-Bolts to The Bigger Vision

To make this vision a reality, we need the technological know-how of the best web designers and online programmers in the field. To translate the holism and relationship between all areas of health, we need an online platform that mirrors this interconnectedness. We plan to achieve this by incorporating the following features in the new web site:

  • interactivity such as clickable text overlays and thumbnails
  • related video hotspots and content 'flagging' options
  • customizable table of contents under each user profile
  • one-click sharing of videos on social media sites and mobile devices
  • membership-based updates and webinars

We will also link to other trusted sources and advocacy groups around the world. Your contribution will enable the launch of this tool for creating one's own health curriculum and sharing the information in an online community setting.

Your Contribution Helps Preserve Independent Media on Health and the Environment

To date, the Lazarus Health Project has depended entirely on individual private donors and is not affiliated with government, corporate, or institutional sources of funding. It does not generate revenue by promoting or selling health products or health-related information. It is truely a project by the people and for the people! Your contribution, big or small, promotes this model of citizen journalism as a platform for education and advocacy.

Please help us spread the word! Watch this video which features both of us sharing why this project matters!

Who's Behind the Project

Anthony Fulker is a holistic health and lifestyle counselor who has translated over 20 years of in-depth experience in the field into an effective program comprehensible and achievable for most everyone. His Eight Steps Towards Dynamic Life and Health shows us how we achieve true health through simple, common sense steps taken consistently as opposed to heroic efforts with diets, fitness programs, and the latest supplement or miracle medical intervention.

Lazarina Todorova is a video producer, with a passion for media as a catalyst for human betterment around the world. For nearly a decade, she has assisted organizations in strengthening their message on issues such as health and environmental sustainability, human rights, education and gender equity. Most recently, she partnered with Anthony in co-producing the Lazarus Health Project, where she serves as a videographer, video editor and co-director.

We anticipate to expand the Lazarus production team to include additional cinematographers, graphic and web designers, social media bloggers, as well as health practitioners and other content advisers.

story:
Short Summary

Hello my name is Jairus.  I am 34 years old and I am pleading for your
help!!  I have been diagnosed with a Neuroendocrine
Stage 4 cancer called Paraganglioma. It’s a rare cancer that I have been battling for the past 2 years and if I don’t receive a procedure right away, called PRRT, I will die.  This aggressive cancer has destroyed my kidney leaving me with only one kidney. It has destroyed parts of my spine leaving me with rods in my back,
numbness in my legs, I can’t stand up straight and can barely walk.  I have undergone those major surgeries that almost took my life. There are spots of the tumor on my lungs which affects my speaking & breathing, on my head and the tumor that was removed in my back has returned. I live day to day in horrific pain. 
I am on Morphine and Oxycodone along with many other medications. I have received many types of chemo, intravenously and orally that had me so sick that I thought I wasn’t going to make it.  None of which had worked.

 I have two boys, who will be teenagers soon, who needs their father.  You don’t realize how just seeing their smiling faces is what keeps me going.  I can be in a lot of pain, but just seeing their faces or just knowing they are in the next room, just makes my day.  THEY are motivation for living.  Oh how I would love to be able to coach their football and basketball teams again. throw a football or shoot a basketball, attend their games and be able to sit through the entire games again. My son asked me, “Daddy are you going to die?”  “Are you going to leave us and never come back?” “Don’t leave us daddy” I told him that with God's help daddy is going to do everything that he can to live. And he gave me a big hug and the tears rolled down my face after he left the room. Young boys need their fathers to help them stay out of trouble these days.  They are already asking me questions that kids ask at their age. They have a wonderful mom but they feel more comfortable talking to their daddy about certain issues rather  than their mother.  I treasure those much needed talks.

My pain and limited functions don’t allow me to be the man that I need and want to be.  I wake up in tears, due to the pain all throughout my body, but I won’t let my kids see daddy wiping those tears away.  I have to be strong for them.  They can’t see me when I’m depressed, they can’t see me when I feel I am not going to make it. I don’t want them to see the fact that I need help walking, standing, sitting and going to the restroom.  I WANT TO LIVE.  I DON’T WANT TO DIE!!  I DON’T WANT TO DIE!!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 There is a radioactive treatment in Houston Texas at
the Excel Diagnostic Center called Peptide Receptor Radionuclide Therapy, also known as PRRT. This is the only place in the U.S. that is approved so far to
administer this type of treatment. The radioactive treatment will attach itself to the type of tumors that I have and shrink them considerably. The treatment is $15,000 per treatment and I need 4 treatments within a 6-8 month period. They will do one treatment. I will come home and return in 4-6 weeks for the next treatment and the next $15,000 will be due at that time and so forth.  I don’t have the funds. I can’t get any insurance to cover it.

The Impact

By you giving, you will help me live.  You will help my children get the full function of their father back.  My boys mean so much to me and I mean alot to them. All I talk about are my sons. I want to see them go to High School, go to their prom, get married and I want to see my grandchildren.  By giving you will extend me a few more years in this world.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can pray that I get all of the funds that are needed.  I would also ask that you pray for my family also because while I am going through this so is my family.

story:
World's first E-INK computer monitor

We proudly present the world's first E-INK monitor.

UPDATE:

Dear CBR friends

Thank you very much again for your support!

Pls contact tian (at) szobt.com if you want to order a CBR after the campaign.

Pls also visit our 2nd Indiegogo project: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/rocktheink/x/3419900 and let more people know about it.

We are working on new projects.

Pls. follow our twitter or youtube. We will announce them once finished.

Twitter: EINKODM

Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/einkodm

Best regards

Your EINK ODM team


What is it?

It is the world's first E-INK Ebook Reader and Monitor 2in1 device. We call it CBR. After the campaign ending, we will reveal what CBR stands for to our contributors.

The purpose of this project is to use a regular E-INK ebook reader as a second computer monitor, displaying text or images that are displayed on LCD/TV monitors onto the E-INK ebook reader device. It’s better for the eyes and much more readable for the user.

(All photos are unmodified! High Resolution Photos)

How does CBR work?

As an E-INK ebook reader: just use it like any E-INK ebook reader.

Update (14th Sep. 2013): New UI with the "Monitor" icon:

As an E-INK monitor:

Just connect the CBR to the USB port of your computer.


Advantages

  • CBR is your eye-friendly E-INK companion.
  • It is mobile. Take it with you. Read ebooks everywhere, at home, on the beach…
  • Connect it to your computer. Surf and work on it without getting eye strain.
  • Great for people who don't really need color monitor, such as children, students, programmers, scientists, office workers, etc.
  • Great for working in sunlight. Try to read on a LCD/LED display such as your smart phone in sunlight. You will notice the difference. E-INK panels deliver clear, crisp text and images with no glare.
  • Great for people with eye problems.
  • Built-in light (for the advanced CBR) evenly illuminates the screen to provide the perfect reading experience in all lighting conditions.
  • Holds up to 1,100 books - take your library wherever you go.
  • Built-in Wi-Fi lets you download books in few seconds.
  • Supports comics formats: CBR and CBZ

What is E-INK?

E-INK displays are great for your eyes

The E-INK (also called electronic paper or epaper) screen is easier on the eyes for reading documents and web pages. Its displays are easier to read than backlight displays, because they mimic the appearance of ink on paper. You will not experience eye strain after long time reading.

E-INK enabled displays are easily readable even in direct sunlight because E-INK displays reflect light like ordinary paper.

E-INK enabled displays are green

If we could replace all paper newspapers with eNewspapers tomorrow, it would save 95 million trees which could remove 98 million tons of greenhouse gas each year.

E-INK Displays save 60% energy vs. LCD/LED. There are 6 billion electronic displays in mobile devices, computers and signage worldwide consuming 2,300,000 Megawatt Hours.

CBR Features:

2 in 1 E-INK EBook Reader + E-INK Monitor

1.  As an E-INK ebook reader: Our CBR features all functionalities of an ebook reader like reading ePUB, PDF, TXT, FB2, HTML, etc books, watching images like JPG, BMP, and reading comics.

Just take it with you.

2.  Eye-friendly and easy to use E-INK monitor

Connect it to the USB port of your computer as a second monitor.

CBR Specs

CPU

Rockchip RK2818

RAM

128MB

E-INK Monitor

Yes

Display Type Standard:

E-INK Pearl white, resolution 800*600

Display Type Advanced:

E-INK Pearl white high-definition with front light, resolution 1024*758

Size (diagonal)

6.0"

Gray-scale level

16 Grey level

Wi-Fi

Built-in Wi-Fi 802.11b/g/n

OS supported

Fully tested: Windows XP 32bit, Windows 7 64bit, Android-based tablet PC or smart phone)

Not tested, but should work: raspberry pi, Linux and Mac (any system that support USB network or Wi-Fi)

Product size HxWxT, mm

16.5*1.5*1.0cm

Operating system

Linux

Battery type

Polymer Li-on battery

Battery power

1800mAH

Page Turn

about 10000 pages

Standby Time

20 days

E-BOOK file format

Document Formats: EPUB, PDF,TXT, HTML, FB2, RTF, etc.

Reading Function

PDF reflow, table of contents, screen rotation, searching the file name and content, zoom

Dictionary

English, Spanish, Russian, German, etc.

Image files format

JPG, JPEG, BMP, TIF, PNG

Internal Memory

4GB

Expansion Slots

Micro SD (TF) card up to 32GB

Other Interface

2.0 USB

OSD menu

Multi-language: English, German, Spanish, Russian, Chinese, etc.

Other functions

Comic reader

In Package

USB cable, user manual (PDF), microfiber protection bag, gift box

What have we done so far?

We had already made the prototype of our CBR and its molding in March 2013. A small quantity trial production was implemented in May 2013, it was very successful. Our software and hardware design is complete. What you see on the photos are real working units. 

Photo gallery

(All photos are unmodified! High Resolution Photos)

Browsing the web:

Working on Word:

Working on Excel:

The PCBA (main board):

The case:

The advanced panel (PVI E-INK pearl white high-definition 1024*758 and front light):

The standard panel (PVI E-INK pearl white 800*600 without front light):

Why do we need your help?

We need your support at Indiegogo to help us to fund our first mass production and manufacturing run. That means making thousands of these devices to ship around the world. We also need your help to develop ebook reader monitors with bigger size display such as 9.7inch. You'll be worldwide amongst the first to have one so you can tell your friends and the whole world too.

If you cannot contribute the dollar, but you are willing to help us to make some noise on facebook, twitter, google+ or any other similar websites, we would also be very grateful for your help.

What's Next?

We’re now getting ready to start production of our CBR but we need your help to accomplish that. With the support from Indiegogo we'll be able to start our first manufacturing run and we hope to start shipping them to you in November 2013. 

The product contains an E-INK Ebook reader with a USB cable and a microfiber protection bag in one box.

The products you will get:

The CBRs are available in two display types, E-INK panel with and without light.

1.  The standard device uses a 6inch E-INK pearl white panel without front light, resolution: 800x600.

2.  The advanced device uses a 6inch E-INK pearl white HD panel with front light, resolution: 1024x758. With the front light, you can even use it in the darkness. (The Amazon Kindle Paperwhite uses such a panel with front light)

About us:

We are a small development team specialized in the development of E-INK-based devices such as Ebook readers, price display, educational backpack, etc.

We started working together some years ago on several new concepts with the aim of creating innovative solutions that would make life easier for everyone who used them. We believe in innovation and breakthrough, and that every problem must have a solution.

Contact us at: tian(at)szobt.com

Schedule

The board is ready for manufacturing; the factory is only waiting for the final quantity; that will be available at the end of this campaign, so the production will start immediately after this campaign is over, the 16th of October.

We have organized the whole process to be completed in only 30 days.

We will start to ship out the products at the end of November.

It's time for action now! Scroll back to the top of the page and you will find the perks on the right column. Give us your support today and use the sharing functions of Indiegogo to let everybody know it!

story:
Do you know Kelly McMahon?  Have you benefited from being Kelly's friend?  Do you love Kelly's laugh and enjoy being with her?  Does Kelly laugh at all of your jokes and make you believe that you are hilarious?  Has Kelly ever listened to your problems and given you great advice?  Do you have a good Kelly story (or several)?  Now is your chance to give back to this amazing friend!

Help celebrate Kelly's 40th birthday by pitching in to buy her a new bicycle!

Kelly has been riding the bike pictured below for the past several years.  It's pretty rusty, the seat is ripped, and it's not a road bike.  She rides it to The School of Education, around town, and also trains on it.  Kelly trained on this bike for the last several triathlons and the Ironman race that she recently completed.  Kelly is hardcore (you probably already know this).  While Kelly's motto has been:  If I train on this bike, it's going to be 10x easier on a fancy bike on race day (she borrows a bike for races), wouldn't it be awesome if we collectively got her a kick-ass bike?  A basic new triathlon bike runs around $2000.  The more that we raise, the fancier the bike that Kelly can buy (or she can choose to buy fancy accessories).


When contributing we'd love it if you left a message for Kelly.  The intent is to share this page and messages from friends on Kelly's actual birthday.  You could 1) record a short video, or 2) share a picture, or 3) write a short e-mail wishing Kelly a happy 40th!  Send your wishes to: kellymcmahonbirthday@gmail.com
Help Kelly to celebrate her 40th birthday with an awesome bike!

story:
Brent Lowak of Bulverde, Texas, went to the movie with his friend Jessica Ghawi, an aspiring sports journalist who recently moved from Texas to Colorado. Lowak, 27, and Ghawi, 24, were sitting in the sixth or seventh row when Lowak heard the hiss of gas from the canisters, his mother, Sue Greene, said Sunday.

Lowak and Ghawi ducked when they heard the sound, and Ghawi screamed as a bullet pierced her leg, Greene said.

Lowak — who has been studying to become an EMT — applied pressure to her wound as she screamed. Then she stopped and Lowak realized she had been shot again, and she was soon dead.

"Only then did he leave her," Greene said in an interview at Children's Hospital Colorado, where her son is listed in serious condition. "They were best friends," she said.

Lowak realized he too had been shot and couldn't walk. He crawled away and managed to find his way to a van taking victims to the hospital.

He took a few steps on Sunday, his first since the shooting, but Greene said she doesn't think he will be well enough to attend a memorial for Ghawi.

"He wants so badly to be well enough to be at her memorial service," Greene said.

 

 

Lets raise money to pay his medical bills. He has enough to worry about!

story:
Proposed Product

StomaLife is a proprietary ostomy device that uses an innovative valve system with a pressure relief feature to provide stoma continence and enable control over faecal discharge and gas release. Furthermore, the device uses a novel magnetic retention system to secure the device to the stoma site without the use of adhesives and the associated skin irritation and infection.

 

Current Solutions

Currently, ostomy patients use various bag systems into which body waste is discharged. The bag systems use adhesives to retain the bags in place. Patients wear these bags 24hrs/day. The bag systems have many limitations such as involuntary faecal and gas discharge, involuntary odour release, stoma tissue damage, skin irritation and infection.

 

Market Need

The benefits of StomaLife to ostomy patients are continence 24/7, reduced skin irritation and infection, odour and sound control, leak prevention, waste material flow control and on-demand gas release. StomaLife does away with the need for messy and unsightly bags.  It aims to improve the quality of life of ostomy patients by enabling them to live a near normal healthy active life.

 

Technology/ Innovation employed:

StomaLife is a proprietary valve system that is partially implanted around the stoma.

It consists of three functional components: 

  1. Control component with a unique valve system that provides continence, controlled flow of waste material, and controlled release of gas;
  2. Retention component that provides non-adhesive fixation of the StomaLife device to the stoma site; and
  3. Implantable magnetic component that provides stability to the stoma site and helps avoid stoma complications.

Either during or after the original ostomy operation, the magnetic component is implanted at the stoma site.  The surgically cut stoma (bowel) end is then attached to the StomaLife plug, and the StomaLife plug is fitted to the stoma site and held in place by the magnetic attraction between the implanted magnetic component (implanted underneath the skin) and the metallic Retention component on the surface.  A cushion of air holds the retention device just off the surface of the skin, in order to reduce abrasion and subsequent infection (which is a major problem with existing ostomy solutions).

Once fitted the device is barely noticeable under the patient’s normal clothing.  The innovative valve allows the patient to release gas and faeces as and when required.  To pass faeces, the patient simply attaches a tube to the device and opens the valve and the faeces can be released into a toilet bowl and flushed away as normal. 

 

 

Stage of Development

Conceptual prototyping and proof-of-concept.

 

Intellectual Property  

Reference:    Sabeti (WO 2008/067603)

Approved Patent:     Australia, China, India, Japan, Singapore and USA 

Pending Patent Approval:       Europe, Malaysia, South Korea

 

Use of Funds

The funds obtained will be directed towards pre-clinical (including testing of prototypes) and clinical testing, initiating regulatory process, IP protection and overheads.

story:
October 19, 2014

Breck and I are getting married in a little over 10 weeks. Since we've been living together for a while now, we have most of our household items in order, but we're having a really hard time stretching our shoestring budget to pay for the wedding, so instead of creating a registry at a store and asking for really specific things that we don't really even need, we opted for this instead.

We've gotten a lot of help from friends who have agreed to lend their time, talents, or even decorative items to our cause so that we can have a pretty little wedding with all of our close friends and family present, but there are some expensive loose ends, such as flowers, the dress, a PA system, table linens, a photographer, champagne, cups, silverware, and paper goods. If this website does well, we plan to spend the extra on a small honeymoon - a few days in a cabin at the lake or a weekend at Hot Springs or Branson.

We are not wealthy by any means and do not have expensive tastes, but we are resourceful and creative and we love each other. We want our special day to be a unique and fun representation of who we are as a couple, and we just want to be able to share it with all of you. Feel free to donate as little (even one dollar would add up if enough people did it!) or as much as you would like. We love you all and can't wait to start our lives together with you present to see our first kiss as husband and wife!

story:
A Smart Mouth Guard that Tracks Your Hydration.

 

SMRT Mouth is the world’s first Bluetooth-enabled mouth guard that provides biometric monitoring to athletes of all ages. Embedded sensors in the mouth guard allow parents, coaches, trainers and team physicians to monitor the athlete’s biometric data in real-time.

 

Want to get your SMRT Mouth guard for FREE? Click here.

 

SMRT Press

Click on logos to read

   
 
 
 
 
 

 

Whether playing in the big leagues or for a local high school team, athletes are expected to perform their very best. But how can you or your coach tell when you’ve reached your limit?

 
 

Meant for pint-sized & pro athletes alike, SMRT Mouth does a lot more than just protect your teeth. It tracks your key biometrics.

Tracking hydration, circulation, respiration, and exertion in real-time allows athletes and coaches to know when they need to hydrate, when they can go harder, and when they need to cool off. It can even be worn during non-contact sports to help athletes avoid problems like cramping or dehydration.

 
 

Let's Change The Game

 

The SMRT Move

Prevent Dehydration

 

SMRT Mouth provides peace of mind. According to the National Center for Catastrophic Sports Injury Research, 54 high school football players died from heat stroke since 1995. An estimated 9,000 high school athletes are treated for heat illness annually, particularly during August, according to the Centers for Disease Control. SMRT Mouth provides biometric information that can help mitigate heat-related illness.

Proper hydration is also critical to regulating your body temperature and delivering oxygen, which helps transport nutrients to your muscles. Over 80% of muscle sprains and pulls are attributed to dehydration and overexertion. Without proper hydration, your muscles weaken, cramp and eventually spasm. When your water intake is balanced, you experience gains in performance while reducing fatigue. SMRT Mouth will help you figure out it’s time for a water break.

 

SMRT Sync

Track Biometrics From Mouth guard

 

Other than more designs and decals, there have been few innovations and advances in mouth guards since 1947, when a Los Angeles dentist used transparent acrylic resin to fit the upper and lower teeth. SMRT Mouth utilizes wearable sensors to collect biometric data that is transmitted to mobile devices via Bluetooth.

The app has different sensors that transmit data in different increments. For instance, your heart rates changes by the second, while your hydration level does not. Over time, the app and data will provide each athlete more clarity so they can find their “Zone.” And if parents are running late to the field, they can still track their child’s biometrics remotely.

 

Play SMRT

Real Time Stats At A Glance

 

SMRT Mouth is designed for continuous use during training, practice and competition to provide real-time data that can help athletes optimize performance. The embedded heart rate monitor measures the most important vital statistic an active person can generate: Heart Rate Variability (HRV). An unhealthy heart is like a musician with no soul, beating at a robotic pace with intervals of identical length between each pulse. A healthy heart - like a musician with soul - goes with the flow, with beat intervals of varying length.

 

What Makes It SMRT?

 

SMRT Mouth measures osmolality in biofluid, which allows the sensor nodes to measure hydration. Tracking pulse for circulation and using an accelerometer for exertion, SMRT Mouth sends information to mobile devices. SMRT Mouth has a microcontroller with integrated BLE for wireless communications and can support a plurality of sensors that provide a small, electrical footprint. The BLE protocol offers up to 80% energy savings over classic Bluetooth.

 

SMRT Specs & Highlights

 
 
  • Bluetooth enabled
  • SMRT vibration feedback
  • Track performance over time with mobile app
  • Remote monitoring through use of the mobile app
  • Case charges SMRT Mouth
  • Case cleans SMRT Mouth
  • Fully-charged SMRT Mouth is targeted to last 4 hours in continuous use
 

Perks For You

 
 

Timeline

 

The SMRT Mouth Team

 

Michael Robinson

President

Michael is a proven winner, shining at Penn State as the 2005 Big Ten Offensive Player of the Year and helping the Seattle Seahawks win Super Bowl XLVIII. But the former Pro Bowl fullback is now dedicated to beating dehydration, which slows, derails and even kills athletes.

Dana Hawes

Chief Executive Officer

A school principal, Dana was inspired to create SMRT Mouth after having to inform parents a few years ago that their child had suffered dehydration during a practice. He’s had a hand in every key step of getting SMRT Mouth to where it is today.

 

Amish Patel

Chief Financial Officer

The president of a computer services company founded in 1979, Amish is a master of econometrics - possessing a command of numbers and analytics. He is, in short, a master of detail.

David Janney

Chief Information Officer

David is a nuclear & mechanical engineer and physicist turned software developer - rich with a history of interfacing engineering and research with coding. He’s working to develop the SMRT Mouth app and oversees the analytics and all IT matters for the company.

 

SMRT Mouth Advisors

 

Scott Amyx

Smart Wearable Advisor

Scott is the CEO of Amyx+McKinsey, a wearables & IoT strategy + execution agency specializing in wearables & IoT strategy and implementation. As a thought leader in wearables and IoT, Scott explores the intersection of enterprise implications and consumer decisions of adopting wearables and IoT technologies. Scott was voted as Top 25 Global Speakers by Speaking.com.

Ken Murray

Legal & Engineering Advisor

Leveraging a multi-faceted career in engineering, Ken began his legal career as principal patent analyst for the University of California, Davis. He founded Murray Tech Law, just a few blocks from the school. Over the past 14 years, Ken has created an innovative law and technology intellectual property practice.

 

Michael Hong

President of Tandem & Industrial Design Advisor

Michael, who holds a masters degree in Industrial Design from Purdue University, has over 15 years of product design experience with clients such as Acer, Honda, Haier and Vizio. Before founding Tandem, Michael was the lead designer for Gateway Computers, the third-largest computer manufacturer in the United States.

 

The SMRT Mouth Story

Since 1995, 54 high school football players have died from heat stroke. In addition, an estimated 9,000 high school athletes are treated for heat illness each year, according to the Centers for Disease Control.

That’s why Dana Hawes started SMRT Mouth.

“Heat related deaths and illnesses are 100 percent avoidable and preventable,” Hawes said. "Until now, an athlete’s hydration level has been guesswork."

SMRT Mouth is a rechargeable device that features sensors and algorithms that provide real-time feedback on vitals and performance. Tracking speed, velocity and acceleration are just the beginning; SMRT Mouth will also capture previously inaccessible measurements like hydration and exertion levels.

In two years, we’ve made significant strides with SMRT Mouth. But now we need your help to bring SMRT Mouth to market and make it available to millions of athletes who are practicing and competing without a tool that can help protect and empower them.

Your contributions will reinforce the viability of the product, and catapult the research and development of the first product so it’s available in August 2016.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

What comes with each SMRT Mouth?

SMRT Mouth guard, directions and a carrying case, which also serves as the charger and cleaner. Separately, information on how users can download the app is included. The app provides access to the data and ways to provide their information to other users.

Is SMRT Mouth a medical device?

No, SMRT Mouth is not a medical device, and SMRT Mouth does not make any medical claims. SMRT Mouth can provide biometric data that can be beneficial toward optimizing an athlete’s training and performance.

Is there any danger in putting SMRT Mouth – with the sensors – in your mouth?

SMRT Mouth is founded on research and technology that has already proven to be both viable and safe in clinical trials in other industries and unrelated applications. Testing of SMRT Mouth will be conducted by multiple, independent experts in thermoregulation and hydration, including the Korey Stringer Institute.

How long does a fully charged SMRT Mouth last?

Four hours of continuous use.

Does a device need to be next to SMRT Mouth to receive an alert?

SMRT Mouth will allow transmission of data to mobile devices at extended ranges. SMRT Mouth will also vibrate when the pre-set threshold levels for each metric are reached, alerting the wearer and also provide a notification to coaches, staff or parents tracking the user’s information.

Is SMRT Mouth custom fit or does one size fit all?

There will be a youth and adult size. But both can be custom fit, utilizing a boil and bite feature.

Is the SMRT Mouth app available on iOS and Android?

The app will be available on Android, iOS and Microsoft Mobile and free for a single user at least 18 years of age. Users under 18 can access the data and also add a parent or guardian for free. Anyone else who wants access to a user’s data – such as a coach or trainer – must pay a yet to be determined cost.

Will there be custom design features, such as different colors and the ability to add a logo?

The first generation of SMRT Mouth won’t incorporate customization, other than our first seven colors: yellow, blue, orange, green, red, platinum and purple. However, we are on custom design capabilities for individuals and entities in future generations!

 

SMRT Mouth, SMRT, the SMRT Mouth Logo and design of the mouth guard, case and app are licensed Trademarks of SMRT Mouth, LLC.
story_txt:
A Smart Mouth Guard that Tracks Your Hydration. SMRT Mouth is the world’s first Bluetooth-enabled mouth guard that provides biometric monitoring to athletes of all ages. Embedded sensors in the mouth guard allow parents, coaches, trainers and team physicians to monitor the athlete’s biometric data in real-time. Want to get your SMRT Mouth guard for FREE? Click here. 
SMRT Press
Click on logos to read

      
 
   
 
   

 
  Whether playing in the big leagues or for a local high school team, athletes are expected to perform their very best. But how can you or your coach tell when you’ve reached your limit?  
Meant for pint-sized & pro athletes alike, SMRT Mouth does a lot more than just protect your teeth. It tracks your key biometrics.

Tracking hydration, circulation, respiration, and exertion in real-time allows athletes and coaches to know when they need to hydrate, when they can go harder, and when they need to cool off. It can even be worn during non-contact sports to help athletes avoid problems like cramping or dehydration.
  Let's Change The Game 
The SMRT Move
Prevent Dehydration
 
SMRT Mouth provides peace of mind. According to the National Center for Catastrophic Sports Injury Research, 54 high school football players died from heat stroke since 1995. An estimated 9,000 high school athletes are treated for heat illness annually, particularly during August, according to the Centers for Disease Control. SMRT Mouth provides biometric information that can help mitigate heat-related illness.
Proper hydration is also critical to regulating your body temperature and delivering oxygen, which helps transport nutrients to your muscles. Over 80% of muscle sprains and pulls are attributed to dehydration and overexertion. Without proper hydration, your muscles weaken, cramp and eventually spasm. When your water intake is balanced, you experience gains in performance while reducing fatigue. SMRT Mouth will help you figure out it’s time for a water break.
 
SMRT Sync
Track Biometrics From Mouth guard
 
Other than more designs and decals, there have been few innovations and advances in mouth guards since 1947, when a Los Angeles dentist used transparent acrylic resin to fit the upper and lower teeth. SMRT Mouth utilizes wearable sensors to collect biometric data that is transmitted to mobile devices via Bluetooth.
The app has different sensors that transmit data in different increments. For instance, your heart rates changes by the second, while your hydration level does not. Over time, the app and data will provide each athlete more clarity so they can find their “Zone.” And if parents are running late to the field, they can still track their child’s biometrics remotely.

story:
• Share and let us know in the comment section to have a free cleaning brush included in the package ;)

 

 

 

 

 

 

Fittbo is also available in black and you will get to choose the color before shipping!

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • The dimensions are 9.25inch x 9.25inch x 1.59 inch - 23.5cm x 23.5cm x 4.5cm, the best size for it to be carried comfortably while still having enough food for the day!
  • It weighs less than 500 grams
  • The materials used are all premium and food safe! Made From the Highest Quality 100% Food Grade compliant, BPA Free Plastic   

 

 

What's included in the package:

 

 

As it's clear, a lot of effort has been put into designing this product. This design, combining wood with white materials has been inspired by Scandinavian products that are all over Pinterest. It has unique features smartly incorporated that no other lunchbox out there has.  Every detail is placed with a clear reason and nothing is random.

 

 

 

I’m Alan Alexandru, young designer, I've worked for some companies in the past, gaining a considerable amount of experience and understanding how a product is designed and implemented from the drawing board to the finished product. I finally got the courage to take this big step, leaving a comfy job to dedicate all my time creating products that would make life better. On this journey, i'm not alone. My friend Olivia is in charge of the marketing, keeps us organized, and makes sure everything gets done when it should.

As it's clear, a lot of effort has been put into designing this product. This design, combining wood with white materials has been inspired by Scandinavian products that are all over Pinterest. It has unique features smartly incorporated that no other lunchbox out there has. Every detail is placed with a clear reason and nothing is random. Our first e-mails asking producers how to make this lunchbox date back to the summer of 2015!

This is our take on the lunchbox, and we really hope you’ll like it! Our goal is to create a food box that would be easy to carry and use, with an impeccable design.
story_txt:
Share and let us know in the comment section to have a free cleaning brush included in the package ;)      Food - influences how we feel, how we look, how healthy we become. The easiest way to have a healthy lifestyle and stay fit is to eat properly! 
Having the right food within your reach makes a huge and telling difference on your body over a long period of time. Having a healthy, balanced meal each day will make us feel better, and also keep the weight under control!
We created Fittbo to be the ultimate food box as it is:

easy to use
easy to clean
100% leakproof
microwave safe food tray
designed to fit the contemporary, always on the go lifestyle
thermo-insulated to keep the food fresh throughout the day
compartmented to hold everything you need to make a balanced diet in one place.  

  Fittbo is also available in black and you will get to choose the color before shipping!  
 


The main section lids are fitted with a rubber gasket for each compartment. The food tray also has a gasket that holds the entire body and exterior shell together as one piece. Even in the unlikely case you pack in a hurry and don’t close the lids correctly, the unibody designed shell won’t allow any leaking.
 

  
Fittbo is compartmented based on the ideal dinner plate for an adult.
For the main course, you have 1/2 of the space for vegetables 1/4 for low GI carbohydrates and 1/4 for lean protein.
To have enough fuel for the day, there are two small compartments for healthy snacks! These are a really important part of every diet. They help keep the appetite under control so you won't go about eating the first thing that comes your way!
  We thought a lot about how to create the compartments. After thorough research, we had to design it based on the optimum portions of nutrients. This makes it easy to keep a track of the optimum ratios of food, and transporting the different types of food separately keeps them fresh for longer.   
 
The dimensions are 9.25inch x 9.25inch x 1.59 inch - 23.5cm x 23.5cm x 4.5cm, the best size for it to be carried comfortably while still having enough food for the day!
It weighs less than 500 grams
The materials used are all premium and food safe! Made From the Highest Quality 100% Food Grade compliant, BPA Free Plastic   
  What's included in the package:   
 
 


 
We made A LOT of design prototypes. We basically wanted the box to be simple, easy to use and have a smart, clean design you'd be proud to take anywhere. Every feature we thought of had to be incorporated into the design: the insulation, the cutlery, the optimum ratio and division between compartments.As it's clear, a lot of effort has been put into designing this product. This design, combining wood with white materials has been inspired by Scandinavian products that are all over Pinterest. It has unique features smartly incorporated that no other lunchbox out there has.  Every detail is placed with a clear reason and nothing is random.    
 I’m Alan Alexandru, young designer, I've worked for some companies in the past, gaining a considerable amount of experience and understanding how a product is designed and implemented from the drawing board to the finished product. I finally got the courage to take this big step, leaving a comfy job to dedicate all my time creating products that would make life better. On this journey, i'm not alone. My friend Olivia is in charge of the marketing, keeps us organized, and makes sure everything gets done when it should.As it's clear, a lot of effort has been put into designing this product. This design, combining wood with white materials has been inspired by Scandinavian products that are all over Pinterest. It has unique features smartly incorporated that no other lunchbox out there has. Every detail is placed with a clear reason and nothing is random. Our first e-mails asking producers how to make this lunchbox date back to the summer of 2015!This is our take on the lunchbox, and we really hope you’ll like it! Our goal is to create a food box that would be easy to carry and use, with an impeccable design.

story:
ROGER'S STORY

First of all, I am sure that you are already under the charm of the wonderful dog that is Cotie. Do not worry, my friend Roger, his master, felt the same the first time he saw the huge puppy about to become his best companion. That day, Roger was out to get some stuff for his motorcycle and... he went back home with Cotie.

I met Roger online three years ago and despite the distance between us, we got to know each other and became friends. But as time went by, my path took another direction and we lost contact.

But last fall, I got in contact with him again, only to find out that in April 2011, his motorcycle got hit by a car while he was at a STOP sign and ended up seriously injured. The hit and run driver fled the scene, leaving him there on the edge of the road. Because the police got there half an hour after the fact, they were not able to find the culprit.

Since the accident, Roger has been fighting every day. Fighting against the feeling of angst toward the person who did this to him. Fighting to keep his foot attached to the rest of his body. Fighting against the bone infection that caused the surgeon to remove part of his tibia and heel. Fighting against the bank that wants to foreclose against his house because he can no longer afford its mortgage... But it is hard to fight when you undergo the physical pain and the fear to lose the roof above your head because you haven't been able to work for so many months. Hope disappears as bills pile up.

THE IMPACT

The campaign Goal is not random : $ 2865 will pay 3 months of mortgage. 3 months is the time Roger needs to heal properly, to start physical therapy in good condition, without the fear of losing his home. 4 to 9 % will go the IndieGogo website  for the great opportunity they give us to start this fundraising campain.
The rest of the money will help Roger to live and add up some extra comfort to his every day life. A man like him, reliable, gentle and strong, deserves to live and not only survive as he has been doing for almost 10 months now.
If you want to give him some air to breathe and that way accelerate his healing process (your body cannot heal fast when your mind is full of worries and fears), then give something. Five dollars, ten or more, it's up to you, but please, give only what you will not miss later and, most of all, give heartfully.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We all know someone, friend, relative or even ourselves, who had to face a traffic accident and suffer its physical and emotional consequences. 23 years ago, my big brother, he was 18 at that time, got hit by a car, on a crossway. More than 20 years later, he still carries the after-effects, dealing daily with epilepsy due to brain damages. Roger's situation reminds me a lot about my brother's case. Both had been victims of criminal negligence. Both had to face the pain in their flesh and bones. The difference is that I was a 12 year old girl when my brother got injured. I am a grown up now and I can help. And you can help too.

If Roger's situation found an echo in you, please spread the word, tell your acquaintances and relatives about it and by then, my friend will get not only one companion but several of them who will make true this quote by the King Solomon : "A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity." (Proverbs 17/17)

story:
Summary:

 

            My name is Daniel and I currently live in Cypress California. I am disabled with Cervical Spinal Stenosis secondary to acute Degenerative disc disease. I have been living in an ‘Extended Stay Motel’ for the past ten years. Honestly, it is all I can really afford. When I moved here I planned on staying six months. Getting the surgery I needed and then getting back to work. Four years passed just getting approved for Medicare and Social Security.

In that four years my disease progressed, became much worse. By the time I had insurance, the afore mentioned four years, my neck was in shambles. There was permanent damage to several nerve roots, and the beginnings of spinal stenosis. The nerve root damage has resulted in me having limited feeling and use of my left arm and hand.

The spinal stenosis has caused ‘left foot drop’ and many other medical problems and it only gets worse. I do not have the financial resources to get the pricy surgery that might help. I am not bitter, I just want to be safe and work at my blog whenever I can. I am not here to ask for assistance for a surgery, nothing that frivolous. I am asking for your assistance so that I can move.

As I said, I have been staying at this motel for the past ten years. However, recent developments have made me staying here not a viable option. First, there is the brown water. I have written about it extensively @ The Other Shoe. As well, there are three videos of this brackish water @ YouTube. I have talked and complained to the management here, yet the problem persists.

This property management company, that is, there is a new one coming… hang on I am getting ahead. This brings me to the second part, the company that has owned this building all the time I have been here is selling this building. The new company is taking over at the end of July. From what everyone here is being told? The new company is going to convert this building to all senior living. Normally this would be a God send. Why it is not, is simple.

We are being told that everyone in the building will be evicted, so that they can convert the whole building at once… and “get a better class of people, living here…” That, I was told, by a source close to the process. This causes me grave concerns and it was the ‘Straw That Broke the Camel’s Back’ for me. I wanted to try to raise the money to move, again, since my first attempt did not succeed. Please, don’t get me wrong, everyone that gave to the original Daniel’s Moving Assistance Fund were angels indeed. I am touched by their help and moved by their generosity.

However, it takes more than I raised to move me. It has been a year, since, the last campaign. A year fraught with difficulty and growing pain, and a realization that soon I might not be able or capable to do what I do now. So, it is with a heavy heart and deep regret that I come back to Indiegogo and you to ask one more time. I come here to ask for your assistance, your help, your understanding and compassion.

It is only with your assistance that I can hope to escape. Escape a building with foul water, and a second story room with no elevator to get my power chair out alone.

Now, I would like to outline the expenses the best that I can. I have shopped for prices for this August and September. I have projected the best that I can.

 

What I Need: (Please)

  • Truck Rental – Penske Truck Rentals = $56.00 per day + $0.79 per mile plus refilling the gas tank.  = $100.00
  • Truck      Rental Deposit (Insurance as I do not currently own a car nor do I have      car insurance)  I was quoted $200 -      $250 depending on my DMV record. I have NO accidents EVER so I am hoping      for  =   $200.00
  • Labor to help me move… this gets      scary… From what I understand I can hire men @ the Home Depot (right      across the street) for $50.00 - $80.00 per day. I will need help packing      and throwing much stuff away. I would guess two people for two days would      be enough. @ ~ $60.00 (per) X 2 (people) X 2 (days) =   $240.00
  • Next and Last. I will need      assistance with the initial rental and deposit. Looking on line at several      different sites. To rent a single (bachelor) here in Orange County will      cost between $1,000.00 and $1,200.00 a month in rent. I have not rented an      apartment for nearly ten years… I am sure they will want; First, Last and      a Deposit equal to at least one month’s rent.  That is the killer, and one I hope to      bring DOWN.  =   $3,000.00 - $3,600.00

.

That is all I can, in good conscience, ask for assistance. Any other expenses I will just handle the best that I can when and if they land in my lap. However, ALL the sites that I can use (to raise money) ALL charge a percent of what you raise (7%-10%), and there is a ‘Bank Transfer Fee’ (last time it was $150.00).

.

Total Cost   =     $3,000.00                                    $3,600.00                   

                           $180.00 (6% fee)                         $216.00

                            $150.00 (Bank Fee)                     $150.00

                         $3,330.00                                     $3,966.00

 

Therefore, Best Case = $3,330.00 (with luck on my side and the wind at my back)

                  Worst Case = $3,966.00 (With it being Southern California and no ‘luck’)

 

I thought long and hard on this and I do not want a repeat of my last efforts (I did not consider all possible angles and problems… like getting the power chair out of my house) I will err on the side of caution and round this out @ $5,000.00 = $4,500.00 After Indiegogo Fees and Bank Fees [Updated 714/13 dlh] Just to be safe, just to be sure and not end up within striking distance and then fall.

.

Impact:

 

      Let me be blunt, I will live longer and healthier with your help.  Moving will afford me the opportunity to find a home that is safe. This building is only safe, as it is now and that is not much, because of the efforts of myself and other residents that stood up to the drug dealers and prostitutes they used to rent to here. I took pictures and made videos of drug transactions and then shared them with the police and property management company. Only with our information and support did we rid most of the ‘Bad Elements’ from this building. However, there are many residents that still I would not walk around this building at night alone.

Freedom (guess that should have come first…) I can move to a building with elevators to get myself and my power chair out of the building when I want! Or, to a first floor room/apartment in a safer building with clean fresh water. That would give me a freedom I have not had in over eight years. Yes, it has been eight years since I was able to walk out of this building with my own two feet, and get past the front desk. My condition has worsened to the extent I cannot walk more than ¼ a block and one flight of stairs. My roommate/Caregiver helps me with everything else.

IF I want to get out, just for fresh air or to see a movie (I have not done that in eight years, either) I need assistance. If I were to have your assistance I would be able to get in and out when I want! That is what I call Freedom. That is what your help will give me; safety and freedom.

Last, Ii know that you noticed... you are very smart, that the total is $4,000.00 and I asked for $5,000.00. The remaining monies will go to; GLASSES that I have not had in SIX YEARS, some little trift store furniture... I currently only own a bed and frame, and some decorations for the new home... to make it more like a HOME. Maybe go out to dinner and see a movie in a theater, and money to SAVE for (I know it is coming) a rainy day. I hope you understand and approve. I just want a little wiggle room. ;)

 

 Other Ways YOU Can Help:

 

Not everyone that wants to give can afford to give, I understand that… believe me I do!  However, there are MANY other ways you can help, here are a few:

 

  • ‘Share’ and ‘Like’ my campaign and posts (at Facebook and The Other Shoe) With YOUR Facebook friends. Just press ‘Share’ right by the ‘Like’ button. This does TWO things. It shows your Facebook friends that you care. Second, it shows them that you approve of my campaign. SO many people want to help, but hesitate because they do not know the person (me) and do not know if they can be trusted. Your support, this way, is a badge of honor to me. It shows that I can be trusted to do with the money what I claim. I will and I will post proof , like I did with my Power Chair Campaign.
  • Talk about the campaign to; friends, family, fellow church members and members of professional or hobby based groups. Just like the ‘Like’s and ‘Share’s above, talking about the campaign tells your friends and family that you approve and that you can or do give, too. Post the URL to the campaign on Community Bulletin Boards and even ask for a mention in the weekly newsletter @ church or @ work. Honestly, I would prefer $5.00 from 1,000 people… but I am told that is a ‘pipe dream’.
  • Offer goods or services as ‘Donations’ for me to give to people who can donate money. I am going to try to find ways that I can give items as rewards for contributions. Last time I gave away ‘Shout-Outs’ on my blog(s) and on Facebook. You make a donation, of a certain amount at a certain time, and I mention your name and “Thank you!’ in the public domain for everyone to see. This was very popular last time.
  • Offer your time or assistance with me managing the campaign. Offer to share a recipe @ The Other Shoe or an entertaining article. One of the most difficult tasks for me is keeping up the content and posting along with everything else I do. My pain gets SO extreme… and I leave and don’t post for a day or two. During that time my traffic falls, and so do the contributions. ANY assistance with content or posting would be of great assistance to me.

 .

That is all I can think of at this time. However, if I think of anything else I will share it just as soon as I can. Right now I am in extreme pain… I about finished so I am going to push through to the end. I have one more thing to say, then I will post this and pray.

 

Conclusion:

 .

This is not the timing that I wanted, had planned or even desire. I know families are going on vacations. However, the timing was taken out of my hands. From what I am told I have, at the most, 60 days before I am forced out. Today is July 10th, 2013. I have made the campaign for 45 days, because I need the money by the end of September to avoid… the worst possible scenario. If you cannot give, now. Let me know and I will be happy to set up a way for you to contribute at a later time.

.

Last. “Thank YOU!”  Let’s count how many times I say this over the next 45 days. I am guessing close to a thousand. It has taken me three days to write this… correct it… and make sure it is something I want in the public eye. Today is the day… Please. Please help me to move to a safe building with fresh clean water. A place where I can take out my power chair any time that I want without help… That would mean the world to me. And, again, “Thank YOU!”

Summary:
 
            My name is Daniel and I currently live in Cypress California. I am disabled with Cervical Spinal Stenosis secondary to acute Degenerative disc disease. I have been living in an ‘Extended Stay Motel’ for the past ten years. Honestly, it is all I can really afford. When I moved here I planned on staying six months. Getting the surgery I needed and then getting back to work. Four years passed just getting approved for Medicare and Social Security.
In that four years my disease progressed, became much worse. By the time I had insurance, the afore mentioned four years, my neck was in shambles. There was permanent damage to several nerve roots, and the beginnings of spinal stenosis. The nerve root damage has resulted in me having limited feeling and use of my left arm and hand.
The spinal stenosis has caused ‘left foot drop’ and many other medical problems and it only gets worse. I do not have the financial resources to get the pricy surgery that might help. I am not bitter, I just want to be safe and work at my blog whenever I can. I am not here to ask for assistance for a surgery, nothing that frivolous. I am asking for your assistance so that I can move.
As I said, I have been staying at this motel for the past ten years. However, recent developments have made me staying here not a viable option. First, there is the brown water. I have written about it extensively @ The Other Shoe. As well, there are three videos of this brackish water @ YouTube. I have talked and complained to the management here, yet the problem persists.
This property management company, that is, there is a new one coming… hang on I am getting ahead. This brings me to the second part, the company that has owned this building all the time I have been here is selling this building. The new company is taking over at the end of July. From what everyone here is being told? The new company is going to convert this building to all senior living. Normally this would be a God send. Why it is not, is simple.
We are being told that everyone in the building will be evicted, so that they can convert the whole building at once… and “get a better class of people, living here…” That, I was told, by a source close to the process. This causes me grave concerns and it was the ‘Straw That Broke the Camel’s Back’ for me. I wanted to try to raise the money to move, again, since my first attempt did not succeed. Please, don’t get me wrong, everyone that gave to the original Daniel’s Moving Assistance Fund were angels indeed. I am touched by their help and moved by their generosity.
However, it takes more than I raised to move me. It has been a year, since, the last campaign. A year fraught with difficulty and growing pain, and a realization that soon I might not be able or capable to do what I do now. So, it is with a heavy heart and deep regret that I come back to Indiegogo and you to ask one more time. I come here to ask for your assistance, your help, your understanding and compassion.
It is only with your assistance that I can hope to escape. Escape a building with foul water, and a second story room with no elevator to get my power chair out alone.
Now, I would like to outline the expenses the best that I can. I have shopped for prices for this August and September. I have projected the best that I can.
 

What I Need: (Please)

Truck Rental – Penske Truck Rentals = $56.00 per day + $0.79 per mile plus refilling the gas tank.  = $100.00



Truck      Rental Deposit (Insurance as I do not currently own a car nor do I have      car insurance)  I was quoted $200 -      $250 depending on my DMV record. I have NO accidents EVER so I am hoping      for  =   $200.00 

Labor to help me move… this gets      scary… From what I understand I can hire men @ the Home Depot (right      across the street) for $50.00 - $80.00 per day. I will need help packing      and throwing much stuff away. I would guess two people for two days would      be enough. @ ~ $60.00 (per) X 2 (people) X 2 (days) =   $240.00

Next and Last. I will need      assistance with the initial rental and deposit. Looking on line at several      different sites. To rent a single (bachelor) here in Orange County will      cost between $1,000.00 and $1,200.00 a month in rent. I have not rented an      apartment for nearly ten years… I am sure they will want; First, Last and      a Deposit equal to at least one month’s rent.  That is the killer, and one I hope to      bring DOWN.  =   $3,000.00 - $3,600.00


.
That is all I can, in good conscience, ask for assistance. Any other expenses I will just handle the best that I can when and if they land in my lap. However, ALL the sites that I can use (to raise money) ALL charge a percent of what you raise (7%-10%), and there is a ‘Bank Transfer Fee’ (last time it was $150.00).
.
Total Cost   =     $3,000.00                                    $3,600.00                   
                           $180.00 (6% fee)                         $216.00
                            $150.00 (Bank Fee)                     $150.00
                         $3,330.00                                     $3,966.00
 
Therefore, Best Case = $3,330.00 (with luck on my side and the wind at my back)
                  Worst Case = $3,966.00 (With it being Southern California and no ‘luck’)
 
I thought long and hard on this and I do not want a repeat of my last efforts (I did not consider all possible angles and problems… like getting the power chair out of my house) I will err on the side of caution and round this out @ $5,000.00 = $4,500.00 After Indiegogo Fees and Bank Fees [Updated 714/13 dlh] Just to be safe, just to be sure and not end up within striking distance and then fall.
.

story:
Sometimes you meet very special people who are passionate about their calling in life.  Spencer and Marygen Cailing are such people.  While they faithfully serve the indigent and youth in the Philippines, they have done so cheerfully and with little outside assistance to make things work. 

For the last three months, they have undergone unbelievable loss and hardship.  Three months ago, Spencer's father suddenly passed away unexpectedly.  If that wasn't enough, last month Spencer, himself,  had to undergo emergency surgery and was just discharged two weeks ago.  Finally, as Marygen was sweeping the church last week, she was bitten by a poisonous snake!

At this very moment, Marygen lies in a hospital bed fighting for her life.  The hospital is preparing her for multiple blood transfusions but will not do so until the finances are there to pay for them  first.  In addition to that, they will not allow Marygen to be discharged until the entire hospital bill is paid.

Any amount that you can give, no matter how large or small, will be graciously appreciated.  100% of the proceeds received will go directly to the payment of these medical expenses and subsequent care. 

Thank you for your donations and your continued prayers.

story:
My Mom never really competed much. Sure, she came to all of my events, gave me her full support and guidance as I chased my Olympic dreams...And then at 55 years old, she decided to put on her big girl pants and get on the mat! 

Most people don't believe me when I tell them, but she had never taken 1st place in an event before...any athletic event before...and hadn't even competed for over 20+ years...

...but I guess you never really know when it's YOUR time, if you don't put yourself out there to find out...

Then, just after turning 61, she became the first USA Taekwondo Poomsae Athlete to Win the World Freaking Championships! 

...I always told her she was a late bloomer ;) 


And this year she's made the team again! 

She's attempting to be the first and only US athlete to defend their World Poomsae Title. 

  • The good news, she's been training even harder since she won World's last December - she's won the US Open, and the US Nationals again.
  • The bad news...Worlds is in Bali, Indonesia this year...and that's like, really far from what I'm told. 

The best news? She's been training hard all year - she's an avid CrossFitter - and Whole Life Challenge participant! 


And she's going to need all of Mrs T's Troopers to #repeat.


What We Need & What You Get

  • As her 'Sonager', I've crunched the numbers and all the deets of her trip. 
  • We're looking for 'Mrs T's Troopers' to raise $3238.88 to fund her plane fare, hotel, and food for the week long trip to Bali, Indonesia for the World Taekwondo Poomsae Championships. 
  • We have awesome prizes & awards for every level of contribution!
  • Best of all, as one of Mrs T's Troopers, you get to 


Your Impact

For those of us who have met my Mom, you'll know that she lives what by what she says - Just Keep Kicking! 

I know she would never say it aloud, but so much of her journey is to show everyone that you always have more ahead than behind...that only you can limit yourself...and that your Full Effort is the real accomplishment we look for. 

I know it's true, because that's what she taught me as an athlete and as a person. 

And that's why I'm doing this. Because I believe in her. 

I'm hoping you all believe in her to keep on kicking, too!


Here's How YOU Can Help!

Of course, we know that every ounce of support is incredibly valuable, and we have awards & prizes for every level of donation...because we cannot do this without YOU. 

But, if you're unable to donate, you can still have her back by spreading the good word about my Mom's upcoming journey!

Heck, maybe drop her a fb message and say 'you can do it'. 

We all know winning the second time is harder than the first, because of that big target on your back...she's going to need all of our support! 

-And Never Stop Kicking!

story:
Hello All,

I am trying to raise money for my mom, Bev, who suffered severe complications after a routine craniotomy.  Why anyone would call a craniotomy routine is beyond me!  The craniotomy removed a brain tumor from her left frontal lobe that was discovered in June  after she tripped and fell, hit her head and was given a cat scan to ensure that she did not have a concussion.

Before her surgery, Bev lived alone and was very Bev: lively, compassionate, and mobile. Currently, she is suffering from short term memory loss, confusion, inability to walk or stand, and is unable to care for herself in any way.

To make matters worse, like many people, she did not have long term care insurance or significant savings.  We, my sister Perryn, myself, and Henry are committed to keeping her safe, healthy, and as comfortable as possible.  Because we do not know how long her recovery will take, nor how much recovery will be achieved, we are looking at a very uncertain and extremely expensive financial situation.

This campaign would cover a year's worth of in-home care, 24 hours a day.  We do not know what the future holds, but are so hopeful that she can be well cared for and be in her apartment for as long as possible.

Please feel free to contribute any amount, even small amounts add up and will be gratefully received.  It takes a village! 

Thank you!

Max Miller and Family
