story:
My name is Candice Taylor. I am 37 years old, a mother of two small children ages 3 and 5. I have been diagnosed with PBC a rare auto immune liver disease. I have been struggling with this for over 10 years but only diagnosed 3 years ago after the birth of my daughter. I have since become so ill that I cannot work anymore. The chronic fatigue, restless leg syndrome, sjorgens, Reynards, chronic pain, memory loss, weakness, weigh gain, neuropathy, and carpal tunnel among many other symptoms has made it impossible for me to work.  I have to nap several times a day just to function, and take care of my two children.  I am currently on assistance for disability, while I wait for CPP Disability.  However they have taken over a year and a half and I still have no answers from them.  I have several doctors, specialists, chiropractors that have written in to verify that I am unable to function in a workplace environment. 

My husband works full time, however his wages don't even cover half the household bills let alone to clothe and feed our children.  We have relied heavily on my grandparents to support us through this terrible time, however that has to come to an end.  We are also relying on the food bank to feed us, however for myself with a special diet cannot eat pasta, breads, rice, processed foods.  I have been however in order to eat, and am feeling worse by the day.  My husband has benefits through his low paying job in order to pay for all of my medical prescriptions.  However we are on the brink of losing our home and I can't even afford to pay for my children to go to school.

I am hoping that some caring individuals like you can help me for the next few months while I wait for CPP Disability to help my family out.  I have exhausted all other efforts in order to save our family home and do not know what else to do.  I have fallen behind on bills and am soon to be cut off of tv, phone, internet, heat, electricity and water.  My grandparents are in their 80s and I can't keep relying on them to help me with finances and to help take care of my kids while I nap.  The stress on them as well as myself is putting all of our health in jeopardy. 

I have nothing to offer in return except my sincere gratitude and the knowledge you are saving a family.  I am hoping to also take a small trip to see my dad and aunt and uncle in Alberta this summer and my best friend.  My aunt and uncle and dad have offered to help with this trip financially but they cannot cover the entire cost of the trip.  They have only met my children once for a family funeral 2 years ago locally but have been unable to make a trip here.  My best friend and I haven't seen each other in 6 years and we have never met each others children at all.  I hope to see her and family before I become too sick to even travel.  As it is I cannot drive for very long due to the carpal tunnel and neuropathy.  This is the first year my husband has holidays. 

Thank you in advance for hearing my story, please feel free to look up my devastating disease online and even though I won't be able to have a transplant until I am in liver failure, there is no real treatment for all the symptoms of this terrible and debilitating disease.
story_txt:
My name is Candice Taylor. I am 37 years old, a mother of two small children ages 3 and 5. I have been diagnosed with PBC a rare auto immune liver disease. I have been struggling with this for over 10 years but only diagnosed 3 years ago after the birth of my daughter. I have since become so ill that I cannot work anymore. The chronic fatigue, restless leg syndrome, sjorgens, Reynards, chronic pain, memory loss, weakness, weigh gain, neuropathy, and carpal tunnel among many other symptoms has made it impossible for me to work.  I have to nap several times a day just to function, and take care of my two children.  I am currently on assistance for disability, while I wait for CPP Disability.  However they have taken over a year and a half and I still have no answers from them.  I have several doctors, specialists, chiropractors that have written in to verify that I am unable to function in a workplace environment.  
My husband works full time, however his wages don't even cover half the household bills let alone to clothe and feed our children.  We have relied heavily on my grandparents to support us through this terrible time, however that has to come to an end.  We are also relying on the food bank to feed us, however for myself with a special diet cannot eat pasta, breads, rice, processed foods.  I have been however in order to eat, and am feeling worse by the day.  My husband has benefits through his low paying job in order to pay for all of my medical prescriptions.  However we are on the brink of losing our home and I can't even afford to pay for my children to go to school.
I am hoping that some caring individuals like you can help me for the next few months while I wait for CPP Disability to help my family out.  I have exhausted all other efforts in order to save our family home and do not know what else to do.  I have fallen behind on bills and am soon to be cut off of tv, phone, internet, heat, electricity and water.  My grandparents are in their 80s and I can't keep relying on them to help me with finances and to help take care of my kids while I nap.  The stress on them as well as myself is putting all of our health in jeopardy.  
I have nothing to offer in return except my sincere gratitude and the knowledge you are saving a family.  I am hoping to also take a small trip to see my dad and aunt and uncle in Alberta this summer and my best friend.  My aunt and uncle and dad have offered to help with this trip financially but they cannot cover the entire cost of the trip.  They have only met my children once for a family funeral 2 years ago locally but have been unable to make a trip here.  My best friend and I haven't seen each other in 6 years and we have never met each others children at all.  I hope to see her and family before I become too sick to even travel.  As it is I cannot drive for very long due to the carpal tunnel and neuropathy.  This is the first year my husband has holidays.  
Thank you in advance for hearing my story, please feel free to look up my devastating disease online and even though I won't be able to have a transplant until I am in liver failure, there is no real treatment for all the symptoms of this terrible and debilitating disease.

story:
Hello, my name is Corey Nufer and for the past four years, I have been working for the cleaning and improving of a local disc golf course called Knollwood Park, here in Kalamazoo, Michigan. Our very first year in action, we cleared more than 25 contractor bags full of trash and over 400 pounds of broken glass from the park. Unfortunately, the folks that are trashing the place have gone unchecked and there is another full compliment of glass on the ground.
 
The glass is not where our struggle ends, the City of Kalamazoo Department of Parks and Recreation has refused to empty the garbage cans with any regular schedule. The reasons that have been cited to explain this flagrant disregard to park goers include: Lack of funding (emptying the cans would take 1 hour a month), tough terrain (the city owns several atvs with trailers), and the idea that the park was designed without consideration of garbage removal.

Well, we finally have a new parks director and we are seeking your help to jumpstart our campaign!

What We Need & What You Get

We have been doing these cleanups for four years now and have had minor success with the limited budget available. We hold tournaments and cleanup day events to raise awareness and money, but in order to make real changes, we need product to sell. The money you donate to our cause will be invested in merchandise that includes: Stickers, Discs, T-shirts, and/or bracelets. These will be resold at a reasonable price to provide funding for our fundraiser tournaments, direct park improvements (signs, better garbage receptacles, new chains on baskets, glass removal).
 
The first 20 people donating $25 will receive a disc of their choice out of the selection available. The first five donations of $50 gets you a pair of disc golf discs and one of our stickers! Finally, three lucky people with donations of $100 or more will receive a full set of discs, a sticker, and some special presents TBD from the manufacturers of the discs!

Any amount of funds raised will be put toward merchandise whether the goal is not met, has been reached, or is surpassed. (If there are more donations than I have asked for, I will include something extra in each perk sent!)
 
The impact that this will have on Knollwood park is immeasurable, our efforts will create a more accessible place for people to bring their families and pets without having to constantly be on the lookout for dangerous materials. Our golfers will finally have a course to be proud of rather than a mess to defend. Believing that we can create change is the first step on the path toward true freedom.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you personally do not have the money to contribute, please, help spread the word of our cause to everyone, whether they are disc golfers or not. It is time that the world community take responsibility for the state of our environment.
 
Thank you very much for your consideration!

story: Mark has always been healthy his entire life up until now when he went in for a routine DOT physical and a life changing diagnosis came about. He was told his heart was beating with an irregular pattern and needed to see a cardiologist. He found out he had an extreme case of A Fib and Cardiomyopathy. Several tests and procedures for 3 months to try and control it via medication and lifestyle change failed and the Ejection Fraction stayed at a dangerous level. He recieved an ICD implant and has been doing fine since. Even though he had insurance the out of pocket expense is out of reach due to the procedure happening before the end of coverage year and ending the next coverage year, meaning twice the out of pocket expenses.He needs help to pay for medical costs Insurance won't pay. And to make things worse because of the implant he is unable to pass the DOT physical so has had to resign his position at work due to medical reasons so his insurance coverage ends at the end of the month. Emphatically searching for a job that offers medical coverage for his health and everyday expenses is tough but he has been down that road before and has come out on top. This is a man that throughout all his life stood up to help those that were in need and never asked for anything in return and is now in need himself.....Thank you in advance for taking the time to read this.....This procedure has enabled him to be able to look forward to many more years to enjoy time with his beautiful new loving wife...........

story:
Who Is Willow, & What Is Willow Fit?

My name is Shannon Willow Edwards, and I'm a National Academy of Sports Medicine (NASM) certified personal trainer.  I'm also a yoga and barefoot junkie, and a big advocate of the idea that you can be healthy and beautiful no matter your size, shape, or age.  Willow Fit is the first step in what I hope will become a fitness revolution focused on self-empowerment, the mind-body connection, and genuine health.

Most of the fitness industry is focused on appearance-based achievements:  get six-pack abs, perfect your beach body, fit into that little black dress, and so on and so forth.  There's no room in that world for the notion that a person can wear plus-sized pants, or have laugh lines and still be beautiful, healthy, and strong.   With Willow Fit, I aim to break people out of that mindset, one client at a time.

By working with clients in their homes and over video chat, I'm removing the exercise experience from the often toxic atmosphere of many chain gyms.  I can encourage my clients to focus on their health and wellness goals without contradictory messages being sent via the "thin at any cost" culture in many gyms.  Clients will set their own fitness goals:  anything from weight loss to doing an unassisted pull-up to improved balance and flexibility.  As their trainer, I'll not only help my clients reach their goals, but also help them recognize and appreciate all their body does for them already.  I want to help my clients see how strong and beautiful they are right now. 

By contributing to this campaign, you'll help me bring this fitness philosophy into people's homes.  Long term, I hope to start a small studio or gym that welcomes men and women of all ages and body types without judgment, a place where yoga, pilates, belly dance, and other mind-body practices are taught to a wide variety of people...  But all that starts here, with Willow Fit in-home personal training.

What I Need

There are certain costs associated with freelancing, or running your own small company.  For a personal trainer just starting an in-home training business, they look something like this:

  • Liability Insurance: $172;  That's the minimum for one year of coverage.  The better the coverage I get, of course, the higher the premium.  Above and beyond it being smart and safe to have this insurance, I could lose my certification if I practiced without it. 
  • Website hosting and business cards: $134;  As marketing goes, this is the absolute bare minimum.  Breaking it down a bit more, I'm looking at $99 for a domain name and a year of website hosting (plus a few other "premium service" perks), and about $35 for 1,000 business cards. 
  • Equipment: $54;  $39 for a decent set of resistance bands with handles, ankle straps, and a door anchor, plus about $15 for a foam roller.  As easy-to-transport equipment goes, that's about as basic as it gets.

Those are my unavoidable, must-get-these-covered expenses, and you may notice they only come to a total of $360.  Any money raised beyond that will go to additional equipment, marketing, or continuing education courses to improve the training that I offer.  Some examples of these expenses include:

  • Suspension Trainer: $185;  This covers the cost of a TRX suspension trainer kit that includes the suspension rigging itself, as well as a door anchor.
  • Yoga for Personal Trainers Course: $219; Offered by the Academy for Holistic Fitness and recognized by NASM, this course would help me bring the mind-body focus of yoga to my one-on-one sessions with clients.  
  • Fliers: $1 - $50;  The cost on this depends on a lot of factors, including, most heavily, how many I decide to print.  This is where any small or odd leftover dollar amounts would be spent.

What You Get

For any donation, even just $1, you will get a unique thank you poem.  I don't promise it will be good, and I don't promise that it will be longer than a haiku.  I do promise that it will be sincere and written just for you. 

For a donation of $20, you get a video-chat physical assessment.  I'll get some info about your health and lifestyle (for safety reasons), and guide you through a few reps of some basic exercises.  Afterward, I'll let you know about any muscle imbalances you may have, and recommend a few exercises to correct them.  This is a service that will not be offered outside of fundraising efforts, and is worth well more than twenty bucks.

At the $50 level, I'll do a physical assessment over video chat, or in person (distance allowing), as well as create a 3-month workout plan based on your needs and goals.  That's a physical assessment and three months of professionally planned workouts for less than the cost of a single training session (in-person training sessions start at $60 an hour)!

If you're feeling really generous, a $100 donation gets you a physical assessment, a 3-month workout plan, AND a one-on-one session with me at the start of each new month (for a total of three sessions).  That's half the cost of purchasing this same service after the end of the campaign.  As with the previous level, this is available over video chat or in person, distance allowing.

The delivery estimates for all perks over $20 are subject to change, and are dependent on your schedule, and available training times.

Other Ways to Help

If you can't donate, that's not a problem.  This campaign is pursuing an...alternate revenue stream.  Sign up for training!  Or get your friends to sign up.  Or both!

Spread the word by posting to Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or the social media site of your choice!

story:
Summary

Heels on the Ground’s (HOTG) mission is to improve and enrich the quality of life for caregivers of America’s wounded soldiers by providing local support networks, workshops and holistic retreats.  

Like the wounded service member, caregivers face enormous pressures and make tremendous sacrifices, yet there are few options for healing caregivers. HOTG provides ongoing, customized support for caregivers, guiding them through the healing process and empowering them to make lasting transformations to their health so that they can thrive in the face of these challenges. As the caregivers thrive, so will their spouses and families.

HOTG firmly believes that the benefits of peer support groups, education, personal goal setting, meditation, relaxation and physical wellness can greatly improve a caregiver’s ability to cope with stress.  HOTG’s holistic approach combines these methods to promote health and well-being within the caregiver community.

HOTG was created by Allison Hughes, former Army Blackhawk pilot and presently MBA student and caregiver to a critically wounded Special Forces officer. She has partnered with Katherine Malavenda, former Army officer and presently a Licensed Professional Counselor with extensive experience working with military families.  


What We Need 

With the first $50,000, HOTG will provide support for up to 40 caregivers through five dynamic channels: 1) a local support chapter; 2) individualized mental and physical wellness plans; 3) educational webinars; 4) live, quarterly workshops offering teaching skills for healing the mind and body; and 5) an annual retreat for up to 15 caregivers to build upon the skills developed in the other channels.  HOTG will increase the amount of retreats offered each year to accommodate demand. 


    The Impact

    It is estimated that there are over one million post 9/11 caregivers of military veterans, representing a growing—yet underserved—community within our nation’s military.  Programs in existence for the caregiver typically focus on the soldier and only diffusely relate to the needs of the caregiver.  HOTG will address this gap by specifically targeting the needs of caregivers of post 9/11 wounded soldiers. 

    Depression and anxiety are among the leading problems facing these caregivers.  Empirically validated research has proven the effectiveness of peer support groups, education, setting personal goals, meditation, relaxation and physical wellness in helping military populations and general caregiver populations cope with depression and anxiety. HOTG’s holistic approach combines these effective methods and is expected to be effective in promoting health and well-being within the caregiver community. In addition, these methods are easy for caregivers to transfer to daily life. 


      Risks & Challenges

      Current programs for caregiver assistance cannot meet the incredible demand. They service only a small percentage of the caregivers who struggle daily. These programs offer retreats infrequently and lack progressive, ongoing support for caregivers.  In addition, caregiver support cannot be a once yearly activity and effectively meet the needs of the caregiver population.  Caregivers are at work 365 days per year and each caregiver has a unique, complex situation requiring unique, ongoing treatment. In order for caregivers to accomplish healing, caregiver resources cannot be minimized to one event but must utilize an evolving, holistic approach encompassing their unique needs.  None of the programs in existence for caregivers today offer ongoing, individualized and holistic treatments for caregivers.

      Donation Perks

      As part of our appreciation for your donations, Rags of Honor, a veteran-run tee shirt shop in Chicago,  will be screen printing tee shirts, hoodies, beanies, and canvas tote bags with the Heels on the Ground Logo.  


        Other Ways You Can Help

        Please spread the work about our Heels on the Ground campaign to help make our business venture a success.  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to send this campaign to friends and family.  
        • Spread the word far and wide. Tell friends and neighbors. Post on Facebook, Twitter, and Pinterest.
        • Use our awesome banner photo on your Facebook or Twitter profile!

story:
LADIES OF GNI. 

We love reading what Jenna has to say...but can she say much without teeth? We think not.

We are a community and there is no reason we can't come together. Jenna needs a lot of DENTAL work. She is in pain and paying for this is out of her budget.

Some of us don't have much, but if every girl in GNI put in even just 1 dollar this could be paid for.

So let's give. She's given us SNACKS and Taxidermy and boobs for days. Let's give back. back to her mouth. Let's give nanna teeth.

story:
About Charley

Hello! My name is Charley. I am a freelance artist from NYC. I am transgender (meaning that the gender was assigned at birth is not my gender). I am disabled. I am a very friendly person with a lot of serious anxiety, most notably in regards to my chest and the assumptions people make about my gender. Going out can induce severe panic attacks that negatively affect my already compromised heath. Getting a desperately-needed double mastectomy will majorly improve my quality of life and mental health! Unfortunately, this is not something my insurance will cover, and all things considered this will cost me over $8000 out-of-pocket which is not attainable on my own, which is why I need your help!

What I Need & What You Get

  • All funding will go to fund my surgery, with a small portion allotted for the travel and accommodations I will need during the week or so recovery period. I have a surgeon selected, Dr. Beverly Fischer. I have seen patient results and am extremely impressed, and she isn't too far from me.
  • This campaign may not have as many perks as most, but a chance to get a custom piece of art from me may be enticing! I will also mention backers in a thank you post on my well-known tumblr, transrants!
  • If I don't reach my full goal, all proceeds will be placed in my top-surgery fund. Regardless of whether I make my funding goal, your contribution will majorly help in getting me this surgery I so desperately need.

Impact
  • On a global scale, this may not mean much. But this surgery will quite literally change my life and allow me to live my life with so much more confidence and happiness. At this current time, every time I go out I get jeered at because I do not fit the stereotypical expectations of either binary gender.
  • Many other transgender and disabled people have been able to achieve surgery goals through crowdfunding. A single dollar towards my surgery is a step forward to getting this surgery I need so badly.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! All I ask is for you to SHARE this campaign wherever you can. Like I said, a single dollar will get me that much closer to a major life-changing surgery I desperately need, so by boosting it to your friends, family, and followers, you are helping me majorly to reach those who can donate.

(NOTE: Don't forget to contact me to tell me who you are if you are selecting promo perks, and don't forget to send me what you want drawn if you are selecting art perks!)
story_txt:
About CharleyHello! My name is Charley. I am a freelance 
artist from NYC. I am transgender (meaning that the gender was assigned 
at birth is not my gender). I am disabled. I am a very friendly person 
with a lot of serious anxiety, most notably in regards to my chest and 
the assumptions people make about my gender. Going out can induce severe
 panic attacks that negatively affect my already compromised heath. 
Getting a desperately-needed double mastectomy will majorly improve my 
quality of life and mental health! Unfortunately, this is not something 
my insurance will cover, and all things considered this will cost me 
over $8000 out-of-pocket which is not attainable on my own, which is why
 I need your help!  What I Need & What You Get 
All funding will go to fund my surgery, with a small portion 
allotted for the travel and accommodations I will need during the week 
or so recovery period. I have a surgeon selected, Dr. Beverly Fischer. I
 have seen patient results and am extremely impressed, and she isn't too
 far from me.
This campaign may not have as many perks as most, but a chance
 to get a custom piece of art from me may be enticing! I will also 
mention backers in a thank you post on my well-known tumblr, transrants!
If I don't reach my full goal, all proceeds will be placed in 
my top-surgery fund. Regardless of whether I make my funding goal, your 
contribution will majorly help in getting me this surgery I so 
desperately need.

  
Impact  
On a global scale, this may not mean much. But this surgery will 
quite literally change my life and allow me to live my life with so much
 more confidence and happiness. At this current time, every time I go 
out I get jeered at because I do not fit the stereotypical expectations 
of either binary gender.
Many other transgender and disabled people have been able to 
achieve surgery goals through crowdfunding. A single dollar towards my 
surgery is a step forward to getting this surgery I need so badly.


 Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!
 All I ask is for you to SHARE this campaign wherever you can. Like I 
said, a single dollar will get me that much closer to a major 
life-changing surgery I desperately need, so by boosting it to your 
friends, family, and followers, you are helping me majorly to reach 
those who can donate.(NOTE: Don't forget to contact me to tell 
me who you are if you are selecting promo perks, and don't forget to 
send me what you want drawn if you are selecting art perks!)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Diana Wiggins. On February 26, I slipped while getting off the bus and broke my foot very badly. What I have is called a LisFranc injury, which is no fun. I spent weeks unable to walk after the surgery to put four screws in my foot, and I still suffer a great deal with getting around.

Unfortunately, my job requires me to stand for hours at a time, so I was unable to work for the duration of my time in a cast, and have only started working again in the last week. My mother, who has been helping me with medical costs, was laid off a few months before I hurt myself. As a result, we were already short on money, and this incident has not helped at all.

What I Need

Mostly what I need help with is covering the cost of the surgery ($6000) as well as how much the surgery to get the screws taken out will cost. I won't know for sure how much that is until I am billed for it, but I assume it will be quite a bit.

If the goal is met, I will post lots of pictures of my screw-free foot, as well as photos of the screws themselves (if I am able to keep them). I would also personally fall in love with each person that helps me.

    The Impact

    This would help me immensely in continuing to improve my health situation. This is honestly my last resort, since we are low on money and I'd like not to bankrupt my family due to my own clumsiness and a slippery bus step.

story:
This April, the International Quidditch Association’s top 80 teams will be travelling from all over globe to Myrtle Beach, South Carolina. These teams – teams from California, to Canada, from to New York, to Europe – will all compete for the title of World Cup VII Champion. These teams have practiced, fought, and won for the past year to earn their spot in the biggest completion of the season. And until this April, these teams will be waiting to show the worldwide quidditch community exactly what they’re capable of doing.

BU Quidditch is one of those teams. But we need your help to get there.

As previously stated, this year’s World Cup will be taking place in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina. Transporting 21 players from Boston to South Carolina is an expensive endeavor, and, as such, requires a great deal of funding. Our team is solely responsible for generating that funding. In order to pay for the necessary transportation and lodging expenses, we have organized t-shirt campaigns, sweatshirt campaigns, and a bottle drive. But so far, it has not been enough. Which is why we need your help.

This season, BU Quidditch has fought its way to an undefeated tournament record, earning two titles, including its third straight Northeast Regional Championship. We don’t want to stop there. We hope and intend to bring the motivation and perseverance that has carried us through this season with us to the World Cup. And we hope and intend to bring home the title. So – please – help us accomplish that goal.

Each perk we will be sending you for your donations comes with our greatest and deepest gratitude. Thank you all so much.


Tee-Spring Fundraiser

We also have a T-shirt fundraiser currently running. Check out these awesome shirts!

http://www.teespring.com/buquidditch






Please share this page and like our Facebook page!

If you have any questions, email us at BostonUQuidditch@gmail.com

story:
My name is Bryan, and I'm an avid motorcyclist.  I frequently use my motorcycle for commuting, so I ride 90+ miles most days.  I am a motorcycling safety advocate, and often counsel younger riders on riding safely, and the importance of wearing good safety gear.  When asked about helmets, my normal response is "Sure, buy a $100 helmet, if you've got a $100 head."  Yet recently, since my Arai visor clip broke and is not repairable, I have been riding around in an entry-level cheap helmet, making me a bit of a hypocrite.  

I will continue to mentor new riders, and focus on riding safely, regardless of what helmet I wear.  It would, however, be much more convincing to younger riders if I was myself wearing high quality protective gear.

Thank you for your consideration of funding.  Every little bit is appreciated.

story:
Ultimate Muscle Confusion

Ultimate Muscle Confusion (UMC) is the easiest and best way to get and stay in shape.  UMC uses a system created by former college football player Bobby Bluford that combines two scientifically proven methods for increasing lean muscle and decreasing body fat- Muscle Confusion and High Intensity Interval Training.  We are currently building both a website and an iphone and Android app to remove the barriers that prevent people from maintaining momentum in their fitness and exercise program: Time and Equipment Availability.  We are in the process of developing and offering the following features:

Website

  • Members have access to workout videos based on the UMC training system (see below for details on the UMC training philosophy).  The videos vary in time (10-50 minutes), equipment used (from nothing at all or things you’d find around the home or office to things you’d find in a fully equipped gym such as dumbbells and barbells), and body parts worked (many are overall body, while others focus on a specific group of muscles or specific purpose such as speed development or agility improvement).  Additionally, the videos are in real-time, so members can simply press play and follow along for a complete workout, including warm up, cool-down, and motivational encouragement with one of UMC’s talented and engaging trainers.
  • Members can set goals and track their progress via reports, summaries, and various fitness tests.
  • Members check in periodically, recording their results along 5 dimensions that include weight, body fat/BMI, and measurements.
  • Members log UMC minutes, earning shirts upon the completion of certain levels.  For example, 5,000 minutes logged (roughly 1 year @ 3 workouts per week) earns a Green “5,000 Minute Club” Shirt


  • The site will highlight and spotlight members at all levels for achievements including the reaching of minute milestones (new shirt color) and personal bests in fitness tests.
  • Members can build “Workout Buddies” lists, teaming up with other members for motivation and encouragement; competition; or just fun.
  • Members can view live group exercise sessions (mostly bootcamps) from anywhere in the world.  Select members (e.g. personal trainers who employ the UMC system) will also have the ability to conduct their own exercise classes to broadcast to other members.
  • Members will be able to find other members in their geographic area and “meet up” for workouts if desired.
  • Members can participate in live webinars with experts in fields such as nutrition and sports training, which will be available frequently (monthly, then weekly, then several times per week).

Mobile Site and Workout Tool (App)

  • When logged in, members can view the activity of their “Workout Buddies”, including who is currently working out and how much time they have remaining in their workouts.  Members will be able to send real-time motivational messages to their workout buddies.

“Keep it up, Jim!”
“I’m gonna grab my shoes and join you, Jill!”

  • Members can run any off-the-shelf videos available on the website from their mobile device.  These videos can be downloaded and stored (automatically or manually) to the member’s mobile device for use in offline mode.  Which videos a member can view will be dependent upon the user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum)
  • Members can run the Proprietary Workout Tool/App.  Running the Workout Tool is simple and fast.  The user simply answers a few questions:

  • How much time do you have? (10, 20, 30, 40, or 50 minutes)

  • What equipment is available to you? (medicine ball, chair, wall, open running area, dumbbells, jump rope, etc.)

  • What body parts do you want to focus on? (e.g. a woman’s trouble areas, a man who wants to get a good chest pump before going to the beach)

  • What body parts do you want to avoid? (e.g. a bad knee or elbow, lower back pain)

  • What intensity level do you want? (light, moderate, heavy, intense)

  • The Workout Tool/App pulls from an ever-growing database of 30-second exercise video clips (See Below for UMC Training Philosophy) any and all videos that meet the criteria set by the questions the member answered.
  • The Workout Tool/App randomly selects a video from this subset of videos  x number of times, where x is the number of minutes available to workout (question #1) times two (2), then strings together all of the videos into a video reel.  For example, if the member desires a 10-minute workout, the Workout Tool/App will pull 20 (10 x 2) 30-second videos.
  • Once the Workout Tool/App has finished creating the workout reel, the member will see a “Start” button.
  • The member can press play to begin the workout
  • Once the workout is completed, the minutes, exercises, and specific playlist are all logged and saved in the member’s profile.  How much information is kept and stored for later use and analysis will be dependent upon the user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum)
  • Members can save, share, and create custom workouts.  This feature will be dependent upon the user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum)
  • Members will receive weekly meal plans, along with shopping lists.  This feature will be dependent upon the user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum)
  • Members will correspond periodically (via phone, email, and chat) with healthy lifestyle coaches.  This feature will be dependent upon the user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum)

Where the UMC idea came from?

The Ultimate Muscle Confusion (UMC) exercise system was created out of necessity. 

“I played football in college, so I’ve always been a gym rat.  For years after I graduated from college and finished my football career, I was working out 2 hours a day, 6-7 times per week.  But, as I got older and began advancing in my career (in Corporate Finance) and building a family, I found it more and more difficult to spend hours in the gym.  I simply didn’t have the time, or the energy, to keep such an extensive and time-consuming workout regimen.”
 - Bobby Bluford; Founder, UMC   

UMC removes the major barrier that prevents people from getting and staying in great physical condition- MOMENTUM!

What do we mean by MOMENTUM?

We all have what we at UMC term “fitness seizures” at times.  These moments where we tell ourselves “Enough is Enough!” happen throughout the year.  Maybe we come across an old photo of ourselves when we were thin.  Or we see an old teammate that tells us how “buff [we] used to be.”  Or maybe we just pass by the mirror after a shower or go for an annual checkup at the doctor and finally confirm the weight we were pretty sure we’d gained.  And we all have this same fitness seizure on or near January 1 of every year when we vow to ourselves and loved ones that we are going to exercise more and eat better.

When these fitness seizures happen, what do we do?  We go out and buy new fitness gear or running shoes.  We join the local gym or hire a personal trainer.  And we rush to the local supermarket and nearly clear out the produce section and health food aisles.  All of this builds MOMENTUM.  We are gung ho, overwhelmingly excited about our future.  This “fitness seizure” lasts several days or weeks and the MOMENTUM builds as we see a difference in how we both look and feel.  This discipline, this MOMENTUM, might even last a few months.  But more times than not, something eventually happens to derail our well-laid plans, to interrupt our schedules.  We travel across the country for work and are confined to a hotel room for days.  Or we are stuck at the office until late at night for a week straight trying to meet an important deadline.  Or we’re unable to get to the gym or even pop in our favorite fitness DVD because our child is home sick with the flu.  Inevitably, life has its way of putting a wrench into our plans.  The result: MOMENTUM lost!

How does UMC fix that, helping you to maintain MOMENTUM?

UMC helps people build and maintain fitness MOMENTUM by removing the two major constraints that people face: TIME AVAILABILITY and EQUIPMENT AVAILABILITY.

  • Time Availability
Working out at the gym is great; having a personal trainer is even better. But one session, when you include travel time to and from the location, requires an investment in time of up to an hour and a half. Popular fitness DVDs remove travel time from the equation, but the time for those workouts is fixed and difficult to adjust. For example, if a particular DVD workout is 40 minutes, but you only have 20 minutes to work out, what do you do? Are you going to start it and stop half way through? Are you going to skip the warm-up? The odds are that you are going to skip the workout altogether. The simple truth is that, historically, fitness options have required people to adjust their lives to fit them in, not the other way around. NOT WITH UMC! The UMC Workout Tool/App allows the user to choose how much time she has to work out. From 10 to 50 minutes, furthermore, the Workout Tool adjusts for warm-up and cool-down accordingly. All of the thinking is done for the user. With UMC, working out and staying fit is no longer an “All or Nothing” proposition.
  • Equipment Availability
If you are in a gym, you have access to everything you need to work out. You might even have your home set up to get a great workout most of the time. But what if you don’t belong to a gym or have an efficient setup at home? What if you don’t have a lot of equipment. Or anything at all. Or maybe you just have a jump rope and a medicine ball. IT DOESN’T MATTER WHAT EQUIPMENT YOU HAVE! With the UMC Workout Tool/App, it doesn’t matter what equipment you have or where you are. With an ever-growing database of exercises, requiring different types of equipment or none at all, the UMC Workout Tool/App is always able to put together a great workout for you. Whether you are a beginner that prefers only bodyweight exercises or an experienced athlete who loves the challenges that weightlifting, power movements, and plyometrics present, the UMC Workout Tool/App accommodates you. As a matter of fact, the best thing about the UMC Workout Tool/App is that it allows you to progress in your fitness at your own rate. You can start out with 10-minute workouts, using only bodyweight exercises and those that use items that are readily available such as kitchen chairs or office desks. Later, you can purchase a few items such as a pair of light dumbbells or a jump rope, adding to the set of possible exercises. Slowly, you can make the workouts longer, then add resistance bands, pull-up bars, or even a sandbag and make your workouts even more intense. And when you are ready to join a gym or take your workouts to the next level, the Workout Tool/App will be there with you.

The UMC Training Philosophy

Ultimate Muscle Confusion combines two well known and scientifically proven methods for both building muscle and losing weight: High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) and Muscle Confusion. But even though these ideas are not new, UMC has made two significant upgrades, making the UMC system unique and PATENT PENDING.

  • High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)
What is it?
An exercise strategy where short intense periods of exercise are followed by brief recovery periods. Common examples include the 40/20 split, where intense exercise periods of 40 seconds are followed by rest periods of 20 seconds.

UMC’s Enhancement
Rather than have a uniform and constant mix of exercise and full recovery (rest) periods, the UMC philosophy is based on 30-second exercise periods with few, if any, scheduled recovery periods. Furthermore, the UMC recovery periods are almost never full rest periods. Instead, UMC uses Active Recovery Periods, which usually consist of jogging or walking in place and abdominal/core work). The UMC system requires that users monitor their own rest periods. This does two things. First, it reduces the total workout time, allowing users to get a great workout in a fraction of the time other fitness methods take. And secondly, it allows the user to control his own fitness, taking breaks as he sees fit (during any exercise period). This creates a great self-evaluation tool, allowing the user to feel himself improving as the self-imposed rest periods become shorter and less frequent.
  • Muscle Confusion
What is it?
A training principle based on the belief that the body’s muscles accommodate and adjust to specific types of stress if the stimuli are not adjusted or changed. The theory states that, because the body is amazingly capable of adapting to anything it repeatedly encounters, building muscle and losing weight requires continuous change in the exercises those muscles are asked to perform.

UMC’s Enhancement
DVD programs that are based on High Intensity Interval Training are fixed. No matter how many DVDs are in the set, eventually your body will adjust. Or you will become bored. And whether the workouts use weights or they rely on bodyweight exercises, the actual workouts do not change. Even if there are 20 workouts in a DVD collection, for example, those 20 workouts will always be the same length, using the same equipment. The “U” in UMC refers to ULTIMATE because the workouts the system produces are ALWAYS DIFFERENT. Whether through a certified UMC instructor or the UMC Workout Tool/App, each exercise in a UMC workout is almost completely randomly selected. Once the time available and equipment available is determined, the workout possibilities are unlimited in both variety and intensity.

Where We Currently Are

Ultimate Muscle Confusion (UMC) in Action

I have been using UMC in my own life for more than two years.  In doing so, I’ve discovered:

  1. I don’t need to spend hours in the gym; I spend half as much time working out as I used to.
  2. I don’t need to rely solely on weights to get a great workout; I use weights roughly ½ of the time and RARELY lift heavy.
  3. I don’t need to lift heavy to gain size, nor lift light to gain definition.  If I push myself as hard as I can for 30 seconds at a time, everything else will take care of itself.  I can’t go for 30 seconds with weights that are too heavy.  And I can’t push myself for those same 30 seconds if I go too light.  Yet, as you’ll see in #7, these workouts are as productive as any I’ve ever done.
  4. I don’t need to do traditional cardio (jogging, riding the stationary bike, or using the stairmaster); instead, I rely on the continuous movement that is the foundation of UMC to burn calories.
  5. I don’t have to always have a plan for my workout.  I simply decide what equipment I want to use and how long I want to work out, then simply start.  I often literally take it one half minute (30 seconds) at a time.

  6. Working out and general fitness is not an “All or Nothing” proposition.  If I have 10 minutes to work out, then I’ll work out for 10 minutes.  If I have 50, then 50 it is.

    ..And Most Importantly

  7. I’m 40 and I look and feel as good as I did when I was 20, well before I realized all of this!

Bootcamp Usage

In January of 2013, I began using the UMC system in bootcamps that I conduct. Because of my experience using this methodology, I am able to create dynamic, challenging workouts that are completely different every time. Students in my bootcamp rave about UMC’s efficiency and enjoy the fast-paced, ever-changing nature of the program. Here are some of the quotes:

    “I never know what’s coming next. I love it!”

    “I have lifted weights for years and never sweated this much!”

    “I thought I was working hard before. I guess I was wrong.”

    “In some of our workouts, we use just a chair. I guess I have no excuses!”

Development of the Workout Tool/App

The Ultimate Muscle Confusion (UMC) Workout Tool/App is currently being developed and is due to be fully released in the Fall of 2013.  We are currently filming the hundreds of video clips (each 30 seconds in length) that will make up the video library.  As described earlier, the tool will ask the user a series of questions that will determine how many and which videos to pull for possible inclusion in the workout. 

From this subset of videos that match the user’s criteria, the initial version of the Workout Tool will then randomly select a video x number of times, where x is the number of minutes available to work out times two (2), until the requisite number of videos is pulled together to create a continuous video reel.  Later versions will build upon this logic, increasing the complexity of the algorithm used to create the workout, taking into account the user’s ability level and progression, as well as grouping exercises and stacking them into what we call rounds.  For example, the Workout Tool/App might randomly select the following:

  • Push-Ups
  • Planks
  • Squats
  • Burpees

Then, group those four exercises into one round, having the user repeat the four-exercise group two or three times, separated by an exercise (video) that is conducive to slight recovery, then smooth transition.  For example:

  • Push-Ups
  • Planks
  • Squats
  • Burpees
  • Jog in Place
  • Push-Ups
  • Planks
  • Squats
  • Burpees
  • Jog in Place
  • Push-Ups
  • Planks
  • Squats
  • Burpees

Developers are also working on the tracking, analysis, and social media tools that will be available to members based on their membership levels.  These tools include:

  • Automatic recording of workout details; including total minutes as well as minutes broken down by body part and intensity; time and ranking (scale of 1 to 5) of workout (to help members realize best times to work out)

  • Ability to save workouts that were particularly enjoyable. These workouts will be available in offline mode.

  • Ability to connect with “Workout Buddies”. Members can then share workouts with these “Workout Buddies” as well as see when they are working out, and can even send them motivational and encouraging messages.

  • Ability to set goals and timetables, which can then be monitored manually or automatically. For example, after each workout, a message will appear stating something like:

Goal Number of Minutes 1,000
Goal Date 8/1/2013
Minutes Toward Goal 370
Minutes Above/Below Pace -20




 

The Workout Tool/App is being created for both the iphone and Android platforms.  Our initial focus is on the logic and algorithm behind the Workout Tool.  We will then focus strongly on the social media component, GUI, and overall user experience.


Purpose for Funding

I am looking to raise $25,000 in order to:
  • Professionally film and edit off-the-shelf full workouts, at a variety of lengths, using a variety of equipment. Currently, I both film and edit these and would like to greatly improve the quality (lighting, sound, location) as well as hire others for some of the workouts.

  • Professionally film and edit the 30 second videos needed for the UMC Workout Tool/App. The hope is to have 500 exercises, using a variety of equipment, by the end of 2013. Currently, I both film and edit these and would like to greatly improve the quality (lighting, location) as well as hire others for some of the exercises.

  • Complete Development of Random Exercise Selection (RES) function of Workout Tool/App. This feature will increase in complexity in each future version of the tool.


  • Complete Development of additional features, including social media integration and collaboration tools (motivating, coaching, and inspiring each other).
