Members will be able to find other members in
their geographic area and “meet up” for workouts if desired.
Members can participate in live webinars with
experts in fields such as nutrition and sports training, which will be
available frequently (monthly, then weekly, then several times per week).


Mobile Site and Workout Tool (App)



When logged in, members can view the activity of
their “Workout Buddies”, including who is currently working out and how much
time they have remaining in their workouts. 
Members will be able to send real-time motivational messages to their
workout buddies.







“Keep it up, Jim!”





“I’m gonna grab my shoes and join you,
Jill!”




Members can run any off-the-shelf videos
available on the website from their mobile device.  These videos can be downloaded and stored
(automatically or manually) to the member’s mobile device for use in offline
mode.  Which videos a member can view
will be dependent upon the user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold,
Platinum)
Members can run the Proprietary Workout
Tool/App.  Running the Workout Tool is
simple and fast.  The user simply answers
a few questions:






How much time do you have? (10, 20, 30, 40, or
50 minutes)

What equipment is available to you? (medicine ball, chair, wall, open running area, dumbbells, jump rope, etc.)


What body parts do you want to focus on? (e.g. a woman’s trouble areas, a man who wants to get a good chest pump before going to the beach)


What body parts do you want to avoid? (e.g. a bad knee or elbow, lower back pain)


What intensity level do you want? (light, moderate, heavy, intense)





The Workout Tool/App pulls from an ever-growing
database of 30-second exercise video clips (See Below for UMC Training
Philosophy) any and all videos that meet the criteria set by the questions the
member answered.
The Workout Tool/App randomly selects a video
from this subset of videos  x number of
times, where x is the number of minutes available to workout (question #1) times
two (2), then strings together all of the videos into a video reel.  For example, if the member desires a
10-minute workout, the Workout Tool/App will pull 20 (10 x 2) 30-second videos.
Once the Workout Tool/App has finished creating
the workout reel, the member will see a “Start” button.
The member can press play to begin the workout
Once the workout is completed, the minutes,
exercises, and specific playlist are all logged and saved in the member’s
profile.  How much information is kept
and stored for later use and analysis will be dependent upon the user’s
membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum)
Members can save, share, and create custom
workouts.  This feature will be dependent
upon the user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum)
Members will receive weekly meal plans, along
with shopping lists.  This feature will
be dependent upon the user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold,
Platinum)
Members will correspond periodically (via phone,
email, and chat) with healthy lifestyle coaches.  This feature will be dependent upon the
user’s membership level (e.g. Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum)



Where the UMC idea came from?
The Ultimate Muscle Confusion
(UMC) exercise system was created out of necessity. 
“I played football in college, so I’ve always been a gym
rat.  For years after I graduated from
college and finished my football career, I was working out 2 hours a day, 6-7
times per week.  But, as I got older and
began advancing in my career (in Corporate Finance) and building a family, I
found it more and more difficult to spend hours in the gym.  I simply didn’t have the time, or the energy,
to keep such an extensive and time-consuming workout regimen.”
- Bobby Bluford; Founder, UMC   
UMC removes the major barrier that prevents people from
getting and staying in great physical condition- MOMENTUM!

What do we mean by MOMENTUM?

We all have what we at UMC term “fitness seizures” at
times.  These moments where we tell
ourselves “Enough is Enough!” happen throughout the year.  Maybe we come across an old photo of
ourselves when we were thin.  Or we see
an old teammate that tells us how “buff [we] used to be.”  Or maybe we
just pass by the mirror after a shower or go for an annual checkup at the
doctor and finally confirm the weight we were pretty sure we’d gained.  And we all have this same fitness seizure on
or near January 1 of every year when we vow to ourselves and loved ones that we
are going to exercise more and eat better.
When these fitness seizures happen, what do we do?  We go out and buy new fitness gear or running
shoes.  We join the local gym or hire a
personal trainer.  And we rush to the local
supermarket and nearly clear out the produce section and health food aisles.  All of this builds MOMENTUM.  We are gung ho,
overwhelmingly excited about our future. 
This “fitness seizure” lasts several days or weeks and the MOMENTUM builds as we see a difference
in how we both look and feel.  This
discipline, this MOMENTUM, might
even last a few months.  But more times
than not, something eventually happens to derail our well-laid plans, to
interrupt our schedules.  We travel
across the country for work and are confined to a hotel room for days.  Or we are stuck at the office until late at
night for a week straight trying to meet an important deadline.  Or we’re unable to get to the gym or even pop
in our favorite fitness DVD because our child is home sick with the flu.  Inevitably, life has its way of putting a
wrench into our plans.  The result: MOMENTUM lost!

How does UMC fix
that, helping you to maintain MOMENTUM?
UMC helps people build and maintain fitness MOMENTUM by removing the two major constraints
that people face: TIME AVAILABILITY and
EQUIPMENT AVAILABILITY.

Time Availability




Working out at the gym is great; having a personal trainer is even better.  But one session, when you include travel time to and from the location, requires an investment in time of up to an hour and a half.  Popular fitness DVDs remove travel time from the equation, but the time for those workouts is fixed and difficult to adjust.  For example, if a particular DVD workout is 40 minutes, but you only have 20 minutes to work out, what do you do?  Are you going to start it and stop half way through?  Are you going to skip the warm-up?  The odds are that you are going to skip the workout altogether.  The simple truth is that, historically, fitness options have required people to adjust their lives to fit them in, not the other way around.  NOT WITH UMC! The UMC Workout Tool/App allows the user to choose how much time she has to work out.  From 10 to 50 minutes, furthermore, the Workout Tool adjusts for warm-up and cool-down accordingly.  All of the thinking is done for the user.  With UMC, working out and staying fit is no longer an “All or Nothing” proposition.   

Equipment Availability



If you are in a gym, you have access to everything you need to work out.  You might even have your home set up to get a great workout most of the time.  But what if you don’t belong to a gym or have an efficient setup at home?  What if you don’t have a lot of equipment.  Or anything at all.  Or maybe you just have a jump rope and a medicine ball.  IT DOESN’T MATTER WHAT EQUIPMENT YOU HAVE!  With the UMC Workout Tool/App, it doesn’t matter what equipment you have or where you are.  With an ever-growing database of exercises, requiring different types of equipment or none at all, the UMC Workout Tool/App is always able to put together a great workout for you.  Whether you are a beginner that prefers only bodyweight exercises or an experienced athlete who loves the challenges that weightlifting, power movements, and plyometrics present, the UMC Workout Tool/App accommodates you. As a matter of fact, the best thing about the UMC Workout Tool/App is that it allows you to progress in your fitness at your own rate.  You can start out with 10-minute workouts, using only bodyweight exercises and those that use items that are readily available such as kitchen chairs or office desks.  Later, you can purchase a few items such as a pair of light dumbbells or a jump rope, adding to the set of possible exercises.  Slowly, you can make the workouts longer, then add resistance bands, pull-up bars, or even a sandbag and make your workouts even more intense.  And when you are ready to join a gym or take your workouts to the next level, the Workout Tool/App will be there with you.

The UMC Training Philosophy


Ultimate Muscle Confusion combines two well known and scientifically proven methods for both building muscle and losing weight: High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) and Muscle Confusion.  But even though these ideas are not new, UMC has made two significant upgrades, making the UMC system unique and PATENT PENDING.
High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)




What is it? An exercise strategy where short intense periods of exercise are followed by brief recovery periods.  Common examples include the 40/20 split, where intense exercise periods of 40 seconds are followed by rest periods of 20 seconds.
UMC’s EnhancementRather than have a uniform and constant mix of exercise and full recovery (rest) periods, the UMC philosophy is based on 30-second exercise periods with few, if any, scheduled recovery periods.  Furthermore, the UMC recovery periods are almost never full rest periods.  Instead, UMC uses Active Recovery Periods, which usually consist of jogging or walking in place and abdominal/core work).  The UMC system requires that users monitor their own rest periods.  This does two things.  First, it reduces the total workout time, allowing users to get a great workout in a fraction of the time other fitness methods take.  And secondly, it allows the user to control his own fitness, taking breaks as he sees fit (during any exercise period).  This creates a great self-evaluation tool, allowing the user to feel himself improving as the self-imposed rest periods become shorter and less frequent.


Muscle Confusion




What is it? A training principle based on the belief that the body’s muscles accommodate and adjust to specific types of stress if the stimuli are not adjusted or changed.  The theory states that, because the body is amazingly capable of adapting to anything it repeatedly encounters, building muscle and losing weight requires continuous change in the exercises those muscles are asked to perform.  

UMC’s EnhancementDVD programs that are based on High Intensity Interval Training are fixed.   No matter how many DVDs are in the set, eventually your body will adjust.  Or you will become bored.  And whether the workouts use weights or they rely on bodyweight exercises, the actual workouts do not change.  Even if there are 20 workouts in a DVD collection, for example, those 20 workouts will always be the same length, using the same equipment.  The “U” in UMC refers to ULTIMATE because the workouts the system produces are ALWAYS DIFFERENT.  Whether through a certified UMC instructor or the UMC Workout Tool/App, each exercise in a UMC workout is almost completely randomly selected.   Once the time available and equipment available is determined, the workout possibilities are unlimited in both variety and intensity.



Where We Currently Are
Ultimate Muscle Confusion (UMC) in Action


I have been using UMC in my own life for more than two
years.  In doing so, I’ve discovered:


I don’t need to spend hours in the gym; I spend
half as much time working out as I used to.
I don’t need to rely solely on weights to get a
great workout; I use weights roughly ½ of the time and RARELY lift heavy.
I don’t need to lift heavy to gain size, nor
lift light to gain definition.  If I push
myself as hard as I can for 30 seconds at a time, everything else will take
care of itself.  I can’t go for 30
seconds with weights that are too heavy. 
And I can’t push myself for those same 30 seconds if I go too light.  Yet, as you’ll see in #7, these workouts are
as productive as any I’ve ever done.
I don’t need to do traditional cardio (jogging,
riding the stationary bike, or using the stairmaster); instead, I rely on the
continuous movement that is the foundation of UMC to burn calories.
I don’t have to always have a plan for my
workout.  I simply decide what equipment
I want to use and how long I want to work out, then simply start.  I often literally take it one half minute (30
seconds) at a time.

Working out and general fitness is not an “All or Nothing” proposition.  If I have 10 minutes to work out, then I’ll
work out for 10 minutes.  If I have 50,
then 50 it is.
..And Most Importantly

I’m 40 and I look and feel as good as I did when
I was 20, well before I realized all of this!



Bootcamp Usage


In January of 2013, I began using the UMC system in bootcamps that I conduct.  Because of my experience using this methodology, I am able to create dynamic, challenging workouts that are completely different every time.  Students in my bootcamp rave about UMC’s efficiency and enjoy the fast-paced, ever-changing nature of the program.  Here are some of the quotes:



“I never know what’s coming next.  I love it!”
“I have lifted weights for years and never sweated this much!”
“I thought I was working hard before.  I guess I was wrong.”
“In some of our workouts, we use just a chair.  I guess I have no excuses!”






Development of the
Workout Tool/App

The
Ultimate Muscle Confusion (UMC) Workout Tool/App is currently being developed
and is due to be fully released in the Fall of 2013.  We are currently filming the hundreds of
video clips (each 30 seconds in length) that will make up the video
library.  As described earlier, the tool
will ask the user a series of questions that will determine how many and which
videos to pull for possible inclusion in the workout. 

From this subset of videos that match the user’s criteria, the
initial version of the Workout Tool will then randomly select a video x number
of times, where x is the number of minutes available to work out times two (2),
until the requisite number of videos is pulled together to create a continuous
video reel.  Later versions will build
upon this logic, increasing the complexity of the algorithm used to create the
workout, taking into account the user’s ability level and progression, as well
as grouping exercises and stacking them into what we call rounds.  For example, the Workout Tool/App might randomly
select the following:


Push-Ups


Planks


Squats


Burpees


Then, group those four exercises into one round, having the user repeat
the four-exercise group two or three times, separated by an exercise (video)
that is conducive to slight recovery, then smooth transition.  For example:


Push-Ups


Planks


Squats


Burpees


Jog in Place


Push-Ups


Planks


Squats


Burpees


Jog in Place


Push-Ups


Planks


Squats


Burpees



Developers are also working on the tracking, analysis, and social media
tools that will be available to members based on their membership levels.  These tools include:

Automatic recording of workout details;
including total minutes as well as minutes broken down by body part and
intensity; time and ranking (scale of 1 to 5) of workout (to help members
realize best times to work out) 



Ability to save workouts that were particularly enjoyable.  These workouts will be available in offline mode.



Ability to connect with “Workout Buddies”.  Members can then share workouts with these “Workout Buddies” as well as see when they are working out, and can even send them motivational and encouraging messages. 



Ability to set goals and timetables, which can then be monitored manually or automatically.  For example, after each workout, a message will appear stating something like:






Goal Number of Minutes
1,000





Goal Date
8/1/2013




Minutes Toward Goal
370





Minutes Above/Below Pace
-20






 
The Workout Tool/App is being created for both the iphone and Android platforms.  Our initial focus is on the logic and algorithm behind the Workout Tool.  We will then focus strongly on the social media component, GUI, and overall user experience.


Purpose for Funding


I am looking to raise $25,000 in order to:
Professionally film and edit off-the-shelf full workouts, at a variety of lengths, using a variety of equipment.  Currently, I both film and edit these and would like to greatly improve the quality (lighting, sound, location) as well as hire others for some of the workouts.




Professionally film and edit the 30 second videos needed for the UMC Workout Tool/App.  The hope is to have 500 exercises, using a variety of equipment, by the end of 2013.  Currently, I both film and edit these and would like to greatly improve the quality (lighting, location) as well as hire others for some of the exercises.






Complete Development of Random Exercise Selection (RES) function of Workout Tool/App.  This feature will increase in complexity in each future version of the tool.
Complete Development of additional features, including social media integration and collaboration tools (motivating, coaching, and inspiring each other).

story:
The iDerma Facial Beautification System, brought to you by Apira Science, is the most advanced full-face coverage, wearable phototherapy device to be available. The iDerma has been developed to enhance one’s overall skin condition, make skin look more supple and radiant, and diminish the appearance of fine lines, wrinkles and facial rhytids.  

A crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo will enable us to collaborate with you, our early adopters, to get firsthand feedback on design and development and gain insights on your iDerma experience. Your valuable input will help drive the final design and user experience of this exciting new product. We want nothing but best-in-class results for our customers, and we want you to share your cosmetic transformation and success story following the use of your iDerma with us! 

Key features and benefits:

  • Patented full-face visor to cover the entire facial surface
  • 142 red and infrared LEDs with both narrow-angle and wide-angle lenses 
  • Provides consistently therapeutic light-therapy sessions
  • Dial adjustment to accommodate a wide range of face sizes
  • Includes elastic foam cushioning pads for maximum comfort


What's in the Box
  • iDerma Phototherapy Device
  • Protective Goggles
  • A/C Power Adapter
  • iDerma Serum


UPDATE: Our first prototypes have arrived and were displayed at the 2015 International CES from January 6–9!



Our Story 

For over a decade, Apira Science has been a pioneer and global leader in aesthetic light-based therapy. Prior to our introduction of iDerma, we developed and successfully brought to market the iGrow® Hair Growth System, a hands-free device clinically proven to promote hair growth in both men and women.  

Our Hair Growth System is the only wearable LLLT-based phototherapy device cleared by the U.S. FDA to promote men’s and women's hair growth.

This system has been sold in over 50 countries world-wide and is currently available through notable retailers such as:


The iGrow is also sold through hundreds of physicians, medical spas and aesthetic practices and has been featured in numerous domestic and international media sources, including:



“iGrow certainly has a lot going for it. It's hands-free, noninvasive, and boasts no known side effects…” – CNET

“Scientifically speaking, LLLT is a rather effective hair growth treatment process…I must say that I did find that the hair that I do have felt a little fuller…” – Wearable Tech World


Why iDerma?


What the iGrow® Hair Growth System has already accomplished for hair growth, the iDerma Facial Beautification System will be doing to improve skin condition. iDerma solves many of the problems associated with conventional facial phototherapy treatments, such as lack of sufficient output and consistency of treatment. With just three 10 minute sessions per week, skin should start to look more youthful and supple, after eight weeks.  Following the initial eight weeks, continue to use iDerma once or twice per week to continue to improve and maintain enhanced skin tone and condition.

iDerma is the perfect alternative to hand-held, low-level light therapy (LLLT) and tabletop systems, whose inconvenient usage characteristics diminish the beneficial effects of phototherapy treatments.  Both the 660nm and 940nm wavelengths used in the iDerma system have been shown to enhance the appearance of the skin, as well as increase the production of collagen. iDerma provides all of the benefits of a high-priced photofacial for a fraction of the cost of clinic-based therapy systems.

What Will It Do?

Improves the Condition of Aging Skin
Widely used by skin care professionals in spas, salons and medical offices, red LED light therapy reverses and improves the visible signs of aging by stimulating deep cellular regeneration. It also helps heal redness and inflammation associated with acne blemishes, leaving the skin refreshed, toned and clear.

Another factor that makes iDerma effective is it’s use of Derma Pulse Technology™, a patented, proprietary function that allows the red and infrared light sources to penetrate deeper into the underlying skin to provide more effective, lasting results.

The iDerma Facial Beautification System designed to:

  • Minimize fine lines and wrinkles
  • Diminish crow’s feet
  • Heal red and inflamed blemishes
  • Improve skin texture and tone
  • Lighten freckles and age spots
  • Reduce pore size


Enhances the Effectiveness of Your Skin Care Products

Extensive clinical research has proven that combining red light therapy with the specially formulated peptide preparations (such as the iDerma Light Activating Serum) can enhance wrinkle reduction and lead to an exceptional improvement in sagging skin, hyperpigmentation, and skin texture and tone. By helping your current skin care products penetrate deeper below the surface of the skin, the iDerma Facial Beautification System can also enhance their performance.

Before-and-After: Potential Results*

*Results shown above are illustrative and reflect anticipated improvements from proper use. Actual results will vary and will be based on environmental, behavioral and genetic factors.

Problems with Traditional LLLT Treatments for Skin

There are currently a number of different ways that LLLT is administered to the face, but they all have significant shortfalls in providing effective and consistent results. Here are the three main delivery methods:

1. Hand Held Devices – Perhaps the most common form of phototherapy is the hand-held system.  These types of systems are extremely burdensome and difficult to use requiring the user to manually move the device across the entire face surface.  While these units do get results, they traditionally have minimal output, which will produce fewer results than units with more surface coverage. 


2. Clinical LLLT Systems – These typically provide significantly higher output and are usually found in the offices of physicians, aesthetics practices and beauty salons.  They provide full-surface coverage, but use is limited to appointed times. Protocols typically consist of one to two treatments per week for several weeks, and then treatment is discontinued, denying the user of the full, ongoing benefits of facial LLLT. 


3. Tabletop Home Use Systems. These units consist of panels of LEDs that are stand-alone units that sit on a tabletop or vanity.  Though of higher output than hand-held products, these units require the user to find a comfortable position where the lights can shine onto the treatment surface.  Since the beam size of the LEDs is typically weaker with distance, these units do not provide consistency of use and therefore will not produce optimum, consistent results. 


A 360º View of iDerma


How Do You Use it?

Basic Instructions for Use 

  1. Position iDerma on head, adjust straps and fitting. Keep face mask in “up” position.
  2. Place protective eyewear over eyes and rotate visor down over face.
  3. Turn on iDerma, sit back, and relax for 10 minutes!
  4. Your session is done!
The steps are outlined in this video below:

    Product Details

    How Low-Level Light Therapy Works 
    Wavelengths of red light (at 650-670nm) have been shown to help improve the skin’s barrier function by strengthening its ability to retain key elements it needs to heal and generate new collagen after its production has slowed due to age or cumulative damage. Red light low-level LEDs are also believed to target the skin’s oil glands to reduce cytokines, a class of pro-inflammatory substances believed to play a role in chronic acne.

    Low-level red light is effective in helping to reduce signs of aging, including fine lines and wrinkles. This wavelength appears to be a popular choice for those struggling with both acne and wrinkles. There is minimal risk of side effects, especially when used without light-activating chemicals. Many dermatologists heavily rely on low-level red light therapy to treat rhytids (wrinkles), rosacea, scarring and eczema.

    To treat facial fine lines and wrinkles, the iDerma Facial Beautification System will administer low-level red light at 650 to 670nm. This wavelength range of red light causes the cells to produce chemicals called cytokines, which then trigger the fibroblasts or collagen-producing cells, that in turn help heal the skin and plump up problem areas.


    Q & A:

    How does this compare to topicals:
    The iDerma Facial Beautification System is a one-time investment that treats the underlying cause rather than temporarily and superficially improving the skin's appearance.

    Do you need to use the included iDerma serum for the light therapy mask to work?
    The iDerma LED Mask is effective and will produce positive results independent of any serums or creams.

    How long should I use this?
    After the initial eight-week treatment period, a maintenance program ensures long-lasting results from the iDerma Facial Beautification System. We suggest treating once or twice per week or as needed.

    How long does it take to see results?
    For some users, the skin looks and feels improved after several treatments; smoother and more hydrated, skin takes on a natural radiant glow. Individual results will vary. The average user will show the most benefit after the initial eight-week treatment period.

    What is an LED Facial?  
    An LED Facial is a technology-based skin treatment that uses specific wavelengths of natural light energy to restore skin’s normal, healthy activity. 

    How does it work? 
    The energy delivered by the red and infrared light-emitting diodes (LEDs) enhances cellular metabolism.  This in turn stimulates the body to build new collagen, increase circulation, and improve the functioning of the lymphatic system.  The result is younger, healthier-looking skin.  

    Is there proof that this technology works?  
    Clinical studies, scientific and medical research, independent testing and patient testimonials exist to prove the efficacy of light therapy. Research conducted by NASA’s space program has proven that near-infrared LED light therapy promotes wound healing and human tissue growth. 

    Are there any adverse effects from this treatment?  
    No. This treatment has no adverse reactions and no down-time.  LED-emitting devices are classified by the FDA as possessing “non-significant risk” because they are completely safe and possess no possibility of harm from over-exposure.  

    Is the process abrasive or painful?  
    No. LED treatment is a gentle, painless, safe, non-invasive and non-abrasive treatment.  

    What is the recommended schedule for iDerma treatment?  
    Recommended use for the iDerma is 10 minutes three times per week for eight weeks followed by regular maintenance of once or twice per week.

    Is iDerma therapy a good complement to other skin care treatments?  
    Absolutely! It helps strengthen and rejuvenate the skin at a cellular level so it amplifies the results achieved in any facial treatment.  

    Can I put my make-up back on immediately?  
    Yes, there is no downtime with this treatment.  

    Can I go out in the sun after this treatment?  
    Yes, the treatment does not increase photosensitivity.  It is recommended that you apply a broad-spectrum UVA and UVB sunscreen every day.  Sunscreen should be applied after every treatment.  

    Does this work for everyone?  
    While almost everyone can benefit from the use of light therapy, these treatments will have the greatest impact on skin with sluggish metabolism and slow cellular activity showing visible signs of aging.  Contraindications for light therapy include pregnancy and epilepsy, photoallergy, and medications that cause light sensitivity (such as Tetracycline). Also, if you are currently taking steroids or cortisone injections, you should not receive light therapy.

    I am not sure iDerma will properly fit my head. Does the headband adjust?
    The iDerma device is fully adjustable to accommodate a wide range of sizes, using a dial adjustment to increase or decrease the diameter of the strap that secures the visor to the head and face. To ensure optimum comfort and a fully customized fit, the iDerma is also equipped with elastic foam cushioning pads that are customer-applied.

    Why INDIEGOGO?

    While we do sell our products online, Apira Science is first and foremost a product development and technology company.  The majority of our global business is facilitated through our worldwide distribution partners.  A crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo will enable us to have a one-on-one relationship with our initial supporters and users to get firsthand feedback on design and development and their iDerma experience.  Since our primary focus is improving one's skin condition, there is nothing better than a letter or photo from one of our users that shows the cosmetic transformation they experience following the use of your iDerma product. Since we launched iGrow, we have received hundreds of letters of thanks from consumers who have successfully conquered their hair-loss challenges and with iDerma we want to have immediate access to the success stories that we're a part of. 

    LLLT is an amazing technology with myriad of benefits.  LLLT devices can help heal wounds, relieve pain, re-grow hair and treat a wide range of skin-related conditions from wrinkles and acne to sun and age spots.  We have built our business on developing and patenting unique applications that make phototherapy a pleasant experience, as strong user compliance leads to long lasting aesthetic results.


    Our Team

    Apira’s management combines decades of experience in both the research and development of Low Level Light Therapy based technologies and devices.  In addition to our highly qualified management team, our product development team includes some of the most credentialed mechanical and optical engineers, regulatory consultants and research physicians in the field of Low Level Light Therapy.

“iGrow certainly has a lot going for it. It's hands-free, noninvasive,
and boasts no known side effects…” – CNET
“Scientifically speaking, LLLT is a rather effective hair growth
treatment process…I must say that I did find that the hair that I do have felt
a little fuller…” – Wearable Tech World

Why iDerma?
What the iGrow® Hair Growth System has already accomplished for hair growth, the iDerma Facial
Beautification System will be doing to improve skin condition. iDerma solves many of the problems
associated with conventional facial phototherapy treatments, such as lack of
sufficient output and consistency of treatment. 
With just three 10 minute
sessions per week, skin should start to look more youthful and
supple, after eight weeks. 
Following the initial eight weeks, continue to use iDerma once or twice per week to continue to
improve and maintain enhanced skin tone and condition.
iDerma is the perfect alternative to hand-held, low-level light therapy (LLLT) and tabletop systems, whose inconvenient usage characteristics diminish the beneficial effects of phototherapy treatments.  Both the 660nm and 940nm wavelengths used in the iDerma system have been shown to enhance the appearance of the skin, as well as increase the production of collagen. iDerma provides all of the benefits of a high-priced photofacial for a fraction of the cost of clinic-based therapy systems.
What Will It Do?
Improves the
Condition of Aging SkinWidely
used by skin care professionals in spas, salons and medical offices, red LED
light therapy reverses and improves the visible signs of aging by stimulating
deep cellular regeneration. It also helps heal redness and inflammation
associated with acne blemishes, leaving the skin refreshed, toned and clear.
Another factor that makes iDerma effective is it’s use of Derma
Pulse Technology™, a patented, proprietary function that allows the red and
infrared light sources to penetrate deeper into the underlying skin to provide more effective, lasting results.
The iDerma Facial Beautification System designed to:

Minimize fine lines and wrinkles

Diminish crow’s feet

Heal red and inflamed blemishes

Improve skin texture and tone

Lighten freckles and age spots

Reduce pore size






Enhances the
Effectiveness of Your Skin Care ProductsExtensive clinical research has proven that combining red light therapy
with the specially formulated peptide preparations (such as the iDerma Light Activating Serum) can enhance wrinkle reduction and lead to an exceptional improvement in
sagging skin, hyperpigmentation, and skin texture and tone. By helping your current skin care products penetrate deeper below the surface of the skin, the iDerma Facial
Beautification System can also enhance their performance.
Before-and-After: Potential
Results*






*Results shown above are illustrative and reflect
anticipated improvements from proper use. Actual results will vary and will be
based on environmental, behavioral and genetic factors.


Problems with Traditional
LLLT Treatments for Skin
There are currently a number of different ways that LLLT is administered
to the face, but they all have significant shortfalls in providing effective
and consistent results. Here are the three main delivery methods:
1. Hand Held Devices – Perhaps the most
common form of phototherapy is the hand-held system.  These types of systems are extremely
burdensome and difficult to use requiring the user to manually move the device
across the entire face surface.  While
these units do get results, they traditionally have minimal output, which will
produce fewer results than units with more surface coverage. 




2. Clinical LLLT
Systems – These typically provide significantly higher output and are usually
found in the offices of physicians, aesthetics practices and beauty
salons.  They provide full-surface
coverage, but use is limited to appointed times. Protocols typically
consist of one to two treatments per week for several weeks, and then treatment is
discontinued, denying the user of the full, ongoing benefits of facial LLLT. 



3. Tabletop Home Use
Systems. These units consist of panels of LEDs that are stand-alone units
that sit on a tabletop or vanity. 
Though of higher output than hand-held products, these units require the
user to find a comfortable position where the lights can shine onto the
treatment surface.  Since the beam size of
the LEDs is typically weaker with distance, these units do not provide consistency of use and therefore will not produce optimum, consistent results. 


A 360º View of iDerma



How Do You Use it?
Basic Instructions for Use 



Position iDerma on head, adjust straps and fitting. Keep face mask in “up” position.


Place protective eyewear over eyes and rotate visor down over face.


Turn on iDerma, sit back, and relax for 10 minutes!


Your session is done!

The steps are outlined in this video below:


Product Details



How Low-Level Light Therapy Works Wavelengths of red light (at 650-670nm) have been shown to
help improve the skin’s barrier function by strengthening its ability to retain key
elements it needs to heal and generate new collagen after its production has
slowed due to age or cumulative damage. Red light low-level LEDs are also
believed to target the skin’s oil glands to reduce cytokines, a class of
pro-inflammatory substances believed to play a role in chronic acne.

Low-level red light is effective in helping to reduce signs of aging,
including fine lines and wrinkles. This wavelength appears to be a popular
choice for those struggling with both acne and wrinkles. There is minimal risk
of side effects, especially when used without light-activating chemicals. Many
dermatologists heavily rely on low-level red light therapy to treat rhytids
(wrinkles), rosacea, scarring and eczema.
To treat facial fine lines and wrinkles, the iDerma Facial Beautification
System will administer low-level red light at 650 to 670nm. This wavelength
range of red light causes the cells to produce chemicals called cytokines,
which then trigger the fibroblasts or collagen-producing cells, that in turn
help heal the skin and plump up problem areas.




Q & A:


How does this
compare to topicals: The
iDerma Facial Beautification System is a one-time investment that treats the
underlying cause rather than temporarily and 
superficially improving the skin's appearance.
Do you need to use the included iDerma serum for the light therapy mask to work?The iDerma LED Mask is effective and will produce positive results independent of any serums or creams.
How long should I
use this?After the initial eight-week treatment period, a maintenance program ensures long-lasting
results from the iDerma Facial Beautification System. We suggest treating once
or twice per week or as needed.
How long does it
take to see results?For
some users, the skin looks and feels improved after several treatments;
smoother and more hydrated, skin takes on a natural radiant glow. Individual results will
vary. The average user will show the most benefit after the initial eight-week
treatment period.
What is an LED
Facial?  
An LED Facial is a technology-based skin treatment that uses specific wavelengths of
natural light energy to restore skin’s normal, healthy
activity. 
How does it
work? The
energy delivered by the red and infrared light-emitting diodes (LEDs) enhances
cellular metabolism.  This in turn stimulates the body to build new
collagen, increase circulation, and improve the functioning of the lymphatic
system.  The result is younger, healthier-looking skin.  
Is there proof that
this technology works?  Clinical
studies, scientific and medical research, independent testing and patient
testimonials exist to prove the efficacy of light therapy. Research
conducted by NASA’s space program has proven that near-infrared LED light
therapy promotes wound healing and human tissue growth. 
Are there any
adverse effects from this treatment?  No. This treatment has no adverse reactions and no down-time.  LED-emitting devices are classified by the FDA as possessing
“non-significant risk” because they are completely safe and
possess no possibility of harm from over-exposure.  
Is the process
abrasive or painful?  No. LED treatment is a gentle, painless, safe, non-invasive and non-abrasive
treatment.  
What is the
recommended schedule for iDerma treatment?  

Recommended use for the
iDerma is 10 minutes three times per week for eight weeks followed by regular
maintenance of once or twice per week.
Is iDerma therapy a
good complement to other skin care treatments?  
Absolutely! It helps strengthen and rejuvenate the skin at a cellular
level so it amplifies the results achieved in any facial treatment.  
Can I put my
make-up back on immediately?  
Yes, there is no downtime with this treatment.  
Can I go out in the
sun after this treatment?  
Yes, the treatment does not increase photosensitivity.  It is recommended
that you apply a broad-spectrum UVA and UVB sunscreen every day. 
Sunscreen should be applied after every treatment.  
Does this work for
everyone?  
While almost everyone can benefit from the use of light therapy, these
treatments will have the greatest impact on skin with sluggish metabolism and
slow cellular activity showing visible signs of aging. 
Contraindications for light therapy include pregnancy and epilepsy,
photoallergy, and medications that cause light sensitivity (such as
Tetracycline). Also, if you are currently taking steroids or cortisone
injections, you should not receive light therapy.
I
am not sure iDerma will properly fit my head. Does the headband adjust?
The iDerma device is fully adjustable to accommodate a wide range of sizes, using
a dial adjustment to increase or decrease the diameter of the strap that
secures the visor to the head and face. To ensure optimum comfort and a fully customized
fit, the iDerma is also equipped with elastic foam cushioning pads that are
customer-applied.


Why INDIEGOGO?


While we do sell our products online, Apira Science is first and foremost a product development and technology company.  The majority of our global business is facilitated through our worldwide distribution partners.  A crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo will enable us to have a one-on-one relationship with our initial supporters and users to get firsthand feedback on design and development and their iDerma experience.  Since our primary focus is improving one's skin condition, there is nothing better than a letter or photo from one of our users that shows the cosmetic transformation they experience following the use of your iDerma product. Since we launched iGrow, we have received hundreds of letters of thanks from consumers who have successfully conquered their hair-loss challenges and with iDerma we want to have immediate access to the success stories that we're a part of. 
LLLT is an amazing technology with myriad of benefits.  LLLT devices can help heal wounds, relieve
pain, re-grow hair and treat a wide range of skin-related conditions from
wrinkles and acne to sun and age spots. 
We have built our business on developing and patenting unique
applications that make phototherapy a pleasant experience, as strong user
compliance leads to long lasting aesthetic results.

Our Team
Apira’s management combines decades of experience in both the research and development of Low Level Light Therapy based technologies and devices.  In addition to our highly qualified management team, our product development team includes some of the most credentialed mechanical and optical engineers, regulatory consultants and research physicians in the field of Low Level Light Therapy.

story:
Michelle is so amazing.  What can you say about her that isn't displayed on her facebook page.  She pours her heart out for everyone to experience and we are so lucky to have her as one of our friends.  Her posts change my days and my life and remind me what is truely important in life. 

Michelle's husband fights for our country and helps his wife fight the fight of her life.  Michelle's son also fights his own health battles yet the family continues smiling, laughing, and loving.  Their commitment to God, family, and friends is one we should all look at and support.  Please support this cause as we give tokens of our love and support to this amazing family.

I started this campaign to give back something to Michelle because she is such an inspirtion to me.  My hope and prayer would be that the family could take this money and enjoy a family vacation.  However, this is a donation to them and they may use it how they see fit. 

I can't do this alone, small or large donations will make a difference and help to reach a goal of $5000 or beyond for this amazing family.

Please consider this a gift as Michelle didn't ask for this. I searched my heart and wanted to do this for her.  I haven't seen Michelle face to face since high school but everyday I think of her and wanted to give her a gift and I hope others feel the same.

In Christ Love, Amanda

story:
Our Story

Meridian Tennis Association is committed to bringing affordable public tennis to Meridian, Idaho.  A practice wall would be a great first step towards enhancing the tennis experience in Meridian.  Hitting against a wall is a great way to practice strokes and meet other players working on their games.   Meridian Tennis Association wants to get people enjoying this great lifetime sport and get in the game!

The Impact

Our goal is to provide an affordable year-round public tennis experience. Besides 4 extra outdoor courts, we are working with the city to build 3 "Quick Start" courts.  Quick Start courts are scaled down courts for beginners and players under age 10.  It helps speed up the learning process, making learning the sport more fun.  Initial fundraising will go towards building a wall, and additional money will assist with our long term vision of a permanent indoor facility.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $11,000 to build a practice wall.  That is the first step. 

We then need $1,200,000 to build 4 outdoor courts, an exhibition court and 3 Quick Start Courts.

Finally, we will need an additional $1,000,000 to enclose the 4 outdoor courts--the wall would then be indoor and outdoor--playable on both sides!

Help us get the ball rolling with the first $11,000!  Additional money will help us complete the project and bring affordable and accessible public tennis to the Treasure Valley community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word by sharing this page through your social networks, both online and offline.  If you have any questions about the project please do not hesitate to get in touch.

story:
On June 2nd, Paul Gaylord, an Army Veteran, conatracted the Bubonic Plague after trying to save his cats life. 

Paul had total organ failure, and at one point the family was told that he had no chance of survival!  Paul , after nearly a month in ICU on FULL life support, being the trooper that he is, made it through the worst!

Paul, a welder by trade, will lose ALL of his fingers & at least the tips of his toes due to this horrible illness.  He will have to relearn to walk, eat, dress & bath himself, etc...in order to function in life, requiring tha assistance of a wheelchair & walker.

He was so severly septic & developed toxic shock as a result of this illness, however has since overcome.  He will continue to be subseptable to illness for a very long perior of time due to the toll that the toxicicty took on him immune system.

He currently resides in a single wide trailer that was manufactured in the early 70's.  The roof leaks & the ceiling panels are falling down.  There are mold issues & mouse infestation problems.

It is not possible to renovate his existing residence to ADA compliance due to it;'s age, as well as how it was built.  Besides modifications, he needs a safe & healthy enviroment to heal in.  In effort, his family is trying to build him a very small ADA compliant home, funded in part by donation.

Family is asking for not only monetary donations, but pleadges for building materials, products & supplies as well.  Pledges for these items may be sent via email to donatetopaul@aol.com

Let's help get this Veteran a new HOME!  He served our country with honor & courage & now it's time to repay him.

story:
Our Story

Dr. Jacob Liberman and technologist Kent Noonan are developing a revolutionary product that will evaluate how light interacts with the eye and use that information to apply selected wavelengths of light to the body. This system will provide an entirely new way of evaluating and optimizing wellness. Dr. Liberman is the author of Light: Medicine of the Future, Take off your Glasses and see, and Wisdom From an Empty Mind, and inventor of the EYEPORT Vision Training System. You can Google or YouTube Dr. Jacob Liberman or visit www.exerciseyoureyes.com.

The Impact

Our project will be the foundation of an entirely new science, providing a non-medical and non-intrusive technology capable of optimizing wellness. 

What We Need & What You Get

Although this campaign is seeking $25,000, the actual financial requirement for the initial phase of the project is $115,000 ($29,000 for hardware and equipment and $86,000 for labor). These funds will allow us to create a prototype that can demonstrate and prove the concept. Below is a breakdown of how the funds will be used. 

Initial Prototype and Investigation

Required materials

1. Electronic parts - $2000

2. Optical requirements - $4,300 (basic spectrophotometer, slit-lamp bio-microscope, diffusers, lens systems, fiber optic cables, etc.)

3. Physiological monitoring system - $1,700

 

Labor

1. Software - $5,000

2. Design, testing, and development - $18,000

 

Product Development

 

Required materials

1. Circuit boards - $2,000

2. Parts - $4,000

3. High-grade spectrophotometer with improved sensitivity and resolution, optics - $15,000

 

Labor

1. Software, user interface, treatment protocols - $20,000

2. Engineering, testing, evaluation - $19,000

3. Studies with live subjects to develop treatment protocols - $24,000

story:
Northern Michigan Community Response to Overdose film and discussion night is put together by locals who are very concerned about the community lack of awareness of overdose and innovative strategies to prevent overdose.

We have seen the impact of some of these strategies- such as take home naloxone, fixed site prescription disposal, and community generated awareness campaigns- in other locations.  Before another member of our community dies, we need to consider some of these effective strategies.  

So, we asked experts and affected parties from all over the state and country to take the time and join us for this event.  Everyone is taking time off work and has gotten here on their own dime.  We are asking for contributions to help offset that cost.

Here's a review of the problem:

Drug overdose is the leading cause of accidental death in the United States, causing more deaths than motor vehicle crashes. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), overdose rates have increased roughly five-fold since 1990.The CDC attributes the rise in drug overdose deaths to a higher use of prescription painkillers and increasing numbers of overdoses of cocaine and prescription sedatives. In 2008, the most recent year for which data is available, the CDC reports 36,500 poisoning deaths in the United States.

Providing overdose prevention, recognition, and response education to drug users and their neighbors, friends, families, and the service providers who work with them is a harm reduction intervention that saves lives. Opioid overdoses are particularly amenable to intervention because risk factors are well-understood and there is a safe antidote - naloxone.

We think naloxone a really important part of the solution:

According to a survey conducted in 2010 by the Harm Reduction Coalition of known naloxone distribution programs, between 1996 and June 2010, a total of 53,339 individuals have been trained and given naloxone as a result of the work of programs the US. These 48 take-home naloxone programs, spread over 200+ sites in 15 US states, have received reports of 10,194 overdose reversals using naloxone.  Michigan had 3 programs, now it has 1, none are in Northern Michigan.

Other ways that you can get involved:

Ask your local public health department about naloxone distribution programs- suggest that they begin one.  This is a website with good information

Talk with your doctor about prescribing naloxone.  S/he might not be familiar with the practice, but here is a lot of good information for prescribers. 

Join (or start!) your local substance abuse task force

Organize (or join) an overdose vigil in honor of International Overdose Awareness Day every August 31st

story:
My friend Edgar Alexander Hurtado was the passenger in a terrible accident on March 24th, 2014 (http://www.theindychannel.com/news/local-news/p...). He is in critical condition at Eskanzi Hospital here in Indianapolis with a number of disabling injuries. He has suffered a broken neck and severe damage to his spinal cord which has left him paralyzed from the chest down.

Edgar has always been the most positive person one could meet. He was a passionate skate boarder and an even more passionate friend. I am asking for the community at large to be positive for him now. A little help could go a long way.

This fundraiser I am starting will go towards an intense and lengthy rehabilitation as well as assistance in the numerous medical supplies he will need. 100% of the funds raised will go directly to him and his family.

If you feel in your heart that you should donate to this cause, I urge you to do so. Regardless, the least I can ask for is to keep my friend and his family in your thoughts and prayers. Thank you very much for taking the time to look into this cause and any and all help will be forever appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kelsey Hill Worley, and I'm a mother of three (4, 2, and 6 months) from Chattanooga, TN. I have very recently, through social networking, become aware of Epidermolysis Bullosa - The WORST disease you've NEVER heard of. As a mother, it shattered me to realize this disease exists, and that these children suffer as greatly as they do. It devestates me to see their parents and loved ones suffering, having to watch their children suffer. I decided I wanted to raise money for an organization that can help them - The Butterfly Fund. Please read about EB, so you can understand why these families need our help so desperately!!

Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB). EB is a rare genetic skin disease (affecting only 1 out of 50,000 births). In this condition, there is a defect in the connective tissue of the skin and mucous membranes that causes the skin to be so fragile that the slightest friction, minor injury, heat, rubbing, or scratching causes severe blistering —inside (such as the mouth, stomach, esophagus) and outside the body. These blisters can cause serious, sometimes fatal problems, when they become infected. The systemic and repetitive nature of the blistering leads to blindness, swallowing and breathing difficulties, scarring, infection, disfigurement, disability and dehydration. Ultimately, such devastating effects can produce a high rate of mortality. In fact, 87% of babies born with one of the more severe forms of EB do not live more than 12 months. There is NO cure for this horrific disease. Sufferers of EB have compared the sores with third-degree burns. They live in unthinkable pain. 

With skin as fragile as butterfly wings, EB patients are dubbed “Butterfly Children." On the outside, physical wounds and limitations brought on by this disorder prevent them from normal daily activities enjoyed by other children. On the inside, their dreams are the same as any child who loves, plays, learns and grows despite the pain and impediment caused by their disease.

The following is what it’s like to be diagnosed with one of the more severe forms of EB:

Imagine… 

•a child with painful wounds similar to burns covering most of his or her body.
•having to wrap each tiny little infant finger with Vaseline gauze and then cover it with gauze to prevent the hand from scarring, webbing and contracting.
•never being able to hold your child tight because if you did, their skin would blister or shear off.
•a child who will never know what it’s like to run, skip or jump, or to play games with other children because even the slightest physical contact will injure his or her skin.
•a child who screams out each time it is bathed because the water touching its open wounds creates incredible pain.
•a diet of only liquids or soft foods because blistering and scarring occur in the esophagus.
•an active baby with his knees soaked in blood from the normal act of crawling.
•a teenager with stumps for hands, the affected fingers scarred/healed together.

For personal EB stories (to get a glimpse of the suffering EB families endure) check out this page:

http://irefuseeb.org/join-the-movement-2/bring-awareness-to-your-community/

For more information and resources regarding EB, check out these sites-

http://www.thebutterflyfund.org/

http://www.debra.org/donate

http://irefuseeb.org/

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

100% of the donations will be given to The Butterfly Fund. 

(http://www.thebutterflyfund.org/)

The Butterfly Fund is an IRS recognized non-profit charitable organization that is dedicated to helping families who have a child diagnosed with any serious life altering disease or event. 100% of the proceeds from their events go directly to family assistance in the form of financial aid, food, housing, clothing & care. Absolutley NO salaries are paid.

The first 50 contributors who donate $15 or more will receive an Antique Brass Homemade Solid Perfume Locket!

Each filigree oval locket pendant contains homemade solid perfume, and is approximately 26*35*10mm, with a 32” chain. Homemade perfume contains organic beeswax, almond oil, and pure essential oils - a combination of sweet orange, grapefruit and lavender. You will love this fresh, sweet, citrusy scent! Rub solid perfume on your pulse points, and enjoy the way the scent compliments your natural pheromones. Your perfume will also exude from your locket as it warms against your skin!

In honor of the butterfly babies, a filigree butterfly charm is attached to each locket. Rubbing your solid perfume on your skin will remind you of the children whose skin is as fragile as butterfly wings – and how you helped them! Thank you so much for your generosity!! 

The Impact

For families affected by this disease, the suffering is endless. Not only are many of the families unable to afford the sheer cost of bandages just to maintain their children's livelihood, many of them also have to travel very far to receive the specialized procedures and care involved in fighting this disease. This can be unbearably expensive. That is what breaks my heart the most about this disease. Not only do these parents and loved ones have to watch their children suffer, but they ALSO have to deal with the anxiety of financial stress just to maintain the medical care necessary to keep their children alive! As if that weren't enough, there is little awareness about EB, so they often feel alone in their suffering, and desperate for support! These precious babies fight for their lives in constant pain - and their parents must muster up the strength to watch it and be strong every single day. No one deserves to suffer the way these innocent children and their families do - and no one is stronger than they are. They are true heroes!!! There is valuable research being done for the purpose of finding a cure. Until there is a cure, The Butterfly Fund is committed to helping these families! Donations are used to help these families with travel, accomodations, medical expenses, bandages and supplies, and any other needs they may have. Until there is a cure, our financial support can make things easier on these precious, suffering families! As a mother of three healthy children, I feel a deep responsibility to DO something!! Donate only $15 (or more) and you will receive a beautiful solid perfume-filled locket with a butterfly charm to remind you of your generosity! :) All you have to do is provide your name and address in the donation process. Will you help me help the Butterfly Babies?!

Other Ways You Can Help

Check out these pages for additional donation opportunities, and to support EB research! 

http://www.thebutterflyfund.org/

http://www.debra.org/donate

http://irefuseeb.org/

If you're unable to contribute financially, will you contribute to the cause by sharing this page on your facebook, and/or other social networking sites? Thank you so much!! :)
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Kelsey Hill Worley, and I'm a mother of three (4, 2, and 6 months) from Chattanooga, TN. I have very recently, through social networking, become aware of Epidermolysis Bullosa - The WORST disease you've NEVER heard of. As a mother, it shattered me to realize this disease exists, and that these children suffer as greatly as they do. It devestates me to see their parents and loved ones suffering, having to watch their children suffer. I decided I wanted to raise money for an organization that can help them - The Butterfly Fund. Please read about EB, so you can understand why these families need our help so desperately!!
Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB). EB is a rare genetic skin disease (affecting only 1 out of 50,000 births). In this condition, there is a defect in the connective tissue of the skin and mucous membranes that causes the skin to be so fragile that the slightest friction, minor injury, heat, rubbing, or scratching causes severe blistering —inside (such as the mouth, stomach, esophagus) and outside the body. These blisters can cause serious, sometimes fatal problems, when they become infected. The systemic and repetitive nature of the blistering leads to blindness, swallowing and breathing difficulties, scarring, infection, disfigurement, disability and dehydration. Ultimately, such devastating effects can produce a high rate of mortality. In fact, 87% of babies born with one of the more severe forms of EB do not live more than 12 months. There is NO cure for this horrific disease. Sufferers of EB have compared the sores with third-degree burns. They live in unthinkable pain.  With skin as fragile as butterfly wings, EB patients are dubbed “Butterfly Children." On the outside, physical wounds and limitations brought on by this disorder prevent them from normal daily activities enjoyed by other children. On the inside, their dreams are the same as any child who loves, plays, learns and grows despite the pain and impediment caused by their disease. The following is what it’s like to be diagnosed with one of the more severe forms of EB: Imagine…  •a child with painful wounds similar to burns covering most of his or her body. •having to wrap each tiny little infant finger with Vaseline gauze and then cover it with gauze to prevent the hand from scarring, webbing and contracting. •never being able to hold your child tight because if you did, their skin would blister or shear off. •a child who will never know what it’s like to run, skip or jump, or to play games with other children because even the slightest physical contact will injure his or her skin. •a child who screams out each time it is bathed because the water touching its open wounds creates incredible pain. •a diet of only liquids or soft foods because blistering and scarring occur in the esophagus. •an active baby with his knees soaked in blood from the normal act of crawling. •a teenager with stumps for hands, the affected fingers scarred/healed together.

http://www.thebutterflyfund.org/

http://irefuseeb.org/

The Butterfly Fund is an IRS recognized non-profit charitable organization that is dedicated to helping families who have a child diagnosed with any serious life altering disease or event. 100% of the proceeds from their events go directly to family assistance in the form of financial aid, food, housing, clothing & care. Absolutley NO salaries are paid.
The first 50 contributors who donate $15 or more will receive an Antique Brass Homemade Solid Perfume Locket!
Each filigree oval locket pendant contains homemade solid perfume, and is approximately 26*35*10mm, with a 32” chain. Homemade perfume contains organic beeswax, almond oil, and pure essential oils - a combination of sweet orange, grapefruit and lavender. You will love this fresh, sweet, citrusy scent! Rub solid perfume on your pulse points, and enjoy the way the scent compliments your natural pheromones. Your perfume will also exude from your locket as it warms against your skin!
In honor of the butterfly babies, a filigree butterfly charm is attached to each locket. Rubbing your solid perfume on your skin will remind you of the children whose skin is as fragile as butterfly wings – and how you helped them! Thank you so much for your generosity!! 


The Impact
For families affected by this disease, the suffering is endless. Not only are many of the families unable to afford the sheer cost of bandages just to maintain their children's livelihood, many of them also have to travel very far to receive the specialized procedures and care involved in fighting this disease. This can be unbearably expensive. That is what breaks my heart the most about this disease. Not only do these parents and loved ones have to watch their children suffer, but they ALSO have to deal with the anxiety of financial stress just to maintain the medical care necessary to keep their children alive! As if that weren't enough, there is little awareness about EB, so they often feel alone in their suffering, and desperate for support! These precious babies fight for their lives in constant pain - and their parents must muster up the strength to watch it and be strong every single day. No one deserves to suffer the way these innocent children and their families do - and no one is stronger than they are. They are true heroes!!! story:
Lokah Samastah Sukhino Bhavantu

 

May all beings everywhere be happy and free, and may the thoughts, words, and actions of my own life contribute in some way to that happiness and to that freedom for all.  

Veronica and Danielle believe that yoga should be accesible to all, no matter your income, state of health, or where you live. Our goal is to bring yoga to Haiti, specifically to the brave cancer patients and compassionate staff members at a Partners in Health(http://www.pih.org/) Clinic in Cange, Haiti.


Your donations will help pay for yoga supplies (mats, blocks, straps, bolsters) as well as their shipping costs, scarves for cancer patients who have lost their hair due to chemotherapy, and traveling expenses. We will be hosting a donation yoga class co-taught by Veronica and Diana Oppenheim this Saturday October 20th at 5pm at Tula Yoga Studio and 1-2 more additional classes before the trip to Haiti. Cash donations accepted as well as yoga mats, straps, blocks etc.
If you cant contribute here, spread the word on facebook, twitter, or by email!
Many thanks!

story:
This is an update to our request. At first we were not sure of all the costs and what services I would qualify for but now we have a better idea. Our figure is now $12,000 and that would cover travel to a few locations in the US for holistic and dietary healing to deal with the chemo and radiation, and to learn how to prevent it from coming back. Thank you for all the donations received so far.

My friends, I have recently been diagnosed with late Stage 3 Orophalyngeal Squamous cell carcinoma, a big word for cancer on the base of my tongue, and with  metastasis to the lymph node. As you would expect, it was a big surprise. My head is swimming most of the time with disbelief.

How did I find it? It just felt like I have a little something stuck in my throat, like a piece of bread. It is not visible so it usually if found in stage 3, like me.

As with most of us men, I thought nothing could ever or would ever happen to me so… I didn’t take care of myself as I should have, didn't excercise and t didn’t have adequate insurance. We do have government insurance here in Japan but it we have to pay for the procedures and visits first, then submit to the city and hope they repay us the full amount. It is a blessing that my wife, Kumiko works in insurance and she had me get a hospitalization policy that will pay us $50/day for every day I’m am in the hospital, but nothing for outpatient procedures. And, they also pay us back after we have paid for the stay. 

The cancer has metastasized (spread) to the lymph node so the seriousness is stepped up. It is a feeling I’ve never had before. I would like to just run away but it’s like trying to run from your shadow. We’ve all seen our kids do that, it doesn’t work. If it was just me, I wouldn’t ask for any help but I’ve got a wife and 3 kids. Brian, the oldest just finished college, Matt is 18, last year of High School and wants to go to college, Lisa, 17, Junior, wants to be a veterinarian. So pride set aside, here I am.

I’ve done loads of research and my wife, Kumiko and I have decided to proceed with the radiation/chemo as the doctors suggested. The surgery is much too extensive and as the tumor is in my throat, I don’t have time to fight it with alternative medicine. As much as we hate the idea (thank you for all the loving advice we have received and all the eye opening information provided) we don’t want to, and feel we cannot delay the chemo. I will receive in patient treatment commencing the 26th of August for 35 days over 7 weeks, that’s the plan. 

In Japan, our government health insurance covers much but you have to pay the bills up front, then submit them to your local court house for evaluation and reimbursement. The cost is not too high, but with all the testing and continual appointments, and as I will basically be out of work for 2 months or more, our savings are quickly being eaten up.

We are also looking into alternative follow up procedures to offset the effects of radiation and chemotherapy treatments and to prevent reoccurrences.

After all is said and done, the reoccurrence is a possibility as is development of other cancers from the radiation and chemotherapy. I will overcome this situation and I will beat this cancer! We are looking at a few clinics and other alternative methods, all of which cost, and I will be out of work 2 months or more. Sadly, the hospitals will not accept love in leu of payment. Any donation, whether big or small is greatly appreciated. I humbly thank you, as does my family, for your help.

Who am I? (For those of you who don’t know me personally)

I am from Elyria, Ohio, from a large, supportive and loving family. Right out of High School I joined the US Marine and got stationed here in Okinawa where I met a cute girl who stole my heart.

Living on a small island, I have done every kind of work imaginable. I currently independently operate a tilt bed tow truck. Business is good at times, feast or famine. Anyone in sales can relate. It keeps the bills paid.

I am also an independent distributor for Life Vantage, building that in Japan and the US.

Kumiko and I have been married for 26 years and she has always been there for me. God only knows how much she put up with over the years. We have 3 beautiful, intelligent (sometimes trying) kids. The oldest, Brian, has just finished college, Matthew, a Senior in High School is just trying to figure out what school he wants to attend, and that changes every few weeks. And Lisa, our 17 year old Junior, wants to go to Veterinarian school.

What Am I asking for?

The donations we are asking for are to help with the cost of eradicating the cancer and preventing it from returning. We do have Japanese Government Health Insurance but we have to pay first and then they reimburse the cost, minus our co-pay.

Reoccurrence is an ever-present risk, especially for this cancer since it has metastasized to the lymph node. At present it is just in one, but the lymph system is all interconnected, like the internet.

We are looking at a few different clinics that deal with the radiation and chemotherapy, both which are known to result in other cancers later on down the road. With a small island, the choices for quality care are limited so our quest will lead me off Okinawa.

The money raised with help with travel, accommodations treatment away from home. I am going to go to the United States to seek holistic and dietary help for about 3 months.

What ever funds you lovingly donate will determine the course of action that we will be able to pursue.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am hoping to make the best choices concerning my recovery and continued health to keep this cancer in check. I want to see my kids grow and have kids. Isn't that every father's wish? That is why I'm asking for your help.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Your support, love and prayers are requested, also. You can also share my plight with others. Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Sadly, the hospitals will not accept love in leu of payment. Any donation, whether big or small is greatly appreciated. I humbly thank you, as does my family, for your help.

story:
On the 20th July Clint is doing the GB Bolton Iron Man. 

This super human feat involves a 2.4 mile swim, 112 mile bike ride and a full marathon 26.2 mile run.  All of  this must all be completed in 17 hours. It tires me out just typing it.

Clint is busy training 6 days a week in preparation for this difficult challenge. 

Katie’s Helping Hand was formed in 2013 in remembrance of Katie Flood who was Deputy Head Teacher at Kington Primary School until her death in 2012.

Katie devoted so much of her life to helping children achieve, and exceed, their potential. However it’s often difficult for a multitude of reasons, whether they be cultural, financial or through a lack of facilities for these young people to fulfil their dreams, hopes and aspirations.

The fund aims to help by providing bursaries for children to experience new sports, skills or pastimes to give them an opportunity they may otherwise not have had.

We have already approached a number of local sports clubs, artists and musicians who are willing to provide a great start for these young people. This help may range from a tennis racquet and fees paid for a term at the tennis club, equipment and subs at the cricket club, a Gi and karate lessons, assistance in the purchase of an instrument and lessons, to drama club subscription. Of course we have only been able to think of a few of the things that people may aspire to.

We have been lucky that we have had many kind donations to the fund and we hope that the beneficiaries will become the fund raisers of tomorrow to give long term help to young people in the area.
