story:
MISSION STATEMENT

I’m passionate about helping people bring health and wellness into their lives.  Being healthy and strong can become an unconscious practice through micro changes on a daily basis.  Wouldn’t it be nice if instead of slumping at our desk we could find ab muscles, or taking stairs over the elevator could become an enjoyable past time, not an avoidable occurence?

WHAT IS FITNESS FLOWER? 

Fitness Flower is a company dedicated to making Fitness simple, accessible and fun, through beautiful, multi-purpose products.  But more than that, we are a movement to change the way people think about exercise.

WHAT ARE THE PRODUCTS?

The first product is the BATHROOM BEGONIA.  

Six convenient exercises are printed on a waterproof flower that suctions to your bathroom mirror with a sand timer.  The exercises correspond to your beauty routine in the bathroom.  Brushing, flossing, lotioning, blow-drying, gargling, and drying your hands are each paired with important muscle building toning exercises.  It's like getting a 10-minute workout without costing you that 10 minutes.

In each box you receive:

  • 1 8 inch pink flower with illustrations by the amazing Greg Paprocki
  • Directions for the exercises in the "leaves"
  • A Reading Rose bookmark with stretches to be done while lying in bed
  • A brochure with Fit Tips ensuring you get the most out of each exercise
The second product is the OFFICE ORCHID.

Six convenient exercises are printed on a 24oz. BPA free double walled tumbler that you use while sitting at your desk.  The exercises correspond with any desk activities, and the great part is, nobody even knows your doing them.  Leg lifts, desk press, ab lift, ankle circles, spine twist, glute and inner thigh squeezes, not to mention the benefits of drinking more water throughout your day. 


In each box you receive:

  • 24oz. tumbler with illustrations by Greg Paprocki
  • Directions for each exercise
  • A Reading Rose bookmark with stretches to be done while sitting at your desk
  • A brochure with Fit Tips ensuring you get the most out of each exercise

INSPIRATION – WHY DID I CREATE THESE PRODUCTS

After my first child was born I found myself without any sort of fitness program and didn’t know what to do.  Even as a former professional ballet, Broadway and Radio City Rockette dancer as well as a Pilates instructor, the conventional ways of working weren’t working for me.  I even lived next door to the gym but still couldn’t get there.  I realized there was a gap in fitness products available.  I started incorporating strength training into my existing beauty routine and realized being healthy and strong can become as routine as brushing my teeth. 

Athletes train throughout the day in order to stay in shape and improve their skills.  I thought, why not create products that help others awaken their inner athlete.  Micro changes on a daily basis create macro results.  My goal is for everyone to feel the benefits of lengthening and strengthening their muscles without taking any time out of their busy day.  My goal is to eliminate the obstacles and excuses we all have to getting and staying healthy.  If you brush your teeth you can work out.  If you sit at your desk you can work out.  This is how the Fitness Flower dream began.

WHO ARE THESE PRODUCTS FOR?

  • Anyone who does lots of cardio but doesn’t make time for toning and stretching
  • New Moms who would rather not leave their children but still need to get fit
  • People who work at their desk and can't find time to get to the gym daily
  • The elderly who would like to prevent muscle loss
  • Anyone injured and building their strength back
  • No matter your fitness level, there is an opportunity to added strength and flexibility with Fitness Flower products


HOW IS FITNESS FLOWER DIFFERENT FROM OTHER FITNESS PRODUCTS?

  • It’s like having a personal trainer with you at all times
  • You don’t need to depend on gym hours to get your workout in
  • No need for special workout attire
  • No gym membership costs
  • Every product has a dual purpose
  • Ease of incorporating workouts into mundane tasks
  • Is beautiful to look at
  • Helps create a healthy routine
  • Removes obstacles

I NEED YOUR HELP!

When I’m not taking care of my kids, or teaching ballet or Pilates, I am working on this company.  My husband and I have funded the production of the first two products ourselves.  With both kids almost in school full time, I’m ready to kick this up a notch and take it to the next level.  With your help, I can finish production of the next product in our line: the COUCH CALLA LILY (exercises on drink coasters for the couch potato in all of us!), work on a mobile app, and a fitness game for children.

I plan to grow the Fitness Flower brand into a household name.  I want to be the fitness company people go to for the inspiration and motivation to live a healthy life.  It thrills me to hear people say how much my products have helped them!


HUGE thank yous to Jack Coble for his incredible filming, Kira Burt for her creative editing, and our friends and family for their unwavering support.
story_txt:
MISSION STATEMENT
I’m passionate about helping people bring health and
wellness into their lives.  Being
healthy and strong can become an unconscious practice through micro changes on
a daily basis.  Wouldn’t it be nice
if instead of slumping at our desk we could find ab muscles, or taking stairs
over the elevator could become an enjoyable past time, not an avoidable
occurence? 
WHAT IS FITNESS FLOWER? 
Fitness Flower is a company dedicated to making
Fitness simple, accessible and fun, through beautiful, multi-purpose
products.  But more than that, we
are a movement to change the way people think about exercise. WHAT ARE THE PRODUCTS?
The first product is the BATHROOM BEGONIA.  Six convenient exercises are printed on a waterproof flower that suctions to your bathroom mirror with a sand timer.  The
exercises correspond to your beauty routine in the bathroom.  Brushing, flossing, lotioning, blow-drying, gargling, and drying your hands are each paired with important muscle building
toning exercises.  It's like getting a 10-minute workout without costing you that 10 minutes.In each box you receive:


1 8 inch pink flower with illustrations by the amazing Greg
Paprocki


Directions for the exercises in the "leaves"


A Reading Rose bookmark with stretches to be done while
lying in bed


A brochure with
Fit Tips ensuring you get the most out of each exercise


The second product is the OFFICE ORCHID.

Six convenient exercises are printed on a 24oz. BPA free double walled tumbler that you use while sitting at
your desk.  The exercises
correspond with any desk activities, and the great part is, nobody even knows
your doing them.  Leg lifts, desk
press, ab lift, ankle circles, spine twist, glute and inner thigh
squeezes, not to mention the
benefits of drinking more water throughout your day.  In each box you receive:


24oz. tumbler with illustrations by Greg Paprocki


Directions for each exercise


A Reading Rose bookmark with stretches to be done while
sitting at your desk


A brochure with Fit Tips ensuring you get
the most out of each exercise


INSPIRATION – WHY DID I CREATE THESE PRODUCTS
After my first child was born I found myself without any
sort of fitness program and didn’t know what to do.  Even as a former professional ballet, Broadway and Radio
City Rockette dancer as well as a Pilates instructor, the conventional ways of
working weren’t working for me.  I
even lived next door to the gym but still couldn’t get there.  I realized there was a gap in fitness
products available.  I started
incorporating strength training into my existing beauty routine and realized being healthy and strong can become as routine as brushing my teeth.  
Athletes train throughout the day in order to stay in shape and improve their skills.  I thought, why not create
products that help others awaken their inner athlete.  Micro changes on a daily basis create macro results.  My goal is for everyone to feel the
benefits of lengthening and strengthening their muscles without taking any time
out of their busy day.  My goal is to eliminate the obstacles and excuses we all have to getting and staying healthy. 
If you brush your teeth you can work out.  If you sit at your desk you can work out.  This is how the Fitness Flower dream
began. 
WHO ARE THESE PRODUCTS FOR?


Anyone who does lots of cardio but doesn’t
make time for toning and stretching


New Moms who would rather not leave their
children but still need to get fit


People who work at their desk and can't find
time to get to the gym daily


The elderly who would like to prevent muscle loss


Anyone injured and building their strength back


No matter your fitness level, there
is an opportunity to added strength and flexibility with Fitness Flower
products





HOW IS FITNESS FLOWER DIFFERENT FROM OTHER FITNESS PRODUCTS?


It’s like having a personal trainer with you at
all times


You don’t need to depend on gym hours to get
your workout in


No need for special workout attire


No gym membership costs


Every product has a dual purpose


Ease of incorporating workouts into mundane
tasks


Is beautiful to look at


Helps create a healthy routine


Removes obstacles


I NEED YOUR HELP!
When I’m not taking care of my kids, or teaching
ballet or Pilates, I am working on this company.  My husband and I have funded the production of the first two
products ourselves.  With both kids
almost in school full time, I’m ready to kick this up a notch and take it to
the next level.  With your help, I
can finish production of the next product in our line: the COUCH CALLA LILY (exercises on drink coasters for the couch potato in all of us!), work on a mobile app, and a fitness game for children.
I plan to grow the Fitness Flower brand into
a household name.  I want to be the
fitness company people go to for the inspiration and motivation to live a healthy life.  It thrills me to hear people say how much my products have helped
them!

HUGE thank yous to Jack Coble for his incredible filming, Kira Burt for her creative editing, and our friends and family for their unwavering support.

story:
Water4Life - Kangaroo Clean Water Project

Hey friends! 

As you know last year I was working in Cambodia as a Women's & Children's Health Advisor at Angkor Hospital for Children (AHC) in the Capacity Building and Health Education Program (CB).

My team works in training up local health workers and village health volunteers to spread vital health messages and run loads of activities to promote health and prevent common diseases. 

One of our projects is called Water4Life and it's about building BioSand Water Filters for families with no access to clean water. This prevents children falling ill to acute diarrhea, the 2nd biggest killer in children under 5!

I believe in this intervention because it is simple, effective, immediate and we have proven it works! And 100% of your donation goes to production and distribution of the filters!

What We Need

  • Each water filters costs AU$30 = clean water for a family for 3 years
  • The target is $1000 = $500 from you guys + $500 from me
  • $1000 = 33 water filters for 166 children and their parents!
  • Any amount is helpful! If you cant donate $30, anything you spare will still be a great contribution!

The Impact

  • All the research shows the first 1000 days of a child's life is the most crucial window in determining their future! Clean water doesn't just prevent diarrhea, it prevents subsequent malnutrition and susceptibility to illness and infection and means children have the energy to play, learn and reach their potential. Your contribution can help this come these little kids achieve this! 
  • We have already built and distributed over 3500 filters! We've been doing this for years and we have even trained local families to build them!

The results

  • Same as last year I will post photos of the filters being distributed, the donor and quarterly report and the receipt of donation to AHC for the project so you can see your donation in action

story:
Hello, my name is Felicia Jackson, the inventor of THE CPR LIFEWRAP. 70% of Americans don't know or know very little about performing CPR. I invented this wrap due to a personal family tragedy as well as a near tragedy involving my son. 

You always hope you never have to perform CPR but  just in case, I developed a plastic ,disposable torso shaped wrap.This wrap has an attached 1 way valve mouth barrier, embossed hand placements with simple CPR instructions. In times of an emergency you don't need to put on gloves, search for mouth barrier ,or wonder if you are performing CPR correctly . The wrap is AED compatible.

The funds I am seeking will pay for materials,manufacturing cost and packaging. I have a Respiratory Therapist/owner of CPR facility doing the product testing. I have a manufacturing, mechanical engineer assisting me with completing this endeavor. 

Since competing and Winning 2nd place in a pitch competition,several people and businesses have expressed interest in this product. 

Accidents happen. During stressful situations that require a quick reaction time, the fine line between life and death may very well rely on the proper CPR technique....or even the COURAGE to perform  CPR at all.


The CPR LIFEWRAP LLC, is patent pending.

story:
If you missed our online fundraiser deadline of Nov. 18, you can still help change the future of cancer treatments by going to this link and making your tax deductible donation today!

http://novobiotronics.com/Donate.html
(Video above: Human Leukemia Cells Being Shattered with our New Nontoxic OPEF Electronic Technology!)

NEWS FLASH! Private Foundation* offers $10k challenge grant. They will match every dollar donated to our indiegogo campaign, up to a maximum of $10,000 (US).  Please donate today and help us take advantage of this exciting challenge grant!

special thanks to the Shearer Family Foundation for this Challenge Grant!

STOP THE SUFFERING OF CHILDREN WITH CANCER

Toxic drug and radiation treatments for cancer don't have to be the only choices!

We have a better and nontoxic way!

As Featured on National Public Radio (click here to listen)

Skidmore College Professor Anthony Holland discovered a new nontoxic way to destroy cancer cells using oscillating pulsed electric fields (OPEF), astounding the cancer experts, but because this new method does not use toxic drugs , it's impossible to move the research work forward without your help! [Big Pharma supports most cancer research which is based on finding the next toxic drug that can be patented!]

We are at a critical juncture in our research work and not one penny you give will go toward administrative expenses because all of our laboratory workers are volunteers, dedicated to developing what we believe will be the cancer therapy of the future!

Help us break the stranglehold BIG PHARMA has over truly innovative cancer research by helping us purchase vital laboratory equipment!

See Part of The Documentary Film-in-progress about our work entitled "The Cure" (click here to watch)

In 2009-10, I was invited to work for four months in a major cancer research laboratory in Philadelphia (Thomas Jefferson University Medical School [TJU], Department of Surgical Research) to test a theory I had that oscillating pulsed electric fields (OPEF) could destroy cancer cells.

CLICK HERE TO SEE  THE TJU SURGICAL NEWSLETTER WITH A FEATURE STORY ON OUR EXPERIMENTS IN THEIR CANCER RESEARCH LABS.

The top cancer experts in the lab were utterly astonished when my experiments worked and killed 30% of cancerous leukemia cells in repeated experiments!  Their top lab techs also noted we had slowed the growth of the cancer by as much as 60%. They'd never seen anything like it!

The cancer experts said: "if this had been a multimillion dollar drug developed by 'Big Pharma', this would have been considered a 'home run'!" But this discovery was funded out of pocket by Professor Holland personally, not by a large grant or organization, AND because it is not a drug based method to kill cancer cells, there is a kind of 'Berlin Wall' we cannot break through to continue our cancer research.  

BIG PHARMA supplies hundreds of millions of dollars to major cancer research centers around the world to develop ever more toxic drugs that leave the patient almost wishing for death, but no funding for small companies that have discovered a non drug approach to cancer, so we are turning to you, the public, to help us break Big Pharma's stranglehold over truly innovative cancer research!

CLICK HERE TO SEE US SHATTER OVARIAN CANCER CELLS!

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

These are the key pieces of equipment needed to move our discovery to the next stage:

$12,000 Biosafety Cabinet

$10,000 CO2 incubator

$3,000 Inverted Microscope

$2,000 Labware  & Supplies

(above)The lower of two pancreatic cancer cells is gradually shattered in one of our experiments in 2010.

 

Here's the dream YOU can help make a reality: 

 A group of children suffering from cancer enter a pleasant new kind of 'play room' and make new friends. They watch TV, read a book, play their video game, or just chat with their new friends... all the while not even knowing that painless and nontoxic pulsed electric fields are flowing throughout the room and gradually destroying their cancer cells.  They don't feel sick.  Their hair does not fall out and they never even realize they are receiving a new medical treatment, the cancer treatment of the future! 

Our Volunteer Team of Experts:

Anthony Holland: Associate Professor, Director of Music Technology, Skidmore College. DMA, MM, MM, BM; President: Novobiotronics Inc. [a nonprofit 501(c)(3) charitable and educational company]. Discovered the ability of Oscillating Pulsed Electric Fields (OPEF) to destroy cancer cells in laboratory experiments.  Expert in custom digital electronic signal design, synthesis and analysis for biological effects. Member: Bioelectromagnetics  Society (BEMS), European Bioelectromagnetics Association (EBEA). Postdoctoral work: Center for  Computer Research in Music and Acoustics (CCRMA) Stanford University. Advanced Digital Synthesis and Analysis studies with: Max Mathews (the ' Father of Computer Music'), John Chowning (founding Director of CCRMA, Electronic Composer and Inventor (famed FM Synthesis Patent); Jean-Claude Risset (Electronic Composer and founding Director of the Digital Synthesis Division of the internationally renowned IRCAM center, Paris, France); John Pierce: former Director of Sound Division: Bell Laboratories. 

Dr. James Bare: Chiropractic Physician, Inventor, specialist in therapeutic pulsed electromagnetic device research and development, member of the New York Academy of Sciences and the Bioelectromagnetics Society.

Phillip Ortiz: PhD (Physiology and Biophysics) expert in cell biology, molecular biology and tissue culture research and assay techniques. He is a fellow of the American Diabetes Association and the National Institutes of Health. Coordinator of Science Education, State University of New York (SUNY), Empire  State College.

Holly Ahern: Associate Professor of Microbiology, Director of Microbiology Research: State University of New York (SUNY) Adirondack. Director: Center for Lyme Disease Education and Research. [Graduate research lab technician experience in cell assay techniques, Albany Medical College].

Gérard Dubost, PhD (University of Paris, France): Physicist, Plasma Physics expert & Electrical Engineer. Numerous published papers and international presentations on the biological effects of electromagnetic fields and pulsed plasmas. Professor Emeritus University of Rennes, Institute of Electronics and Telecommunications, Rennes (IETR).

 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Check Out These Important Links For More Information !!

Medical Newsletter On Our Cancer Research Work

 http://www.thecuredocumentary.com/

 http://novobiotronics.com/CancerResults9.html

 http://novobiotronics.com/CancerResults8.html

 http://novobiotronics.com/CancerResults6.html

 http://www.thisamericanlife.org/radio-archives/episode/450/so-crazy-it-just-might-work

Magazine Article About Anthony Holland's Cancer Research Work

http://www.skidmore.edu/music/faculty/holland/index.php

Special  Thanks to our Project Sponsors:

• Mr. Peter Walker

• The Rife Forum (www.rifeforum.com)

• Rife Research, Europe (www.rife.de)

• Grayfield Optical     (www.grayfieldoptical.com)

story:
Team Malaysia 

After successfully hosting the first Asian Quidditch Cup in 2016, co-founders Andrew and Charmaine set their sights on the biggest premier quidditch tournament of them all: World Cup. The odds were against them because of the distance, currency strength, and a limited number of team members but they were determined to accomplish this feat anyway.

Fast forward almost two years and they've gotten themselves enough players, several coaches, and a little bit of money. They just need your help in the last leg of the race to ensure that every player who has been training hard for the past year can make it.

This team gives respite to its players from all walks of life. World Cup has been a goal we've been working hard towards and it would be absolutely heartbreaking if money was what stopped us after we have gotten this far.

Help make our dreams come true!

Pictured: the first Asian Quidditch Cup

What We Need & What You Get 

The team consists of students and people who only recently started working. The average monthly salary is RM3000 (632 Euros). We have been hosting events to fundraise but alot of that money has been used for the team and player fees. Here's the cost breakdown of what is left:

  • A return flight: RM2800 (728 USD or 588 Euros) 
  • Staying in the village for the entirety of the tournament: RM1161 (305 USD or 245 Euros) per person

But of course, we wouldn't ask for money in exchange for nothing which is why we have exciting perks in store like our jersey! More are coming soon. 

In Case You Were Wondering...

We understand the community's hesitation to donate, because what if we can't make it after all that? Allow us to ease your worries:

  • We don't need visas, so money is truly the only issue (yay diplomacy)
  • We are scattered across the globe so our 8 US, UK & Canada-based players (many of whom have already purchased tickets) will definitely be there to represent regardless of the outcome of this fundraiser

The matter at hand is whether the 11 locally-based Malaysians who have been training weekly and fundraising at every opportunity will be able to make it. Our players have been scrimping and saving so they can afford the flight but not the accommodation for the entire duration of the World Cup, so every little bit helps. 

History Has Its Eyes On You 

By supporting our journey to World Cup, you'd play a role in the development of quidditch in Malaysia. Attending World Cup would be a major milestone that would put us on the map as well as attract more players, perhaps even enough to create a second team in the country. Additionally, it would help develop quidditch in Asia as a whole, as Malaysia is one of the only 4 Asian teams sending a team to World Cup. 

Pictured: Vietnam vs Malaysia friendlies hosted in February

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't donate does not mean you can't help! You can share this fundraiser on your social media platforms and keep an eye out for updates. 

Thanks so much for your support! ✨

Nadhirah Anwar 
Head Coach

story:
Tea Purenes. Honor Nature. Love Yourself.


Second round of the campaign is due to begin in 2nd part of November. Thank you all supporting us in October.


Inspired by one of world’s greenest countries, tired of harmfulness around us, and willing to change for good without changing habits, we are working to make healthy, good tasting, and easy-to-use tea. Tea mix of classic Asia tea from selected fare-trade, organic plantations, added by tastiest, most valuable, and universal Latvia’s countryside healthy tea herbs and berries. Uniquely packed for easy daily consumption.


A few smaller phases will form each step. Up to 3000 parses will go active during 6 main steps total, including products, product sets, and memberships. The goal of the first step is 11 000 EUR, 1 000 of that, on the first phase, taking place now. Money collected on each step, we will split in 3 parts for investing in next campaign, depositing for purchased goods production and delivery, and for step target realization. The earlier you participate, the lower priced product you get.

We divided research campaign in two parts. We are now experiencing the first step – research, with upcoming winter giving time enough to meet experts in field of medicine, biology, diet, and homeopathy, and start researching effect of each herb and mixing them. On second part, with bigger budget, we are able to find best recipes for Tea Purenes.  Real natural product preparation is seasonal, so it’s not possible to rush. Feel free to get involved with your knowledge, while we are working on recipes and sharing updates.

Business incubator. We were incubated at Valmiera Business and Innovation incubator (VBII) in Latvia, and with help of Investment and Development Agency of Latvia (LIAA), we receive financial and informative support. Thanks to VBII and LIAA, we are able to build our website, inform you about campaign, and create videos like this short movie about Tea Purenes
VBII has become strong driving force and stimulated us to start journey for Tea Purenes. 

Competitions. By actively taking part on competitions, like idea contest Atsperiens, we are going to attract additional funding to develop Tea Purenes faster.

Focused. We know what our company is going to be. All we do, we want it to be:
story_txt:
Tea Purenes. Honor Nature. Love Yourself.Second round of the campaign is due to begin in 2nd part of November. Thank you all supporting us in October.Inspired by one of world’s greenest countries, tired of harmfulness around us, and willing to change for good without changing habits, we are working to make healthy, good tasting, and easy-to-use tea. Tea mix of classic Asia tea from selected fare-trade, organic plantations, added by tastiest, most valuable, and universal Latvia’s countryside healthy tea herbs and berries. Uniquely packed for easy daily consumption.A few smaller phases will form each step. Up to 3000 parses will go active during 6 main steps total, including products, product sets, and memberships. The goal of the first step is 11 000 EUR, 1 000 of that, on the first phase, taking place now. story:
My name is Mark Purser, I am a student and teacher of yoga seeking to establish a groovy little bamboo yoga studio at the edge of the forest in Byron Bay Australia.

 

I have been studying and practicing yoga for a very long time, nearly 20 years, and have long held a dream to create a cool little space to share that love with other people.  I have recently returned to my home in Byron Bay to follow this dream and have been extremely lucky to be given the opportunity to build something in an amazing place close to the CBD in Byron - yet tucked away at the edge of the forest.

With the help of some amazing friends, we have come a long way. My friend and uber-architect Joe Oid has designed an incredible space using bamboo for construction and my yoga buddy Matt Foy, Joe and I have been cracking away over the last few weeks building it.

We have come a long way and hope to be finished the main frame of the construction before Christmas - but the funds are running really low and we would love some of your love to help us get the Tentple finished in early 2017.
 

We need money to finish the construction and do some landscaping as well as furnish the studio with a fancy cork floor and some curtains, cushions and matts for all of our amazing yogis to sit upon.

This is a low budget, no frills, honest as they come endeavour. Just a few friends who are passionate about sharing their love of meditation and yoga, pooling their resources and creating something really cool for others to enjoy.

As a yoga teacher setting our on my career, establishing this space is a big step. I've invested nearly $10,000 of my own money thus far, and have committed to spend more, but my own funds are running very low - and would really appreciate your assistance in getting this project across the line.


Your investment can be redeemed in the form of credit against any yoga classes or courses that I run here in Byron or anywhere else in the world, at any time in the next 10 years. Or if you don't chose to redeem the credit yourself, you can pass the voucher onto a friend who may utilise it, or you can let me know and I will make that credit available to someone in the local community who can't afford to pay for yoga themselves.

story:
Bam is a small, stylish tracker that can be attached to anything that you want to keep a closer eye on. That means that everything from your kids and elderly, to your wallet and luggage can be monitored through the Bam network. When you can’t be there, let Bam be there for you!

Who can Bam be used by?

We have done our best to keep the design of the device and mobile app as simple and user friendly as possible. In this way we hope to make it easy to use by absolutely anyone, from young children, to elderly that might not be as tech savvy.  All you need to do is download the mobile application, and attach Bam to anything that needs tracking.

Bam has a smart button that can be used in many different ways.

- Find phone

- Take picture

- Record video

- Share your location

- Play soundtrack

- Make a call

- Launch a mobile app

- Anything else you might think of

Smart button- It is possible to set up 4 different functions.

Single press, double press, triple press, press+hold

Another way to help lost items and pets everywhere.

We know that one of the most important factors in the success of this campaign is getting the word out there. We want to ask for your help. By doing the next few steps you will have a chance to get some free Bam devices when shipping starts:

1. Comment below any suggestion on how to make Bam better.

2. Share the campaign via Facebook.

3. Refer five friends to our campaign.

How it works.

When attaching Bam to your valuables, you will keep track of them through the mobile app. Through the mobile app you can set any distance you want and when Bam is out of range you will automatically be notified. Your mobile phone will alert you by ringing and vibrating and a notification will pop up on your screen.

Bam works in 2 different directions so even when you leave your phone behind Bam will light up and will give you a sound notification.

Find your phone easily.

Keep track of your kids and elderly.

 

Use the NANO microphone to keep track of your newborn, or just use it to make voice recording/notes very comfortably.

Find your valuables around the house. such as your keys, your wallet or purse.

Have control over your music.

Take easier pictures with your selfie stick by just pressing the button.

How accurate is Bam

After testing and adjusting the accuracy and the battery life, we have achieved an accuracy of 2-4 feet.

Simple design- We did our best to keep the design as simple as possible and the most important reason for this was to keep the price low. This will give us the possibility to manufacture in mass as well as on a smaller scale. A simple design also lets you attach it to anything without Bam looking out of place.

Different colors for different preferences.

Choose and customize your device by selecting which color you want. There are 2 different colors available: Silver, Black

Bam Mobile App

Engrave something on Bam.

Engrave your pets name, contact information, a small message etc. Just let us know what you would like for it to say.

Also let us know if you don’t want to have the logo on it (in case you would like to replace it with your pet’s name).

Every Bam device will have a unique serial number which you will be able to register with on our official website. When your item is found by someone ,they will contact us through our website, and we will know what user to contact about a lost item, or pet.

The funds will be used as follows:

-Beta testing and evaluation

-Final development of mobile app

-Device certification programming

-Production tooling

-Optimization of power consumption

-Creating customer support infrastructure

-Ensuring the manufacturing quality to be excellent

Bam battery life.

The Bam battery lasts up to 1 year depending on usage. To replace the battery all you need to do is unlock the battery holder, remove the used battery and insert the new battery inside (each Bam comes with an extra battery) Lock the holder after you are finished.

Technical specs:

Connectivity: Bluetooth 4.0

Battery life: Up to 1 year

Wireless range: 100 feet

Battery type: CR2020 Lithium battery (replaceable)

Operating systems: iOS; Android;

Why do we need your support

Bam is at a great start and very soon will be on its way to being produced in mass.

We have launched this Indiegogo campaign because we want likeminded people that believe in new products and startups to help us not only by backing the project, but with new ideas on how we can make the most out of this smart button.

Please share your thoughts with us via emails, or the comments section below.

We thank you in advance for your time and support, as it truly means a lot to us!

Production timeline

Perks for contributors:

FAQs

How will this device connect to my mobile device?

The connection will be made via Bluetooth.

What is the range between Bam and the device it is linked to?

You can set any range you desire on the app, so that you get an alert at a personalized range. This distance can be set up to 160 meters.

What happens if I forget an item, but I am already out of range?

This will rarely happen because you will get a notification when out of range, but if it does happen you can view the last position of you forgotten item in your app.

How the Bam community help me find lost items?

If you lose an item and can’t seem to find it in the last location you left it, and you are also out of range the other users in the network help find it. Every time a user is within range of your lost item you will get a notification on you device of where it is.

Will other users see what I have lost?

In order to see an item you must first link via Bluetooth, so even if they help in finding your lost items, you are the only one able to see where it is exactly.

How do I choose what color I want my device?

Once you have picked the perk you want to contribute to, please send us a private message asking for the color that you want. We will also contact everyone before shipping out anything, asking you to verify the color, address and any other information that might have changed.

Please let us know if you have any ideas, questions and suggestions on how we can make this product better for users. We are truly grateful for all your support and trust!

We are also looking for distribution partners all over the world, so please contact us to let us know if you would like to become a partner.

story:
WE NEED A  BOOK ON

        Dance Therapy For Healing Children

                                “Psicodanza”

My name is Verónica Arana and I am from Managua, Nicaragua. I studied contem- porary dance professionally. I also studied dance as a therapy modality called “Psicodanza” and I have been working on this for more than 15 years. In my country, without costs, I have served children and teenage victims of sexual abuse, those with developmental challenges such as Down’s syndrome and autism, and the vision impaired as well. With a sense of humility and by helping others I feel guided by God.

The results for these children have been AMAZING. And this has been a great source of joy for their parents throughout the years. The last work of this nature was done as a training session for the psychiatrists, nurses, social workers and psychologists of the Psychosocial Nicaraguan Hospital, in Managua, to help them implement this therapy with their in-patient clients.

I truly believe that God gives us all special gifts and for this reason I wrote a book that will help “differently-abled” children and their families to achieve autonomy, responsible independence, and a sense of belonging.

A book on “Psicodanza” and its practice does not otherwise exist in Central America. This book will provide effective and easy-to-understand explanations of dance-therapy for children with special needs. This way the child will learn with all of his or her senses. For me, publishing this book will be a personal realization and an offering to Humanity; my gift for every child and their family.

Your contribution is going to help much more than you can probably imagine. Families that cannot afford to pay for therapy for their children will now have a book that describes many things that they can do to help their children, and have fun in the process.

I want to publish 300 books and we need your help. To find out how to do so please click onhttp://igg.me/p/libro-psicodanza-para-discapacidad/emal/4864626

Your help will be greatly appreciated. Please donate as generously as you can; any amount will be happily received. For more information visit:

www.fundacionpsicodanza.org

and

https://www.facebook.com/fundacion.psicodanza

campaign_city: London Borough of Camden, United Kingdom

story:
Short Summary 

Health access is very limited in remote regions of the Peruvian Amazon.  In addition to the environmental barriers to health access, most rural citizens in this area of the Rainforest cannot afford to travel long distances to find care, let alone purchase any continued care if and when a diagnosis is made.  Project Amazonas is a non-governmental organization that has been providing greatly needed care with mobile clinics to several of these communities over the last couple decades. MGY, a non-profit organization that has been working to develop sustainable health education and training with mobile health programs, is teaming up with Project Amazons to implement a community co-developed program based on the needs assessment of four rural communities in the Loreto Region: Santo Tomas, Santa Ursula, Comandancia, and Nuevo Israel. 

MGY’s training program will do more than simply supply health workers in the region with waterproof equipment bags, blood pressure cuffs, thermometers, watches, computer tablets, and certain medications.  It will develop and provide a multifaceted skill set for health workers with limited health resources which we hope will spread like wildfire.  The training will begin with courses on the tablets for the Health Workers (one from each community) to watch in Peruvian Spanish. By the end of the week of training, the training videos will be re-rerecorded with the Health Workers new or refined skills, creating a database of health videos for the Health Workers to begin accumulating as they will train the next four communities six months later.  

Computer tablets will serve multiple functions in addition to providing sustainable health education for continual education and new education for communities in the field.  The tablets will serve functions for disease surveillance, step-by-step health protocols, and as a resource to collect basic health information. Using an open-source disease surveillance application created by ICT-Edge, MGY has developed a similar disease surveillance application which will allow Health Workers to collect data over time and store it to the cloud. The cloud will automatically sync when a connection (via weekly travel to an internet source) is present.  Starting with basic surveillance guiding protocols, part of the training will include assessing and recording vitals signs, logging each step on the tablet, and following guided messages based on input such as "perform malaria assay" after vital signs demonstrate recurring intermittent high fever for several days.

This training program and plan has been developed based on community-based research which included introducing technology to these communities. Although most community members had seen a computer, most have never used one.  As MGY suspected, training with mobile health technology was not difficult, and always incredibly engaging. The use of technology in training will not be a barrier, but will serve as the catalyst to amplify educational programs created by communities themselves in very remote regions.

The week of Thanksgiving 2014, a team of medical students, dental students, physicians, water resource experts, and IT/computer experts traveled to the Amazon to live at Project Amazonas' biological station with the health workers to provide free training and equipment. The water and dental teams worked with the communities to assess how they wished to proceed in order to provide more accessible drinking water and improved oral health over the next few years. 

This Thanksgiving 2015 the team will travel to the Project Amazonas' site again to assess the progress of the training videos and retention of material from previous visits by the community healthcare workers. The team will provide more and updated training videos for the community healthcare workers to use. Please be part of our project and donate.  We cannot do this alone.  100% of donations will go to the health worker training program. Thank you for your time and consideration.


What we need and what you get

We need your help so we can purchase the following for 12 new health promoters. Please keep in mind we are training as many promoters (CHWs) in this region as we can and need to supply them with enough basic medical equipment that will last for at least 6 months until we return.  If we raise enough money, we can meet our goal to train 12+ promoters next month, please help! Below is a breakdown of costs we are currently raising money to purchase.  Most of these purchases are based on refurbished and 'required donation' sales (we donate to a non-profit medical supplier to buy at a discounted price). 

$40 buys: waterproof medical equipment bags necessary for Rainforest environment to protect tablets and medical supplies when traveling to patient huts
$40 buys: 1 set of diagnostic equipment including: BP cuff for adult and ped, adult and ped thermometer, stethoscope, trauma shears, and watch
$50 buys: 1 computer tablet that is used for education, disease surveillance, monitoring, and patient care reporting with an application we developed
$50 buys: malaria rapid assay tests for one health promoter (10 assays)
$20  buys: prenatal vitamins and antibiotics for one health promoter 
$25 buys: analgesics (Ibuprofen/aspirin) for each health promoter

$20 buys: basic first aid equipment including 4x4, ABD dressings, kling, alcohol/betadine, tape, and basic splints

$5 buys: 10 pairs of eye glasses for each promoter (community)

$10 buys: Health Promoter short sleeve uniform shirt


In return we can offer you with: 
Exclusive updates on projects including access to a documentary we are creating on the training program. We can also offer you a bracelet made in the Amazon that will represent the intimate relationship between community health and the environment. 

Upon donation, you will receive a receipt that you can use to deduct this donation from your taxes this year. Please email dsebbs@gmail.com for more information on tax deduction. 

The Impact

This project looks at the literature for the future of rural health delivery, and takes the next step: one of implementation.  You are joining us in combining rural health education and treatment with the development of sustainable skill-sets designed from community input and prevalence of regional disease burden. And by integrating technology and surveillance, we can accelerate the decline of ongoing disease amid very rural communities.  This impact will be incalculable. 

Risks & Challenges

Rural Location: As a diverse team that has worked in these regions, we are prepared to return and provide this training and resources.  Additionally, we are working with Project Amazonas who works in the Amazon year-round. 

Training in Spanish: The MGY team has been meeting and working to develop this project and has made multiple trips to this location developing relationships with the local community. Multiple members are fluent in Spanish and we have been able to efficiently communicate through working on learning some Spanish before traveling and also using translators in the group. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit our website, www.mgyaware.org
Volunteer with us, help us create a local chapter, working to build capacity among health workers throughout underserved regions
Help spread the word so we can meet our goal, we look forward to hearing from you!!!

The cloud will automatically sync when a connection (via weekly travel to an internet source) is present.  Starting with basic surveillance guiding protocols, part of the training will include assessing and recording vitals signs, logging each step on the tablet, and following guided messages based on input such as "perform malaria assay" after vital signs demonstrate recurring intermittent high fever for several days.
This training program and plan has been developed based on community-based research which included introducing technology to these communities. Although most community members had seen a computer, most have never used one.  As MGY suspected, training with mobile health technology was not difficult, and always incredibly engaging. The use of technology in training will not be a barrier, but will serve as the catalyst to amplify educational programs created by communities themselves in very remote regions.
The week of Thanksgiving 2014, a team of medical students, dental students, physicians, water resource experts, and IT/computer experts traveled to the Amazon to live at Project Amazonas' biological station with the health workers to provide free training and equipment. The water and dental teams worked with the communities to assess how they wished to proceed in order to provide more accessible drinking water and improved oral health over the next few years. 
This Thanksgiving 2015 the team will travel to the Project Amazonas' site again to assess the progress of the training videos and retention of material from previous visits by the community healthcare workers. The team will provide more and updated training videos for the community healthcare workers to use. Please be part of our project and donate.  We cannot do this alone.  100% of donations will go to the health worker training program. Thank you for your time and consideration.

What we need and what you getWe need your help so we can purchase the following for 12 new health promoters. Please keep in mind we are training as many promoters (CHWs) in this region as we can and need to supply them with enough basic medical equipment that will last for at least 6 months until we return.  If we raise enough money, we can meet our goal to train 12+ promoters next month, please help! Below is a breakdown of costs we are currently raising money to purchase.  Most of these purchases are based on refurbished and 'required donation' sales (we donate to a non-profit medical supplier to buy at a discounted price). $40 buys: waterproof medical equipment bags necessary for Rainforest environment to protect tablets and medical supplies when traveling to patient huts$40 buys: 1 set of diagnostic equipment including: BP cuff for adult and ped, adult and ped thermometer, stethoscope, trauma shears, and watch$50 buys: 1 computer tablet that is used for education, disease surveillance, monitoring, and patient care reporting with an application we developed$50 buys: malaria rapid assay tests for one health promoter (10 assays)$20  buys: prenatal vitamins and antibiotics for one health promoter $25 buys: analgesics (Ibuprofen/aspirin) for each health promoter$20 buys: basic first aid equipment including 4x4, ABD dressings, kling, alcohol/betadine, tape, and basic splints$5 buys: 10 pairs of eye glasses for each promoter (community)$10 buys: Health Promoter short sleeve uniform shirtIn return we can offer you with: Exclusive updates on projects including access to a documentary we are creating on the training program. We can also offer you a bracelet made in the Amazon that will represent the intimate relationship between community health and the environment. Upon donation, you will receive a receipt that you can use to deduct this donation from your taxes this year. Please email dsebbs@gmail.com for more information on tax deduction. 


The ImpactThis project looks at the literature for the future of rural health delivery, and takes the next step: one of implementation.  You are joining us in combining rural health education and treatment with the development of sustainable skill-sets designed from community input and prevalence of regional disease burden. And by integrating technology and surveillance, we can accelerate the decline of ongoing disease amid very rural communities.  This impact will be incalculable. 

Risks & Challenges
Rural Location: As a diverse team that has worked in these regions, we are prepared to return and provide this training and resources.  Additionally, we are working with Project Amazonas who works in the Amazon year-round. 
Training in Spanish: The MGY team has been meeting and working to develop this project and has made multiple trips to this location developing relationships with the local community. Multiple members are fluent in Spanish and we have been able to efficiently communicate through working on learning some Spanish before traveling and also using translators in the group. 


Other Ways You Can HelpPlease visit our website, www.mgyaware.orgVolunteer with us, help us create a local chapter, working to build capacity among health workers throughout underserved regionsHelp spread the word so we can meet our goal, we look forward to hearing from you!!!

story:
Mi-as dori sa putem pune mana de la mana si sa ajutam o familie lovita de necaz.Luca,copilul lor a fost diagnosticat cu Meduloblastom (grad IV), o forma de cancer.Costurile tratamentului sunt in jur de 50.000 euro,suma mult prea mare pentru aceasta familie.

I wish we could help a family in trouble.Their child,Luca was diagnosticated with medullaplastoma(4-th grade), a form of cancer and the costs for the treatament are around 50,000 euros.Luca has to be treated in Turkey.

story:
Family and friends, 

I am travelling to Kenya for 3 weeks in January in order to volunteer in The Kenyan Village Medical Experience (KVME) project which is run as part of Melbourne University Health Initiative.

The program consists of a few days in a local Kenyan medical clinic, followed by visits to four Kenyan villages and volunteer work at a local children's shelter.

One of the aims of the KVME project is breaking down barriers between donors and recipients. We believe that supporting communities in developing countries goes far beyond just financial contributions. It also involves an exchange of culture, information and ideas. It is about establishing lifelong relationships with real people and recognising, realising and respecting all that we have in common.

I am aiming to raise money to take with me to Kenya. The money that I raise will go towards things like refilling medical cupboards, renovating run down areas, and buying books to restock the library at the shelter.

I would appreciate any contribution, great or small, that you could make.

I would also like to take this opportunity to thank you all so much for all the love & support that you have shown! 


The photograph above was taken by Hannah Szto, one of the volunteers from the program last year.

story:
Let's start with some facts:

  • Over 40 million Americans have Dyslexia, 20% of them are school-age children.
  • 11% of school-age children have been diagnosed with ADHD, and that 2/3rds of kids with a current diagnosis take prescription drugs like Adderall or Ritalin.
  • 25-40% of children with either dyslexia or ADHD meet criteria for the other disorder.

You have the opportunity to contribute to the making of a medication-free, affordable, proven cure to learning difficulties - including reading (dyslexia), writing (dysgraphia), and concentration (ADHD) - accessible to millions of people across the globe.

FOX News talking about Intelligence Integration

http://intelligenceintegrationaustralia.com.au/vids/FOX.mp4

We’ve launched a global campaign to create inexpensive online courses which give access to proven correction techniques to millions of people no matter where they live.

Intelligence Integration has a proven success rate of 75%. Our 2,000 independent trainers have already helped over 20,000 children and adults of their ADHD, dyslexia, and dysgraphia.

Watch Ben and his mom talk about the treatment


But what about the millions of people worldwide affected by these difficulties who do not have access to trained Intelligence Integration practitioners?

With your help, we can help them too.

Who We Are

Intelligence Integration campaign is led by developer, lecturer, and published author Moshe Elbaum, PhD, followed by a team of trained specialists in the practice of Intelligence Integration. He is partnering with e-learning specialists to bring the method online.

Team of Specialists

Moshe Elbaum, Phd

  • PhD in Holistic Psychology from MBMU, California.
  • Published author, including “Intelligence Integration: A Revolutionary Training Program that Improves Children’s Learning and Behavioral Abilities.” http://www.intelligence-integration.com/
  • Diploma of Recognition for “Creativity and Excellence in BodyMind Technique” from IPSB, The Institute of Psycho-Structural Balancing, California.
  • Teaches Intelligence Integration workshops worldwide.
  • Read more about Elbaum here: http://www.intelligence-integration.com/abouttheauthor.cfm?source=left_side_bar
Revital Golan
  • Teacher, evaluator, and trainer of Intelligence Integration
  • CEO of Elbaumgroupe (Nonprofit Association)
  • Read more about Golan here: http://www.elbaumgroup.com/m/1414_1414

Myrom Kahaner

  • Coordination Quality Therapist & Body Psychotherapist BACP, CThA, specializing in ‘Intelligence Integration’ therapy
  • Founder of Intelligence integration therapy in the UK
  • Read more about Kahaner here: http://www.myromkahaner.com/about-myrom.html?mainMenuItemToSlide=1

Antony Andrews

  • Head of Intelligence Integration Australia
  • Read more about Andrews here: www.intelligenceintegrationaustralia.com.au

Advisors:

Graeme M. Coomber

  • Managing Director of Global Innovation Solutions
  • Intelligence Integration Distribution Partner
  • Read more about Coomber here: http://www.gis-innovation.com/

Eran Eisen

  • Founder of Present You
  • Read more about Eisen here: www.eraneisen.com

John Katzman

  • Founder & former CEO of The Princeton Review, 2U, and founder & CEO of Noodle.
  • Published author of multiple books
  • Read more about Katzman here: www.noodle.org

Netanel Semrick

  • Contento de Semrik, International Publishing House, Israel
  • Read more about Semrick here:www.semrik.com, www.bookpublish.co.il

What we need:

$500,000 will enable us to convert all Intelligence Integration techniques, methods and tools into e-learning courses and upload them online. This includes translating the e-learning courses into Spanish, Chinese, Arabic, Japanese, French and German. This includes all production, filming and editing costs, as well as partnering with leading sites to distribute the e-learning courses worldwide and more.

Your pledge will contribute to a six-month professional videotaping of Intelligence Integration techniques. Segments  will focus on techniques that demonstrate and explain how to develop the brain’s neural network to quickly correct reading, writing and concentration difficulties, independently and without the use of medication. Additional funds raised will be invested in the further development of Intelligence Integration iPad and tablets apps to strengthen fine motor skills, the connection between the left and right brain hemispheres, and more. These apps are already well under way.

If we raise less then $500,000, we will still begin the process of converting the methods into e-learning courses. Every dollar counts.

Please donate. Please help us share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Please tell all of your friends.

What you’ll get:

As described above, funders will get 20% discounted access to the Intelligence Integration Online program, or invite you to private sessions and workshops with founder Moshe Elbaum. As importantly, you can become a part of medical history. Together we can change the way the world understands and relates to learning difficulties, naturally and affordably.

Thank you.

Thank you to everyone for taking an interest in our campaign. Please follow us on twitter, Join us on facebook and browse our website.

story:
Our purpose

According to statistics released by the National Safety Council (NSC), There were 36,200 fatal traffic accidents in 2012, with more than half of these accidents being caused by driver fatigue. One commonly unperceived cause of driver fatigue is the poor indoor air quality in the vehicles. It is commonly known that factors such as industrial pollution and CO2 emission have been deteriorating air quality around us. Viruses such as SARS, H1N1, tuberculosis, pneumonia, and influenza survive longer in confined spaces like vehicles and offices. They can be easily spread and transmitted through the air and it is difficult to eliminate viruses due to the very small size. A virus has a far smaller volume than bacterium - most viruses measure 0.3 microns in diameter - sothe virus particle may be inhaled and easily attached to cells in your body. Moreover, 275 kinds of chemicals are found in new cars. Inside a hot idle vehicle, the concentration of chemical pollutants from interior decorations, such as TVOC, formaldehyde, benzene, etc., can reach more than 10 times higher than the safe level. Some volatile organic compounds including formaldehyde and benzene, which volatilize from carpet, rubber gasket and perfume, belong to Class A carcinogen, and can cause a lot of damages to human health, especially to those who are vulnerable (e.g., young children, pregnant women, and people with chronic health conditions).




Through nearly two years of research and development, hundreds of experiments, and dozens of design modifications, this mobile smart air purifier has been developed. We are very proud to say, it is the world’s first mobile smart air purifier.


Our product – AIRSOD - will enable you to have the ability to check the air quality in your vehicle anytime and from anywhere by using AIRAPP in your smart phone. It can automatically turn on when reaching poor air quality level. AIRSOD can also monitor relevant data of oxygen content, temperature, humidity, formaldehyde, dust, etc. Furthermore, it can remove harmful gas, second-hand smoke, pollen, odor, bacteria, formaldehyde, benzene, volatile organic compound, virus, and other harmful particles. It is a silent guarding angel in your vehicle. When a shortage of oxygen occurs inside the vehicle, it will alert you to open the window for ventilation. This will help to prevent driver fatigue and avoid accidents. Additionally, when the air quality is low, the smart air purifier will automatically get to work, creating a clean and refreshing environment for you.


As a novel and compact mobile smart air purifier, AIRSOD can be placed anywhere inside your vehicle. Its solar panel will quietly charge itself, and the environment will be kept clean constantly. Unlike traditional on-board devices with  annoying charging lines, this whole device is a size of a piece of A4 paper, and can be put in various places within your vehicle as well as other common places such as your handbag, on your desk, or in a bathroom.

AIRSOD can be controlled through AIRAPP, and several modes are available:

The first mode is especially made for cars. In the car mode, AIRSOD will automatically turn on when you start the car’s engine. And the mode will be automatically shut down 10 minutes after the car engine stops.

The second is the set schedule mode, specially designed for those who drive on a set schedule. The device can be set on half an hour before your regular driving time, so that you can enjoy clean and refreshing air when you enter the car.

The third is the automatic mode. The smart sensor in AIRSOD will automatically detect the air quality in your environment. When low oxygen content is detected, it will automatically raise the alarm to remind you to open the window for ventilation. Poor air quality can immediately trigger to start its operation.

AIRAPP FOR CARPLAY

Through IOS CARPLAY, AIRAPP can display air quality information in your car, enabling you to check and control your air quality similar to controlling the air conditioner and music in your car.


Furthermore, AIRSOD contains GPS positioning. 

The device in your car can easily help you locate your car. The location of your car can be easily found by checking the APP.

AIRAPP also has a fun sharing feature. 

The app allows you to share your surrounding information on various social media platforms.


1. HAF material with 3M large throughput of air filtered

The first is multiple filtrations based on the electrostatic electret technology. Permanently static electricity prevents the adhesion of bacteria. Through multiple filtrations, more than 70% of various particles can be removed.

2. HEPA filter

The second is precision filtration, which can powerfully remove 99% of the fine particles with diameter of above 0.01 microns in the air, such as PM2.5, smoke, pollen, acarid, etc.

3. HAAC cellular materials

The third filtration can efficiently absorb harmful gases, including formaldehyde, benzene series and other volatile organic compounds, in order to create fresh and clean air.

Benefits for Choosing AIRSOD


Why indiegogo?

We have put nearly a year’s efforts in developing this product, and conducted a lot of software and hardware tests during this period. We want to create a great product that offers excellent user experience.We have now obtained a prototype. With your help, we can manufacture the first batch of products for consumers.And in the meantime you can be first to tryour product.

Here is our schedule:

BETA: late Nov

Indiegogo backers: late Feb 2015

Pre orders: Apr-May 2015

You can follow our postings to get the most up-to-date information about the timing of shipments. We will ensure to keep the above information as updated as possible.


AIRSOD LOVE THE EARTH

Nowadays, human beings are continuously doing harm to the ocean and global environment. We advocate environmental protection and call for the halt of hunting. We want to make some contribution to the protection of the earth, and that is exactly the reason we create the AIRSOD smart air purifier, which consumes solar energy to make fresh air for the users. Our designers have also designed this limited edition of T-shirt. We call on everyone to stop hunting and love the earth. When our products are officially distributed in the future, more new types of AIRSOD LOVE THE EARTH T-shirts will be available for our users. Although our company is small, we’re hoping our effort to protect our environment will make a difference in this world. 


FAQs:

What’s the size of the AIRSOD device?

Featuring a portability-oriented design, it is as small as a piece of A4 paper in size. It’s only 25cmx25cm, and 4.5-6.5cm thick.

How many AIRSOD devices can a smartphone be connected to?

One smartphone with AIRAPP can manage up to 10 devices.And one AIRSOD device can be simultaneously connected with two smartphones.

After long-term lack of automatic charging in the sun, can the device still work?

If having not been charged in the sun for a long time, it can still be charged by connecting the equipped USB charging power cord to any mobile phone charger.

How can AIRSOD be connected to the network on mobile phones?

Just inserteda SIMcard in the SIM card slot, then it will automatically be connected to yourmobile phone.

What systems are compatible with AIRSOD?

It currently supports smartphones with iOS or Android system.

Can the location of the device be shown on my smart phone?

Yes. Our device has a GPS chip which will accuratelyshow the position of all your devices.

Is there a fee for software upgrades?

No,all future upgrades will be provided for free.

If solar power is not available, is there another way to charge the device?

Yes, if solar power is not available, the device can be charged throughany USB  power cord.

to yourmobile phone. 
What systems are compatible
with AIRSOD? 
It currently supports smartphones
with iOS or Android system. 
Can the location of the device be
shown on my smart phone? 
Yes. Our device has a GPS chip
which will accuratelyshow the position of all your
devices.
Is there a fee for software
upgrades? 
No,all future upgrades will be
provided for free.
If solar power is not available, is
there another way to charge the device?
Yes, if solar
power is not available, the device can be charged throughany USB  power cord.

story:
Our Story

Hi friends! I'm Serena Scanzillo and own my traveling personal training business called LEAN ON ME: Personalized Fitness & Health out of Washington, DC. I meet with small groups, individuals, teens, new moms and athletes to focus on their nutrition and fresh ways to approach working out. I started LEAN ON ME in November of 2008 and have since gained a strong following in the Northern VA area...however, being as passionate as I am about fixing the nationwide obesity epidemic; my goal is to reach a much larger audience. 'The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.'

The Impact

Obesity is the plague of the 21st century. Approximately 72.5 million American adults are obese. People have got to take the initiative. Annual medical costs of obesity are as high as $147 Billion. On average, obese people have medical costs that are $1429 more than medical costs of normal weight people. The US is also the biggest Big Mac consumer in the world. The list goes on and on. You've heard these facts before, over and over. It's redundant and depressing, I know.  If you're one of these people who help make up such staggering stats, then please help me, to help you. The truth is whatever you're doing now, may not be working so let your visions become reality and get yourself where you want to be. LEAN ON ME has the potential to reach thousands, even millions with the right funding and team collaboration. My approach is fresh, invigorating, and new. This could be huge.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm starting this campaign as an attempt to become the solution for overweight teens and adults by offering them more--fitness on the go phone applications, extra gear, closer nutritional tracking, food tasting demos, facility rentals, transportation, equipment, program development, and motivational treats/prizes. It costs a lot to provide clients with the necessary things to help them lose as much weight as possible and get a solid foot off the ground, once they've met their goals. Maintenance is huge and is often the hardest part of the weight-loss journey.

I need the funding to ensure people that LEAN ON ME is truly a company one can turn to, in desperate times. We're not talking funding for treadmills, punching bags and spin bikes to be put in a generic gym. We're taking money to give you tools to make your work-out YOUR OWN, in any location. Tools to make your work out challenging, real and effective. Tools to make better choices in the kitchen and tools to reinvent your life.

It's not going to be easy, but I'm extremely determined to get LEAN ON ME on the map and into the homes of families/individuals that have nowhere to turn, no support to implement a fitness plan and no motivation to get up and out. There is an answer. There is a way to get America back on track. There is a life out there that each and every person deserves to live. It starts today. 


Other Ways You Can Help

You can retweet or Facebook the heck out of this campaign-You can also visit my site to fill out the Contact form stating how you want to get involved. Feel free to email me at anytime. I'm here, working hard to get LEAN ON ME noticed and used by millions. www.LeanOnSerena.com or LeanOnSerena@yahoo.com

story:
This is a story about a very special brother of mine that desperately need your help. Kevin is 29 years old and a community volunteer, who takes pride in helping his community every day. No matter if it be a family member, friend, or a complete stranger. But now Kevin needs someone to help save his life.

Kevin is a fun and vibrant individual with a quirky sense of humor. Curious by nature, he is known to ask many questions and is genuinely interested in those with whom he encounters. Kevin has learned to be open to new people, places, and experiences. He is committed to building genuine relationships with people in every community he has lived in and now needs you, his community, to help see this crisis through.

In 2000, at age of 18 he paid a visit to the local Emergency Room where that they ran numerous tests for increasing pain. That would hit them with news that would turn their world upside down. Kevin had only 23% Kidney function and would need immediate dialysis to keep him alive. He was admitted into a room where he would spend the next weeks learning about his dialysis treatment, Kidney disease, and what was in store for his future. He received his first Kidney Transplant after 6 months of weekly dialysis.

Kevin got really sick again in December 2011 which landed him back in the hospital in ICU in a semi coma for 2 days with 2 more surgeries. Keeping him in the hospital for a total of 22 days while fighting for his life. Since then Kevin has been able to stay at home while doing at home dialysis 10 hours a day 7 days a week hooked up to a machine with only 20 foot of hose allowing him limited movement. This hose is connected to a tube in his stomach. With no luck of a donor and everyone who tested failed. To top it all off, Kevin received a phone call from his nurse the last week of February 2012 saying that if he doesnâ€™t get partial payment to his insurance, His insurance is going to cancel & he will have to pay for all of his medications, dialysis and transplant himself. Keep in mind that these are all things that Kevin needs in order to keep on living. We've done some other fundraising including car washes, booths etc but not enough to put a dent in our needs.

Kevin is looking to get this surgery over and done with, so he can recover in time to go to the Power rangers Power Morphicon convention this August, the chances are slim, but positive thinking can heal, just as much as time.

story:
Short Summary

Plattsburg High School’s Class of 1995 has come together, 17 years later, to rally around our friend and former classmate, Jodi Brown.  Jodi was diagnosed with Hodgkin’s Lymphoma and has recently started her challenging path to a full recovery.  As you may know, cancer treatments are the most expensive medical treatments in the United States.   Not only is the financial burden overwhelming but the physical and emotional toll this disease takes requires so much more than money can buy.  Thankfully, Jodi is a strong and resilient person and she is the only person who will win the battle ahead of her. 

This page is to help gather our resources as a class and as a community to hopefully provide some financial relief to Jodi and her son, Carter.  As expected, Jodi has already missed a lot of work for doctor and treatment appointments and there is more to come.  As a healthy single mother, keeping up with a 2 ½ year old son is an already demanding and rewarding job.  Our goal is to help alleviate a fraction of stress from this experience so she can better focus on her recovery, and most importantly, her son.  

UPDATE:

Saturday, September 15, 2012 @ 10 am

The Benefit ride will begin at the Brass Rail, located on 152 Hwy in Kansas City, MO at 10 am, and end at Glory Days in Plattsburg, MO, at approximately 3:30 pm Registration begins at 9:00 am. Registration fees are $25/bike, $15 for an additional rider. Additional stops on the route include Wabash BBQ in Excelsior Springs and Stables Grill in Kearney.

NO BIKE? FEEL FREE TO DRIVE THE ROUTE WITH US!

For additional information, you may contact Alicia Smith at alicia.eddie.smith@gmail.com
 

For those of you who have come across this campaign and do not know Jodi Brown.  The PHS Class of ’95 was comprised of approximately 60 students (I can’t find my yearbook) in a town with a population of 2,400.  Jodi is not the type of person who will ask for help nor is it easy for her to share her struggles.  She is the type of person who will make you feel valued, protected and loved.  She has the warmest smile and amazing sense of humor.  She has given so much of herself and her resources to her family and friends; we are doing all we can to give a fraction of that back in return.  We hope you’ll join us.

Please help us exceed our goal – your support is greatly appreciated!

Sincerely,

PHS Class of ’95

story:
Meet Scott Spence

Imagine.  You have worked your whole life, even while enduring painful treatment for bladder cancer which is the most expensive cancer to fight because it reoccurs 100% of the time.  Throughout this ordeal, you see medical bills growing faster than you can pay them, and watch hopelessly as you deplete your savings accounts and sell your house hoping to stay ahead of creditors.

For Scott Spence, losing these material possessions was not important. Scott knew he had all he really needed--his wonderful wife and family, many terrific friends, his job as a kitchen designer, and most importantly, his health.

A few weeks ago, Scott received the devastating news that a growth on his chest is malignant melanoma.  Fortunately, he has found terrific doctors in Spokane willing to operate on Tuesday, June 26, and also provide follow-up treatment.  However, Scott and his family need to pay for this medical care, and do not currently qualify for any government assistance—because Scott works!

Scott’s friends and family are raising money through donations and fundraisers, and we hope you will be a part of this campaign to save his life. Elton John expresses our feelings for Scott best in “Your Song”--how wonderful life is while you're in the world.  His friends and family will do everything possible to help Scott survive this latest battle with cancer.

What We Need & What You Get

Scott and his family are devout Christians, and they have the support and prayers of a very large community.  While they appreciate this support, simply put, they are in dire need of cash to pay their medical expenses.

They are uncertain of the overall costs for treatment, so we have set an initial goal of $5,000, although the costs will likely be much higher.  All monies raised will go directly to the doctors.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would appreciate it if you shared this page and Scott's story with as many people as possible. Please use this site's sharing capabilities to spread the word about our campaign to raise funds for Scott's medical expenses. Words can't describe the gratitude to all of you who not only donate, but also say a prayer for Scott's recovery.

story: Hello everyone, my name is Tonya and I am 32 years old. I live im Ozark, Missouri. I am in dire need of a surgery that will save my life.  It is the gastric sleeve weight loss surgery. I have been big all my life and I have been on so many diets. None have worked. I have very bad fluid build up all over my body and carrying that around makes it almost impossible for me to breathe. My knees and back are very bad as well. I can not do simple things such as bathing, cleaning, and walking. The right side of my stomach is so full of fluid that I can't reach to keep myself clean. I can't raise my arm because of fluid as well. I have been to doctors and they all agree that this surgery will save my life and will take care of the fluid and excruciating pain I endure every single day. After I get myself healthy, I plan on going back to school because I really want to work in the health industry.  I have insurance but I owe a past bill of 4000.00 and until I get that paid, they won't touch me even though this is life threatening. I can provide whatever else that is needed as proof of this. I have pictures and anything else you may need. Thank you so much.

story:
On January 26th, I will run the Marrakesh half-marathon in a bid to raise funds and awareness for Noujoum – Laughing and Healing, a Moroccan organization that helps seriously ill children.

Noujoum is a non-profit inspired by different European and American charities. It was founded in January 2003 following the personal experiences of its founding members who faced their child’s illness. The mission of the association is to provide support for underprivileged children in hospital in the Moroccan cities of Casablanca and Marrakesh. The material and psychological support of sick children and the humanisation of hospital stays are the main fields of Noujoum’s commitment.

As a side note, my Mother is a founding member and the President of this charity. Her courage and dedication over the years while facing some of the world’s most unfair situations on a daily basis but still keeping hope and a smile have been deeply inspirational for me … and I really appreciate any support you could provide.

Also please feel free to share this email with anyone that could be interested.

Majid

------------------

More details on Noujoum – Laughing and Healing

“Noujoum” translates as “stars” in Arabic,  the main goal of the association is to put stars back into sick children’s eyes.

Noujoum is organizing weekly clown shows since 2003 to help children bear the often difficult and painfull treatments they are going through.

The association manages the Casablanca’s hospital kids’ house where kids can find daily events organized.

In addition to its recreational and educational work, Noujoum provides funding to the hospital for it to purchase expensive healthcare material or drugs.

Finally, thanks to the excellent work done over the years, Noujoum has been chosen to manage the newly built accommodation facility for the Mothers of hospitalized children

Contact: Catherine Sebti - Catherine.Sebti@Noujoum.org

Website:www.noujoum.org (for the latest news it’s probably better to check the facebook page that gets very regular updates)

Facebook Page: most of the above pictures are from the association’s facebook page, https://en-gb.facebook.com/Association.Noujoum Please visit, like and share!

Noujoum is member of the ICCCPO (International Confederation of Childhood Cancer Parent Organizations)
