story:
A TALE OF TWO KNEES (and other things).

It started many years ago - my knees started to give out.  I was diagnosed with osteoarthritis and myofascitis.  The cartilage in my knees was eroding.  I went to my first Dragon*Con in Atlanta in 2006, dressed up, met amazing people, made wonderful friends, and felt I had come home.  I had found like-minded people who understood where I was coming from.  I had to do it again.

The knees got worse.  Yet every year I went to the Con, using a cane, walking with ever-increasing pain to the point where the painkillers clouded most of my weekend.

(me & lovely friend Pierre Bernard)

Then, two years ago, I was diagnosed with diabetes.  That required some drastic changes, including the loss of 70 pounds. 

(2013)

But my knees were shot.  It was now bone grinding on bone and every step was excruciating.  Sleep was hell, when I got it.

But wait!  There's more!  I broke my tailbone.  That just sucked.  But that wasn't the cherry on top.

I had to put my oldest cat, Martin, down on the Summer Solstice 2013.  I still miss my little sun kitty.  Still not the cherry on top!

(Marty, 2013)


Finally, at the end of 2013, I got permission from my boss to take time out of work and get both my knees replaced.  JOY!  I spent three months doing the surgeries - the left knee, followed six weeks later by my right knee.  Then my boss let me go two weeks before Christmas - that's the cherry on top.  So I went through three more months of rehab, gaining back my strength, rediscovering, for the first time in almost a decade, what it felt like to move without pain.

(after right knee surgery)

(both knees, slowly recovering)

In April, Niles, my little tuxedo kitty, had to be put down.  Three months later, and I miss his sweetness every day.

(Sir Niles of Happypants)

It's been rough.  Really rough.  I feel scraped down to my very soul.  Almost like I've been wearing the Ring too long.

Now, I'm able to walk, to live, to experience this once-yearly treat as I've never experienced it before, this cavalcade of awesome people and time away from my troubles, and I'm finding it difficult to come up with the funding.  As a temp (finding a permanent job these days is just hell), I'm making below my normal salary, barely able to pay the bills and keep my cats in food and litter.

(Damn, but I am BEAT.)



THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN. 

Help me start on a new path - literally and figuratively - and get me to Atlanta.  I'll be able to walk with strength, wear a costume that makes me look smokin', and mingle with actors and artists without feeling that I only have two minutes before I have to sit down and wipe the pain-sweat off my face.  This time, the focus won't be on my disability, but on ME, on who I am without the heavy burden of that awful pain.

And with your help, I'm offering some awesome perks - goodies from Dragon*Con including lanyards and t-shirts, and, most exciting of all, signed autographs from some of your favorite celebrities.  How can you resist?  You'll aid me in realizing the new and improved me, and get some awesome wall candy, too.  :)  The money raised pays for my lodging, my weekend badge, and food (a friend got my plane ticket with frequent flier miles!) - SO JUST ABOUT $200 TO GO!!!  No "fun" money, just the basics.

    Your assistance will mean the world to me.  Every year, this convention is my Big Thing - I look forward to it every year, I plan for it, I talk for hours about it with my friends, and this year ... this year I can fully participate.  After everything I've been through, the horrible pain, the illnesses, the broken bones, the loss of my fur-babies, the struggle to keep going, to keep moving forward, Dragon*Con is a beacon to me, where I can walk straight and tall (I actually gained back half an inch after the surgeries!) and be a true part of the festivities.

      Whoops!  Sorry, wrong picture.  ;)


     

    This is me, now.  Rarin' to get out there and LIVE!

    Thank you for your help, from the bottom of my heart.
    And if you can't donate, but support the cause, get the word out there!  Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Vine, etc.  Good will goes almost as far as a good dollar.  ;)

A TALE OF TWO KNEES (and other things).It started many years ago - my knees started to give out.  I was diagnosed with osteoarthritis and myofascitis.  The cartilage in my knees was eroding.  I went to my first Dragon*Con in Atlanta in 2006, dressed up, met amazing people, made wonderful friends, and felt I had come home.  I had found like-minded people who understood where I was coming from.  I had to do it again.The knees got worse.  Yet every year I went to the Con, using a cane, walking with ever-increasing pain to the point where the painkillers clouded most of my weekend. (me & lovely friend Pierre Bernard)Then, two years ago, I was diagnosed with diabetes.  That required some drastic changes, including the loss of 70 pounds.   (2013)
 But my knees were shot.  It was now bone grinding on bone and every step was excruciating.  Sleep was hell, when I got it.But wait!  There's more!  I broke my tailbone.  That just sucked.  But that wasn't the cherry on top.I had to put my oldest cat, Martin, down on the Summer Solstice 2013.  I still miss my little sun kitty.  Still not the cherry on top! (Marty, 2013)
Finally, at the end of 2013, I got permission from my boss to take time out of work and get both my knees replaced.  JOY!  I spent three months doing the surgeries - the left knee, followed six weeks later by my right knee.  Then my boss let me go two weeks before Christmas - that's the cherry on top.  So I went through three more months of rehab, gaining back my strength, rediscovering, for the first time in almost a decade, what it felt like to move without pain. (after right knee surgery)
 (both knees, slowly recovering)
In April, Niles, my little tuxedo kitty, had to be put down.  Three months later, and I miss his sweetness every day. (Sir Niles of Happypants)It's been rough.  Really rough.  I feel scraped down to my very soul.  Almost like I've been wearing the Ring too long.Now, I'm able to walk, to live, to experience this once-yearly treat as I've never experienced it before, this cavalcade of awesome people and time away from my troubles, and I'm finding it difficult to come up with the funding.  As a temp (finding a permanent job these days is just hell), I'm making below my normal salary, barely able to pay the bills and keep my cats in food and litter. (Damn, but I am BEAT.)
THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN.  Help me start on a new path - literally and figuratively - and get me to Atlanta.  I'll be able to walk with strength, wear a costume that makes me look smokin', and mingle with actors and artists without feeling that I only have two minutes before I have to sit down and wipe the pain-sweat off my face.  This time, the focus won't be on my disability, but on ME, on who I am without the heavy burden of that awful pain.And with your help, I'm offering some awesome perks - goodies from Dragon*Con including lanyards and t-shirts, and, most exciting of all, signed autographs from some of your favorite celebrities.  How can you resist?  You'll aid me in realizing the new and improved me, and get some awesome wall candy, too.  :)  The money raised pays for my lodging, my weekend badge, and food (a friend got my plane ticket with frequent flier miles!) - SO JUST ABOUT $200 TO GO!!!  No "fun" money, just the basics.Your assistance will mean the world to me.  Every year, this convention is my Big Thing - I look forward to it every year, I plan for it, I talk for hours about it with my friends, and this year ... this year I can fully participate.  After everything I've been through, the horrible pain, the illnesses, the broken bones, the loss of my fur-babies, the struggle to keep going, to keep moving forward, Dragon*Con is a beacon to me, where I can walk straight and tall (I actually gained back half an inch after the surgeries!) and be a true part of the festivities.

  Whoops!  Sorry, wrong picture.  ;)
  
This is me, now.  Rarin' to get out there and LIVE!
 Thank you for your help, from the bottom of my heart.And if you can't donate, but support the cause, get the word out there!  Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Vine, etc.  Good will goes almost as far as a good dollar.  ;)

story:
A Word From Gabrielle

At A.M., we believe everyone has their own internal wisdom and that the combination of awareness and movement can provide access to that knowledge.

I was lucky enough to begin my teaching odyssey when I was thirteen, working with the littlest of movers. In the almost three decades since then I have been a professional dancer, choreographer and dance educator working with movers of all ages and abilities locally, nationally and abroad. This studio is the culmination of years of learning from my students. They taught me that behind the desire for people to move is most often the desire to know themselves and to be known.

​This type of knowing, this wisdom that I've heard so many of us seeking comes when we are able to listen to, learn from and validate what our bodies know. In my experience, moving integrates the mind and body allowing for the messages that reside below the neck to be experienced. This puts us in conversation with ourselves while also challenging and sculpting our bodies.

 

I need your help to create a safe and welcoming space so this unique approach to wellness can succeed. By giving to this campaign you can help build a home for this new approach to mind-body integration and help people improve their lives and their communities.

 

What A.M. Needs & What You Get

I'm raising $5,000 to help cover the costs of floors, mirrors, new lights, matts and other start up costs.

We’ve got some great perks that range from merch to movement and even a chance to be featured in our first Mandala Dance Project!

 

The Ripple Effect

This will be my third business to help launch! I have successfully helped open a thriving dance studio in East Nashville and Co-Founded a burlesque school, Nashville’s own Delinquent Debutantes. Recently, I helped my husband open his own business, Third Coast Comedy Club.

In each instance I’ve witnessed the community that has sprung up around these businesses and how it has transformed the people that join them. I know A.M. can have a huge impact on our community and eventually go beyond Nashville to benefit even more people. It will be another great place for people to come and discover themselves and each other. The world is a better place when we’re all present and with your help A.M. can do it’s part to get us closer to living in harmony.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’d like to help, but a financial contribution isn’t possible please share this campaign with your friends and family via your favorite socials!

Every little bit helps! I hope that you'll join us at A.M. soon. Thanks!

With Deepest Gratitude,

Gabrielle Saliba

A.M. Founder

story:
Our Story

Karen is a 40 year old woman who has one son. She was told that she has Stage 4 colon cancer which has spread to her Liver. She was diagnosed in October 2011. She is now going to New York to have a portion of her liver taken out. The surgery date is Feb. 28, 2012. I am a co-worker of hers and know how important it is for her son to be with her on this misson to save her life. She has already been working part time and going through Chemo at the same time. We work in retail which can be demanding. She will be out of work for 2months when she finishes her surgery and will go back on chemo for another 6 to 8 months. She will be going between Connecticut and New York.

 


The Impact

Helping her is my goal. Her son needs to be with her. Helping her save her life is what is important here. She could die without this treatment. I am helping someone who is to scared to ask for it. I ask you to please help her and her son. Karen is very active in her chruch and strong in her faith. her son is her life. And i know that if this was me or anyone else she knows she would be doing the same for us.  


She needs $2000 but my goal is $5000. This money will be used to get her and her son to and from New York for the surgery. A hotel in New York close enough to the hospital for her son to walk to. He will be there for the entire 9days with her. The total trip will be $2000. However whatever is left over will go towards her Dr. bills and medicine. As I stated she will be out of work for 2 months and has already missed 1 month in Nov. 2011. This money will also fund her other trips to New York to get back to the Dr for Chemo and other Dr appointments.

Also please PRAY for her and her family. The power of prayer is an awesome thing.


If you feel you can't help please pass the info on to someone who can help. This is a time sensitive situation her surgery is going to be on Feb. 28,2012.

story:
Update: Eric will be having his 5th facial laser proceedure October 23rd. Then we will schedule an actual date for his Facial reconstruction. Eric is going to need a release of his lip and the skin will be replaced beneath his mouth and part of his chin with skin grafts from his hip. For that proceedure we will be there for 1 week for recovery in another state away from family and friends. Our untimate goal is to bring Eric's 3 sisters with us to the hospital, so they can see where he has been going. also we are still in need of medical devices in eric bedroom to ease comfort after this painful surgery. Please... if you can't donate... please just considering sharing the link on FB with your friends.

Eric is a 5 year old burn survivor. Burns were sustained to 40% of his body. 30% were grafted using the skin from his back and hips.We are trying to raise funds to get Eric into healing programs, traveling expenses, and get Eric medical devices for his room that will be beneficial to his healing and comfort him after surgeries. As you can imagine the family has many expenses related to his injuries. They are lifelong. They are something they deal with everyday. Eric will face many surgeries in his life. He has had 7 surgeries so far and will have another major surgery in October. Today you have the opportunity to help the Rodriguez families situation for the better. We thank you in advance. No donation is to small. Every dollar will get us closer to our goal. 

The story below is a short story of Little Erics experience writen by his mother:

There are days in the life of many people that they can say changed their life in the blink of an eye. Imagine if you would for a moment that that day was today for you. If you knew it was coming... would you do anything different? Or if that day was destiny would it matter if anything you did could have changed it? That day for me and my family was July 19th, 2011.

The day began as any other day. My family woke up in the morning. I, myself, was not feeling well and took the day off of work. I shortly after went to the hospital leaving my children in the hands of my husband. After several bags of fluid for hydration, I was discharged and my husband came to pick me up. My husband and I went to pick up our children at my brother in law's house. They invited us to stay for dinner because they knew I was not up for cooking a meal for my husband and 3 children. We gratefully accepted and had a normal summer dinner of hamburgers and hot dogs on the grill. As we finished our summer fun meal it was suggested that we start a bonfire. My children were just finishing up and we were all heading outside. My son however asked for one more hotdog and I gave it to him with instructions to come outside as soon as he had finished.

Have you ever gotten that bad feeling in the pit of your stomach like you are outside of yourself looking in and everything screams for you to do something? But I didn't. I left him in the house to join my family outside... convinced it was only in my mind and everything was going to be fine. What’s the worst that could happen?

I joined my family outside. I walked past the bonfire that my family had already started a few feet from the front porch. I walked down to the driveway to join my sister-in-law. It was a normal day. The sun was setting. It was almost over. Then I heard a thunderous noise and flash behind me. It made my soul tremble. I shuddered as I turned around to see flames as high as the trees. Not realizing what had happened. Then out of the flames I saw my brother in law running. The flames followed his body. I screamed, "Stop, drop, and roll". He dropped to the ground and the flames were out. I was scared but walked slowly towards him and closer to where the fire had been. Then my mind froze again. The flames were moving. I stopped in my tracks to realize those flames were my son. My little boy… my baby. He was crying for me, and I was frozen.

My husband acted quickly grabbing my son and throwing him to the ground. I walked towards him with my hands up into the air. It was as if I was praying in my mind to forget the images that just passed my eyes. I found myself over his body as several people attempted to put the flames out from his clothes and hair. I hovered my body over his. My husband took him from beneath me and carried him into the house. Just then someone screamed to put him in the shower. My mind finally kicked into gear. I began to think that we needed to get his clothes off and call 911. I began in to the house telling my husband to get his clothes off and had the phone in my hand to call 911.

I remember being scared to look in the room where my son was. I was even more scared when I went into that room and looked at him. I had convinced myself that maybe it wasn't that bad. He was only on fire for a short period of time. But what I saw stung my eyes. My 3 year old child was naked with burns from his forehead to his feet. His skin melted. His hair half gone. Tears were swelling in his eyes, and mine. My body shook. I yelled to my husband, "We need to get him to the hospital." 911 operators still had not answered at this time and I was terrified.

We carried him to our van and my husband placed him in my arms. We drove for 15 minutes before reaching the hospital that was 5 minutes away. In our panic we couldn't find the local hospital; forgetting which way to take to get there. We drove 70 in a 30 area... passing several police vehicles who never stopped us. We honked our horn and finally we came to the hospital. I jumped out of the van with my son in my arms leaving the passenger door open. I found a door but it was locked. I screamed in horror. "Somebody please God help me." Just then a nurse leaving for the night came out and yelled "follow me". My husband was a few feet behind.

I couldn't breathe. I couldn’t say anything. I just followed her to an ICU room and laid my child's body on the bed. He looked up at me and said, "Mommy it hurts". His body was so weak and frail. I finally let out my first tear. The doctors and nurses rushed in with gauze and saline. His body began to swell. I was helpless. I am a nurse. It’s what I do... I take care of people and I couldn't help him. At that moment I knew my son’s life was in their hands.

I stood there as they tried to save my son’s life. I didn't know what to do or say. I looked across the room and there in the corner was my husband. He was standing there with a single tear in his eye. He was trying so hard to stay strong. But I could tell from his look he was broken. His face and heavy heart broke mine. I began to weep for my son. Not knowing if he would live or die. I couldn't control my tears. I wept as they catheterized my son and kept his body moist with sterile saline and warm with blankets. The nurse grabbed my hand and told me I needed to be strong for my son. I decided to leave the room for a moment. I couldn't face this alone.

I called my mother and my pastor. My mother was in tears and said she would be there soon. I cried to her "mom why did this happen to me and my baby?" Her answer still chills me to this day. She with a hint of anger replied, "Because you’re always in the wrong place at the wrong time." My Pastor told me he needed to pray. We hung up and felt sure he fell to his knees to pray for my son. I was shortly after told my son needed to be transferred to the local pediatric hospital.

The ambulance came to transport my son and me. My husband followed shortly after in our family van. I sat in the front of the ambulance while two EMT's; a man and woman; watched over my son in the back. I began to pray and try to bargain with God. Saying out loud “God please don't take my son away. I can't live without him. I promise his life to be dedicated to you if only you would spare his life. I will not live without him I can't please God please." I repeated the same prayer over and over louder as we drove. The louder I prayed it seemed the faster we drove. I could tell the ambulance driver was as scared for my son as I was. Finally we made it to the hospital.

When I got out of the ambulance there were several people waiting. They took my husband and me inside where I met my mother, step father, and two sisters. We were joined, shortly after, by my step mother, mother in law, and two members of my church. I just kept repeating to them... If I didn't go to the hospital that morning this never would have happened. If I didn't let him have a second hot dog he would have been with me.  In my heart I knew it was not my fault. But my mind screamed... your his mother... it’s your job to protect him... you failed at your job.

While planning his course of care I heard the doctors say the name Shriner's several times. They were telling me they were in contact with Shriner's and were waiting on them to call to plan his next move. The doctors examined his body and stated they would be transferring him to the ICU. Over 60% of his body was estimated to be burned but they wouldn't know more until the blisters were removed from his body and they were able to see the damage. Pockets of fluid covered the whole front of his body. I took my family one at a time to see him. Then when they all had viewed him over it was time to transfer to the ICU.

After we reached the ICU we were immediately told he would have to be transferred to Shriner's Burn hospital in Cincinnati. I was shocked as the doctors told me his burns were too extensive for the hospital to handle, and he needed to go to another hospital. This time he would fly, and we were unsure if I would be able to go with him. I sent my husband home to pack. We were going to Cincinnati.

At 4am the transport arrived and was able to relieve my fears of leaving him. I was able to fly with my son to Cincinnati, but my husband would have to find his own way there. I found out we were taking a private plane and would take only a few hours to arrive at the airport. We took an ambulance ride to the local airport and they loaded us up on the plane. I remember the first question I asked before we took off was, "where is Cincinnati?" "Ohio," replied the EMT.

We arrived at the Shriner's hospitals for Children in Cincinnati on July 20th. I felt lost. I didn't know exactly where I was. I was alone with no money, or clothes. I didn't know what was going to happen or where I would stay. A social worker guided me into a room and stated that she knew I had been through a lot, but they would provide a room for me and my family. They would provide money for food. And that I was at the best place I could be for my son. I finally let out a sigh of relief. I could for a second concentrate back on my son and his care.

They cleaned the blisters off of my son's body and estimated 40% of his body to be burned. He had no signs of smoke inhalation so he would not require a tracheotomy. We would have to treat him aggressively and in sterile conditions to prevent infection. Now it was a waiting game. It was a game my husband would soon join me for as he proceeded to Cincinnati overnight on a bus.

Seven days after we arrived at Shriner's, my son Eric celebrated his 4th birthday. We were told Eric would require surgery. They would use the skin from his back and hips as a donor to graft to his entire chest, shoulder, arm, and both upper legs. From his chest down to his knees would require grafting. After 2 painful surgeries he was deemed able to go home. We spent 18 of the longest days of our lives in that hospital, and though we are so grateful to them for their care and compassion, we were even more so happy to finally go home.

At home waiting for us was our daughters. (Lillian age 5, Violet age 2, and Nina age 14) They gently hugged him as they cried tears of joy to see their brother and parents. For 18 days I couldn't worry about my children at home. I couldn't even think of them, because it took everything in me to be there for my son. Finally I could hold my baby girls again. I missed them more than words can say. We had never been away from them for more than a couple of days. My children are my life and my life felt a little more complete at that moment.

We since have been back to Shriner's 8-10 times for checkups and follow-up surgeries. Eric always learns a new song each time we go. The nurses remember him as the boy with the smiling face who always says thank you. He would tell the nurses he loved them; even after a painful procedure. He is the boy who tried to make everyone laugh even when he was in pain himself. My son is incredibly strong. He has a sense of strength that I wish I had half of. I don't think I could ever deal with the pain he has overcome. And I don't know what in life I did to deserve such a wonderful boy.

My husband and I take every day one at a time. We don't know what to expect. We never know what’s around the corner. We do however appreciate every moment we spend with all our children. At first we were angry with God... but realized it was God who pulled him through and allowed him more time with us. We are so thankful for every moment with each of our children. My son, myself and my family is stronger because of what we have had to endure. And in a weird way I am thankful that we have joined together to overcome our pain and fears.

Every year there are over 1 million burn injuries in the US alone. Everyday hundreds of children are taken to the hospital for burn injuries. Eric’s story is not special, but he is a very special little boy. He likes to be called buddy. He believes he is a Hero (and he is to us). His favorite Super hero is Spiderman. He loves his mother, father, and sisters. And he never gives up an opportunity to let us know it. He is remarkable enough to smile thru his pain. He is a strong willed boy with a need just to live life to its fullest. He is Eric, my son, and a burn survivor.

I take care of people and I couldn't help him. At that moment I knew my son’s life was in their hands.
I stood there as they tried to save my son’s life. I didn't know what to do or say. I looked across the room and there in the corner was my husband. He was standing there with a single tear in his eye. He was trying so hard to stay strong. But I could tell from his look he was broken. His face and heavy heart broke mine. I began to weep for my son. Not knowing if he would live or die. I couldn't control my tears. I wept as they catheterized my son and kept his body moist with sterile saline and warm with blankets. The nurse grabbed my hand and told me I needed to be strong for my son. I decided to leave the room for a moment. I couldn't face this alone.
I called my mother and my pastor. My mother was in tears and said she would be there soon. I cried to her "mom why did this happen to me and my baby?" Her answer still chills me to this day. She with a hint of anger replied, "Because you’re always in the wrong place at the wrong time." My Pastor told me he needed to pray. We hung up and felt sure he fell to his knees to pray for my son. I was shortly after told my son needed to be transferred to the local pediatric hospital.
The ambulance came to transport my son and me. My husband followed shortly after in our family van. I sat in the front of the ambulance while two EMT's; a man and woman; watched over my son in the back. I began to pray and try to bargain with God. Saying out loud “God please don't take my son away. I can't live without him. I promise his life to be dedicated to you if only you would spare his life. I will not live without him I can't please God please." I repeated the same prayer over and over louder as we drove. The louder I prayed it seemed the faster we drove. I could tell the ambulance driver was as scared for my son as I was. Finally we made it to the hospital.
When I got out of the ambulance there were several people waiting. They took my husband and me inside where I met my mother, step father, and two sisters. We were joined, shortly after, by my step mother, mother in law, and two members of my church. I just kept repeating to them... If I didn't go to the hospital that morning this never would have happened. If I didn't let him have a second hot dog he would have been with me.  In my heart I knew it was not my fault. But my mind screamed... your his mother... it’s your job to protect him... you failed at your job.
While planning his course of care I heard the doctors say the name Shriner's several times. They were telling me they were in contact with Shriner's and were waiting on them to call to plan his next move. The doctors examined his body and stated they would be transferring him to the ICU. Over 60% of his body was estimated to be burned but they wouldn't know more until the blisters were removed from his body and they were able to see the damage. Pockets of fluid covered the whole front of his body. I took my family one at a time to see him. Then when they all had viewed him over it was time to transfer to the ICU.
After we reached the ICU we were immediately told he would have to be transferred to Shriner's Burn hospital in Cincinnati. I was shocked as the doctors told me his burns were too extensive for the hospital to handle, and he needed to go to another hospital. This time he would fly, and we were unsure if I would be able to go with him. I sent my husband home to pack. We were going to Cincinnati.
At 4am the transport arrived and was able to relieve my fears of leaving him. I was able to fly with my son to Cincinnati, but my husband would have to find his own way there. I found out we were taking a private plane and would take only a few hours to arrive at the airport. We took an ambulance ride to the local airport and they loaded us up on the plane. I remember the first question I asked before we took off was, "where is Cincinnati?" "Ohio," replied the EMT.
We arrived at the Shriner's hospitals for Children in Cincinnati on July 20th. I felt lost. I didn't know exactly where I was. I was alone with no money, or clothes. I didn't know what was going to happen or where I would stay. A social worker guided me into a room and stated that she knew I had been through a lot, but they would provide a room for me and my family. They would provide money for food. And that I was at the best place I could be for my son. I finally let out a sigh of relief. I could for a second concentrate back on my son and his care.
They cleaned the blisters off of my son's body and estimated 40% of his body to be burned. He had no signs of smoke inhalation so he would not require a tracheotomy. We would have to treat him aggressively and in sterile conditions to prevent infection. Now it was a waiting game. It was a game my husband would soon join me for as he proceeded to Cincinnati overnight on a bus.
Seven days after we arrived at Shriner's, my son Eric celebrated his 4th birthday. We were told Eric would require surgery. They would use the skin from his back and hips as a donor to graft to his entire chest, shoulder, arm, and both upper legs. From his chest down to his knees would require grafting. After 2 painful surgeries he was deemed able to go home. We spent 18 of the longest days of our lives in that hospital, and though we are so grateful to them for their care and compassion, we were even more so happy to finally go home.
At home waiting for us was our daughters. (Lillian age 5, Violet age 2, and Nina age 14) They gently hugged him as they cried tears of joy to see their brother and parents. For 18 days I couldn't worry about my children at home. I couldn't even think of them, because it took everything in me to be there for my son. Finally I could hold my baby girls again. I missed them more than words can say. We had never been away from them for more than a couple of days. My children are my life and my life felt a little more complete at that moment.
We since have been back to Shriner's 8-10 times for checkups and follow-up surgeries. Eric always learns a new song each time we go. The nurses remember him as the boy with the smiling face who always says thank you. He would tell the nurses he loved them; even after a painful procedure. He is the boy who tried to make everyone laugh even when he was in pain himself. My son is incredibly strong. He has a sense of strength that I wish I had half of. I don't think I could ever deal with the pain he has overcome. And I don't know what in life I did to deserve such a wonderful boy.
My husband and I take every day one at a time. We don't know what to expect. We never know what’s around the corner. We do however appreciate every moment we spend with all our children. At first we were angry with God... but realized it was God who pulled him through and allowed him more time with us. We are so thankful for every moment with each of our children. My son, myself and my family is stronger because of what we have had to endure. And in a weird way I am thankful that we have joined together to overcome our pain and fears.
Every year there are over 1 million burn injuries in the US alone. Everyday hundreds of children are taken to the hospital for burn injuries. Eric’s story is not special, but he is a very special little boy. He likes to be called buddy. He believes he is a Hero (and he is to us). His favorite Super hero is Spiderman. He loves his mother, father, and sisters. And he never gives up an opportunity to let us know it. He is remarkable enough to smile thru his pain. He is a strong willed boy with a need just to live life to its fullest. He is Eric, my son, and a burn survivor.

story:
What you will achieve with us

Aethic Sôvée sunscreen is truly Safer and Softer for your Skin and the Ocean.

We want all U.S. citizens to be able to buy Sôvée - world's most complete sunscreen - to protect your skin better and also to leave the ocean intact.

We need FDA approval to make that happen. Which is where you come in.

First, more about the product. 

We probably don't need to tell you about skin damage and worse caused by the sun's rays. We want to help you avoid those dangers, effectively.

There is a minimum requirement which allows companies to say that with just one or two sun filters, their sunscreen is "broad spectrum" though this only covers a minimum number of sun ray frequencies.

We think covering off the minimum isn't nearly good enough!

Instead, Sôvée has 3 sun filters to cover off more of those rays. These 3 sun filters are also the most photo-stable ones. This means they actually work longer than others once subjected to sun light. So, all in all, Sôvée protects your skin better.

We added Vitamin E as a skin anti-oxidant to prevent against damage beyond protection from the sun's rays.

We also added three ORGANIC moisturisers to nourish your skin. Leaving your skin hydrated, smooth and soft.

The preservatives used in Sôvée are organic and food-grade. So no nasties there either   - only goodies.

The ingredient list is one of the shortest in skincare!

People like U.S. Champion surfer Rochelle Ballard and National Geographic Young Explorer and Blue Advocate Alexandra Cousteau love the product. 

Everyone says that it goes on easily, is not sticky or oily, it absorbs well and leaves skin silky smooth.

Secondly, at Aethic we did not stop there. A leading marine scientist discovered that most other sunscreens seriously damage marine life.

All the ingredients considered for Sôvée were individually tested by that same scientist and we used only those that left corals and marine life intact.

We then tested the entire finished consumer product once more and this left both coral and mussels intact. No other can legitimately claim this. True enough, the Sôvée formula is patented.

While the cream itself is ecocompatible, we wanted everything else to be in line with that too.

So our bottle is made from corn plastic. Our box is made from paper from a sustainable source. Our inks are water-based. And we use no glue so the pack unfolds to reveal a full story printed on the inside - doing away with the insert.

In conclusion, Sôvée is like no other sunscreen. There is all the evidence to believe that it is the most complete sunscreen available and when you help us get FDA approval, you will be able to buy it from US retailers and use it too. 

You will be Aethic. And become part of a movement for better skin protection and feeling good about leaving the ocean intact.


HOW WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION BE SPENT?

FDA approval is being handled with and for us by a specialist American law firm based in Washington D.C. The lead attorney on our submission is awesome, super cool and a true professional. We're confident that she and her team will get the job done.

All we need now, is for you to please contribute towards our legal costs. When you do at the right level of reward, you get to try Sôvée for yourself too.

Please contribute as much as you can. People like you can make a real difference.

Thank you.

Allard.


OTHER WAYS FOR YOU TO HELP

If you can't contribute funds, that's ok. Just spread the word. Send this link and our  website link to your friends, like us on facebook, use the tools provided by Indiegogo. Seriously, every little helps, and as I said in the video, our objective is not only to get FDA approval but also to get the word out about Sôvée. So, thanks again for anything at all you can contribute to achieve that. I really appreciate it.

story:
As we continue to push for true health care reform in our country, we must deal with our current reality when we get sick or injured. If you are not fortunate enough to have insurance, like many of us, several non-profit community clinics and county hospitals will see you. One of the obstacles is figuring out the paperwork and the different hoops you have to jump through to get that care. Insurance companies and government health programs are not concerned with addressing this lack of information.

In response to this problem, we are creating the Do-It-Yourself Guide for the Uninsured: Getting Health Care in Alameda County as a resource tool for people in need of health care. It contains a directory of clinics for low to no income clients, step-by-step instructions on how to enroll in a new comprehensive county health program called HealthPAC, and tips & tricks from physicians and social workers on how to work your way through the system.

We need your help in publishing this guide and getting it out to our communities. We need your financial support. We hope to raise enough money for 500 copies of the guide. We are throwing a kick-off event at Mosswood Park in Oakland on October 13th. Free copies will be distributed at an information booth and physicians and social workers will be on hand to answer questions. We will also distribute the guide to local community centers and public venues. With additional funds, we plan to launch a website featuring a downloadable version of the guide.

This project is not funded by any political campaigns, lobbies, insurance companies, grants, etc. We, Rose Khor and Jack Ian Lin, are an artist / designer collaborative team and this is an entirely grassroots effort. We embarked on this social action project because we simply have too many friends and community members that do not have adequate health coverage. This guide is inspired by these folks, and we hope it reaches many more. Any support you can provide is greatly appreciated! If you aren’t able to donate, please pass this onto your friends.

 

Hot off the press:

DIY Guide for the Uninsured: Getting Health Care in Alameda County

Mosswood Park

W. MacArthur Blvd. and Broadway

Saturday, October 13, 10 am-2 pm

story:
http://seattletimes.com/html/politics/201908195...

WHO ARE WE? 

 Chi-square Technologies is providing an electronic technological concept for global portable medical records that will lower healthcare costs, provide better, quicker, safer medical care and in turn, save lives. We sell performance, vision, technology, process & expertise. 

 WHAT IS OUR PRODUCT? 

 The product we are presenting here is a multifunctional smart card. It carries all the critical personal information with you and with highest possible security. Three of its major roles are: 

 1. Portable medical records - can deliver a summary medical record at the point of care with or without the Internet and act as a physical security key to access all previous episodes of care over time and across delivery systems, thereby creating a global longitudinal medical record. 

2. Electronic insurance cards – can guarantee identity, store value and insurance benefits on the card and adjudicate health insurance right at your doctor’s office. 

3. All in one cards - contain an electronic driver’s license, passport, voters ID, national ID & portable medical record that can only be viewed by someone with an access card which provides appropriate credentialing for the specific application (police see a driver’s license, MD sees the medical record, etc).

 The system we adopted for this technology is called Makron®. Makron® is an encrypted virtual private network (VPN) that acts as an ATM banking system for medical record exchange connecting disparate EMRs (Emergency Medical Records). 

 HOW DOES CHI-SQUARE HELP? 

 We all agree there are many, many problems with our current healthcare system. Adverse drug interactions and adverse drug reactions kill 100,000 American men, women and children each year. This is equivalent to 500 Boeing 737 crashes per year and no one would stand for that. The only way to avoid adverse drug interactions is to have everyone connected to the same system and have that system run in real time. This is exactly what Chi-square does! 

 Fragmented records and medical record errors kill another 98,000 people each year in the US and cost billions in unnecessary healthcare expenses and lost productivity. X2 can effect a major drop in the number of deaths due to these medical errors and a corresponding drop in costs. 

 People are traveling more and if they fall ill, their records need to be with them. Ideally they should be available at the point of care, anywhere, anytime even in disaster situations like Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Isaac when all services are down (power, phone & Internet) and casualties are high. With the current systems this is not possible. With Chi-square’s system, your core medical records are always with you, stored in a chip embedded in a smart card. 

 X2 solves the four fatal faults: 

 1. Privacy – the X2 PMR (Personal Medical Record) acts as a physical security key to your records. It cannot be accessed without your permission and you can have an accounting of whom saw what and when it was seen. 

2. Disruption – no power, no Internet equals no records. The X2 PMR works both On-line and core data is available Off-line. 

 3. Secure log-on – with X2, only one record at a time is exposed and it requires both an access card (who is looking) and a data card to grant permission. This protects against both external and internal hacking threats. 

4. Fragmentation – all episodes of care are listed on the card and the server so the patient does not have to remember. Every time you use the card, it is automatically updated with the previous episode of medical care. 

 In addition, the “X2 system” provides unique benefits to the 6 P’s: Patients, Providers, Pharmacists, Payers, Plans and Producers. X2 can reduce logistical costs (>10%), redundancy costs (>20%), and disease management costs (20-55%), saving $100 to $200 Billion per year and making national healthcare affordable. 

X2 aims to improve society through implementing this convenient technology. X2 can provide a smartcard summary record at the point of care and use the card as a physical security key to connect everyone to a common security platform for medical record exchange. The system guarantees identity, reduces fraud, prevents adverse drug interactions, reduces medical errors, delivers medical records at the point of care with or without the Internet, links disparate EMRs and practice management systems, collects, standardizes, aggregates and analyzes the medical record data to target therapies and populations to reduce disease management costs by 20 to 55%. 

 WHY IS CHI-SQUARE UNIQUE?

 • Our system is patient-centric. 

• We have two major patents pending. 

• We are user friendly for both patients and physicians. 

• Our product was developed by a physician and a patient. 

 • We are vastly less expensive than current EMR systems. 

 SYSTEM COMPARISONS 

WHAT WILL WE DO WITH YOUR CONTRIBUTION? 

 With your help, we will be able to achieve these goals and benefit society altogether: 

 • $150,000 will allow us to finish the last minute programming details before going live. 

 • If we are fortunate enough to raise $350,000, that will allow us to go live and purchase data bases with the latest medical information, rent server and storage space and complete the first proof of concept pilot. 

 • If you, our contributors, are kind enough to contribute $500,000, we will be able to complete the final proof of concept pilot, add additional features to the software system, and shortly thereafter be in business. 

 Anything above the $500,000 level we will tell you about in further updates and we promise that we will have plenty of exciting updates for you on a regular basis!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Peace y'all! My name is Tracee Thomas and I am the creator behind Yoga is for Everyone. I am a certified Kemetic Yoga instructor and have been practicing yoga for more than 7 years. When my mother was diagnosed with Stage 4 colon cancer in 2007, my love affair with yoga intensified and I began to practice daily. Yoga gave me the peace of mind and strength to support my mother while she battled cancer.


I created Yoga is for Everyone because of my personal experience with the benefits of yoga and working with with people who have transformed their lives and health through the practice of yoga. In my travels and teaching,  I come across many individuals who were interested in trying yoga, know about the benefits but are afraid to begin, or believing that yoga if for people of a certain height, weight, shape, or size. These misconceptions are most prevelant in communities that would be postively impacted by the benefits of yoga.

Yoga is for Everyone will be a critical contribution in communities where stress, diabetes, obesity, high blood pressure are major killers. Your contribution will make sure that we are able to get this video into the hands of those who need it the most and spread the healing power of yoga to everyone.

Yoga is for Everyone is a professionally produced instructional workout DVD, filmed on location by Producer Extraordinaire, Nykole Tyson of NT Media Productions. The quality, the imagery, the love and partnership that went into this project is evident in the quality.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5000 to cover the final costs of marketing and distributing the DVD. Your contribution will allow us to build a website, design and create packaging for the film, compensate the artists who contributed to the film, as well as marketing and distribution of the film. By donating or pre-ordering a copy of the DVD, you will allow us to achieve our goal of launching Yoga is for Everyone this Spring!

You can donate as little as $5 to support the campaging and for a minimum of $25, you will recieve an advanced copy of Yoga is for Everyone!

If, for some strange reason, our goal is not met, donated funds will go to covering the immediate needs of distribution of the DVD.

 

The Impact

The positive benefits of yoga have been studied by medical doctors around the world. After just once class, yoga can increase relaxation and decrease stress. Yoga has been proven to lower incidents of heart disease, lower blood pressure and cholesterol, as well as reduce the risk of stroke.  Yoga also effects mental health, with studies showing a relationship to improved self image, a positive effect on learning and memory, as well as other conditions including insomnia and depression.  With so many people suffering with these conditions, please join me in making this practice accessible to everyone. I want to show that you do not have to be a granola eating, Burkenstock wearing gymnast to practice yoga (not that there is anything wrong with being a granola eating, Burkenstock wearing gymnast!)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially at this time, we value your voice just as much. If you believe in our message and want to support our mission, please spread the word! Tell your friends, your co-workers, your students, your grandma (yoga is for her too!) Join us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter to find out more about Yoga is for Everyone! 

Thank you!

Namaste! Hotep! Ase!

story:
OUR PERKS:

Official CHOT Ball

Official CHOT® T-Shirt  

                            

                                       

                         Signature Series Collectible CHOT® Ball   

 

              The Gladiator Perk

                 

                                  

          Official CHOT PRO Set

                         

                                

                  Collectible Bronze Plated CHOT® Ball

                 

                   Collectible 24k Gold Plated CHOT® Ball

                   

 

                                                                                    The "GLADIATOR" spirit of SLINGING with GOLF for a WHOLE NEW SPORT!

 

Introducing...CHOT®!

 

Executive Golfers – meet the CHOT Gladiator!

With practice, you could soon "out drive" your golfing buddy straight down the fairway, over 275 yards!  But distance isn't the whole game. When it comes to distance, accuracy to the green, or precision in the net, CHOT creates the perfect challenge for beginners and seasoned slingers alike. 

CHOT is a professional slinging sport played on a golf course. It’s similar to golf, except CHOT uses slings instead of clubs, and an oblong ball instead of a round one. Like golf, your objective is to propel your ball to each hole in the fewest number of slings – only your goal isn’t the hole; it’s a circular net attached to the hole’s flag.

_______________________________________________

 

 

CHOT® can be played Side by Side with Golf!

You can play CHOT while your buddy plays golf beside you. You’ve got slings – he’s got clubs. You can play both great sports side by side – simultaneously!

_______________________________________________

 

An Ancient Sport for the Modern Age

Anciently, slings were used by warriors and hunters with deadly precision. They could hurl their “missiles” within a hair’s breadth of their targets. These carefully prepared missiles were oblong with narrow ends. CHOT balls are crafted after this manner, providing a skilled slinger with incredible velocity and accuracy.

A CHOT ball doesn’t hook or slice like a golf ball will. It spirals straight through the air like a football. 

CHOT is an adrenaline rush! It’s easy to learn and thrilling to master! 

________________________________________

 

CHOT® Equipment

Players employ 3 different length slings (driver sling, mid-range sling, putter sling) to hurl a uniquely designed CHOT ball into a 13 inch net attached to each flag on the green. A special CHOT glove is worn to protect the middle finger of the slinging hand. Slings are easily carried on CHOT belt clips. 

CHOT equipment is significantly less than golf equipment, and effortless to pack around the golf course.

Major Benefits to Golf Courses

With the economic downturn, golf courses across the nation are struggling to stay open. The US Professional CHOT Association (USPCA) has produced a sport that will re-populate golf courses. With a whole new game, comes a whole new athlete and a whole new fan base. 

By combining the “gladiator” aspect of CHOT and the “executive’s" game of golf, we have given golf course owners a new vertical market to increase demand of play without compromising their course layout, architectural design, or tee times. Another bonus – CHOT Gladiators don't leave club divots on the course! 

CHOT® as a Global, Professional Sport

There are over 16,000 golf courses in the United States alone. As licensed CHOT courses pop up across the nation, other countries will join in the game. The USPCA is strategically positioning itself to make CHOT a global professional sport.

_______________________________________________

 

How You Can Help

Your contribution to this campaign will provide the resources to manufacture equipment and promote the USPCA worldwide. This is your once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help launch a new professional sport! 

Your contribution will be used for the following:

• Production of additional CHOT equipment; slings, gloves, balls, nets, manuals, etc.

• Videos and training materials for golf courses

• Training and certification of new CHOT professionals and golf courses

_______________________________________________

 

Fundraising Opportunities

Our goal as the United States Professional CHOT® Association (USPCA), is not just to create a one of a kind sport and a whole new athlete, but also to create a professional sport that will hold tournaments specifically designed to promote community and charitable contributions.  

CHOT® tournaments are the perfect opportunity to raise funds for Boys and Girls Clubs, Charitable Events, Scout Troops, School Intramural Sports and College and University Clubs. 

Your contributions go even deeper.  

The USPCA has a higher calling.  By joining us in making CHOT® a professional sport,  we will not only be creating a whole new sport, we will create a whole new money making machine for community fundraising. Our goal is for CHOT® Tournaments to be the leader in creating a sport that gives back to the community......and the giving starts right now!

Any contributions we receive over our goal for this campaign, the USPCA will be giving 25% to our premiere charity, CHILDHELP for the prevention and treatment of child abuse.

By contributing to our campaign, you will jettison our effort to make a better world for all children.

“It should not and must not hurt to be a Child!"

About Our Perks

We have designed our perks to help you become a part of sports history. Most of us weren't there when basketball, football and golf were created, but you can have a piece of sports history with a signature CHOT® ball or 1st edition CHOT® set.

For those who really catch our vision we are offering a unique opportunity to get your course set up for players.  If you don't have a golf course but you want to play big, go to our website www.chotpro.com to inquire about owning a Distributorship available in your area.

Give Us Your Feedback!

Please use our campaign forum to ask any questions you have about CHOT or to leave us any comments regarding the campaign or the sport.  Our desire is to meet the needs of our contributors, our players, and our courses.  Your input is important to us.

 

  CLICK HERE TO VISIT OUR WEBSITE

 

THANK YOU for your support!

We invite you to join us at our inaugural tournament coming soon!  

Follow us on......

story:
Hi! 

My name is Kaleigh and I am 26 years old. In 2008, I was diagnosed with a prolactinoma, which is a type of tumor on my pituitary gland, which is in the middle of my brain. In the easiest way to explain it, it basically makes my body think that I am pregnant. Not to mention it pushes against my optic nerve, making my vision worse and giving me a constant headache. At the end of 2008, I was able to get an MRI and see an endrocrinologist 2 times before I lost my insurance. Since then, I have not had treatment for this tumor. I was in college and could not get insurance and have been unemployed since, yet actively searching for a job; anything to get insurance! This tumor has caused 30 lbs of weight gain, loss of menstration (which means I can't have kids), and can possibly lead me to becoming permanently infertle and even possibly blind if the tumor causes enough damage to my optic nerve.

 

I am doing this because I don't have any other options right now. I have contacted various organizations seeking help, but since my tumor is benign, I have been denied help. I need to see a doctor very badly, and possibly need to have another MRI since it has been so long. MRIs are not cheap and neither are doctor visits. The medications I was on before was $250 a month and that was WITH insurance, so it will be the same or more without. But I'm just reaching out for any kind of help I can get. I am young and do not want this tumor to control my body and life anymore. Plus, I do not want it to make me inferitle so I won't have the choice of having my own children. 

 

If you can not donate, that is fine, I know times are hard. But spread the word; share with your friends or anyone you know. I appreciate any and everything because it will all go towards the outrageous amount of money I will need in order to even get a doctor's appointment.

 $5000.00 is a small portion of what I will end up needing (MRIs, Blood work, Multiple Dr visits, Medications), but I figured it is a start. I know I'll end up needing more, but this will help give me a start.

Thank you so much.

 

Update 7/23: If anyone has anything personal to ask or share, please send it in a message, not a comment being rude. Also, since going public, someone has reached out to me and told me about UVA having a hospital/department dedicated to my type of tumor. I have sent them the application and paperwork they need in order to contact me about assistance and will be mailing my medical records and MRI CDs this week to their patient coordinator, who I have been emailing with. IF I do get financial assistance from them, this money will be used to pay them what I can and also for transportation to and from there, as I do not have an income at the moment. It will also be used, if I have surgery, for my mother to travel to stay with me during recovery. Thanks.

 

Update 8/7: So I heard back from UVA & the endocrinologist & neurosurgeon want to see me! Earliest I could get in for everything is October 24; that day I will have a MRI at 10:00, see the endocrinologist at 12, & neurosurgeon at 12:30! I did qualify for some financial assistance, but will still be paying a certain amount towards visits, tests, and possible surgery. I also still need to raise money for that, travel costs (and everything that comes with travel, ex: food, gas, tickets, rent a car ((if needed)) and so on), not to mention, my mom will be taking time off of work to come, especially if I have surgery, so she will be missing work/pay. Thank you for all of the support so far! I'm thankful this is going to be happening & still need to raise funds, so don't forget to share with your friends!!! Thank you!!!!!!!!

story: Hi, my name is Diane. James and I are from Colorado. I don't know what else to do but tell our story, briefly. It is unreal what we went through. My son James was born with Down's Syndrome and physical problems that required him to endure 20 operations by age 16.  I slept in a hospital chair most of those years. James' Dr.'s wanted us to move near sea level so he could breathe without oxygen. We moved to North Carolina to be near my other daughter. I felt I needed to be near her after losing my oldest daughter to double pneumonia. We moved into a condo in Winston-Salem that the owner said was a clean enviroment after expressing the Dr.'s and my concerns about James. I trusted him, signed the lease and moved in. After a few weeks, James seemed weaker, started coughing, wheezing, his eyes were swollen and his nose was runny. I started feeling sick, too, and could smell a musty odor in the kitchen. I told the Landlord, he came out and and said all was well. I turned to a Licensed Mold Inspector who took samples. They turned out to be Black Mold and 2 other toxic types. I was later told by the Landlord's plumber that he knew of leaks between the walls of the condo from the upstairs toilets but did not want to incur the expense of tearing the walls down and rebuilding them, since they were saturated with three to four different types of mold, even though the leaks were fixed the walls had already been damaged.  We left the place after over 2 years of breathing these toxins and hired a lawyer to go after the Landlord. The attorney assured me of his knowledge of mold cases and required a $2,500.00 retainer from me. Over a year went by with little response from the attorney. I finally had to fire him, he did nothing on our behalf. When I went to his office to get my money back, he'd left town. I was devastated and had to go through months of red tape and trips to the State Bar, who eventually refunded the retainer from a fund. The attorney was dis-barred and had no malpractice insurance. The Statute of Limitations is near expiration, the mold report was in his files which I could not get back. All this time, we remained sick and untreated. James nearly died several times from bacterial pneumonia and lost all his teeth. I stay sick and foggy all the time from the exposure. James likes to eat and watch movies. He's lived off baby food for 2 years and going downhill. I can't get help from any Dr's, they seem to know nothing about mold effects. The only few I found want thousands of dollars upfront to begin treatment. James needs some teeth so he can eat solid food again.  We are near the bottom, and I fear losing my son due to the criminal acts of the landlord and the attorney. I can't believe this could be allowed to happen to a helpless little boy who's suffered all his life. Please help us,  thank-you, Diane Hendrix

story:
The Galaxy is part of the Wexford Soccer Club which is the oldest club in Scarborough, Ontario Canada.  The Galaxy is a MU15 rep team which earned a promotion last season and will be playing in Premier Division of the Central Soccer League (CSL) as well as entering tournaments for the 2013 season.  Promotion to Premier Division also means an increase in travel for the Galaxy as we will be travelling as far as Sudbury (400km) for league games.   The Galaxy is a unique team as we have players from all socio-economic levels and backgrounds a number of which are unable to meet the financial commitments of a team.  

The Head Coach is a former NCAA player/Phys. Ed. Specialist who volunteers his time and energy and believes in giving everyone an opportunity.  Though the team carries 18 players, the Coach opens training for anyone who wants to play and we routinely have 30-40 players in attendance.  He provides the opportunity for skill development and fosters a sense of belonging to all those who step on the pitch.  Among other benefits, the program also fosters positive coping mechanisms in adjusting to life’s challenges and encourages the boys to be leaders on and off the field.  As an educator, he knows the importance of fostering a sense of belonging and community especially for those inner-city youth who are at risk of leaving school and falling through the cracks. 

The Galaxy is a very diverse and unique team which is part of an incredible training program.  We are asking for financial support to help the team with travel and playing expenses as well as helping to keep the program running.

If you want to help youth build confidence, stay in school and develop their self-esteem, please make a donation to the Galaxy.  We believe these kids are winners, please help provide them with the opportunity to prove it not only to you but, to themselves.

Sincerest thanks,

Michele

Team Manager

story:
Project Overview

Fitness Hero is a great way to get in shape and we are excited to finally announce the creation of our fun and custom designed AVATARS!  

For years, we have dreamed about creating a life like Avatar that would evolve with the user and could resemble the goals and strides our users make on a day-to-day basis.  Our Avatars will become an interactive aspect that takes fitness training to a whole new level.

Creating this interactive piece to personal training is more than just about entertaining our users, but rather motivating our users to train harder, achieve more and even reach a level that they have not been able to reach before.

Avatars can be customized with clothing, skin color, appearance and will even evolve physically with the user, as they obtain their fitness goals.  But we felt that wasn't enough!  Avatars hold secret power-ups and gifts that users can obtain by meeting their daily and weekly goals.  From free personal training sessions, workout tools and products, to fun entertaining power-ups, such as cool accessories, celebration videos and more.  All you have to do is achieve your goals to play.

Fitness Hero believes that exercise and health should be about FUN!  Most fitness programs, videos and home equipment lack the essential entertainment value to really keep you going and coming back for more, so we were determined to do something different.

So, how do we pull this off?  By developing a game version that interacts with the user, you are in total control of your Avatar's results.  You are the driving factor of whether your Avatar will evolve, or fall off into Avatar destruction.  Our developers have worked hard on creating a concept that can be duplicated, yet customized, with the hopes to maximize the users experience, thus creating a longer lasting, more satisfactory fitness experience that will last throughout the year.

We have come a long way in developing the Fitness programs and back-bone to make this gaming version of Fitness Hero a success and now we need your help to bring us home.  Through this indiegogo project, our goal is to raise enough money to complete the creation of our dream.  We have set our minimum goal with this kickstarter at $5,000, but we are shooting to raise a full $20,000 with this project.  $5,000 will complete the essential framework necessary to bring these Avatar Characters alive, but $20,000 will create the identity aspects that make these Avatars come fully to life and interact on a customized basis.

Every donation counts and we now need your support to make this happen.  If you have questions, please don't hesitate to contact us directly.  

Thanks in advance for all your support!!

Challenges We Face

Every project has some risks and challenges and ours are very animation related. Our goal is to create "life like" Avatars that can evolve digitally while the user creates a more healthy and fit lifestyle. With any digital world, creating a customizable human figure can be challenging and making movements and body components can take some planning and lot's of story boarding.

Our team has put in a tremendous amount of time in the design, character features and planning of the various phases, every one of our Avatars will go through in order to come out looking their best. We are confident that with enough time and effort, we can make these characters exactly what we want and with your support, we will have the software and expertise necessary to make the final leg of this project successful.

With you involved, we can do this!!!

story:
No matter what your kid’s age, as a parent you always want to know about everything that happened while you weren't with them. Existing solutions require tuning in to a live feed or sifting through hours of recorded video to see if something significant happened. As a result, you miss out on important events and special memories. That's where Invidyo comes in.


Invidyo is the first intelligent child monitoring solution that uses both Face and Emotion Recognition technology to identify important events in your child’s day. It generates a daily Magic Moments Clip and provides smart notifications via the Invidyo app to make you feel close to your child while you are away.

Invidyo also automatically captures snapshots when your child smiles and generates an album of these images. We never delete a smile so that you can always cherish those memorable moments.


"The standout feature, though, is that Invidyo filters the important parts of the child's day, and condenses them into a two-minute summary that parents can view from their phones or desktop. " - CNBC

"Invidyo is using A.I. to give parents daily highlights when they are away at work and smarter notifications, when necessary" - VentureBeat

"For parents who can’t be with their children as much as they’d like ... Invidyo could be the solution" - DigitalTrends

"Here is a child monitor that uses artificial intelligence to give parents peace of mind." - Gadgetify

"first intelligent child monitoring solution that uses both Face and Emotion Recognition technology to identify important events in your child's day" - GearBrain

“Invidyo is the technology to have if you are a working parent, or even just want to keep an eye on your babysitter while you are out.” - Interesting Engineering

“It’s an ideal set up to have when you’ve left your toddler with a babysitter, but don’t want to miss out on those vital moments.” - Paste Magazine

The Invidyo app is available for iOS and Android and is jam-packed with awesome features. In addition to smart notifications, you can:

  • Watch live streams and access recordings of events
  • View daily Magic Moments Clips, and more detailed videos associated with each event
  • Train the system to recognize family and friends
  • Access reports of faces seen in your home
  • Talk to your child Play your baby’s favorite lullaby
  • View albums of your child smiling
  • Monitor current values of temperature, humidity and air quality in your home, and access six hours of history
  • Share live or stored videos on social media
  • Turn on/off camera and change camera settings


Magic Moments Clip - Creates short summary clips that feature important highlights of your child’s day

Smile Albums - Snaps a photo when your baby is smiling and automatically archives them in albums

FamilyID - Recognizes your child, their caretaker and the rest of the family

Stranger Alert - Notifies you if somebody unknown is in your home

Crying Detection - Knows when your child is crying and notifies you

Quality of Life Monitoring - Detects smoke, monitors temperature and humidity in your baby’s environment

Two-Way Communication - Enables you to talk to or soothe your baby right from your mobile phone

Auto Lullaby Player - Lets you play their favourite lullaby automatically when crying or other loud noise is detected

HD Video - Captures sharp and smooth video with a wide field of view and crystal clear audio

Night Vision - Allows you to see clearly even in very low light conditions

Secure Cloud-Based Recording - Stores your recordings under bank level security on our servers; You can access your recorded videos anytime, anywhere

Smart Notifications - Sends you notifications if there’s a sudden noise, movement, change in temperature or humidity, smoke, detection of an unknown person and more

Wired & Wireless Connection Options - Connect via your Wi-Fi network or ethernet cable

Built-in Battery - Records for an hour after the electricity or internet cuts out

Easy Set-up - Get started in under two minutes



Setting up Invidyo takes less than two minutes. Just plug in the camera, download the mobile app and follow the instructions.


We are Özgür, Ekin and Yağız. We met 20 years ago in middle school, and founded Invidyo together in 2012. As you can imagine, a lot happened between our playground days and our crowdfunding campaign!

After university, Özgür and Yağız went on to get PhDs in image and video processing and Ekin got his Master’s degree in interaction design.

Then, our friends started having babies. When they had to go back to work after childbirth, they not only missed their children, they felt they were missing out on precious moments too.

Our friends were having trouble finding a good monitoring solution that addressed all of their pain points. They found that existing cameras were complicated to set-up and required watching eight hours of recordings every day to understand if anything important happened. Previously, you were required to own a DVR, which had limited capacity and was prone to breaking down. More recently cloud-based recording came on the scene, but cameras that leveraged it were unable to detect important events.


We set out to build a system that could analyze the video data and automatically determine important moments in the day (both happy times and incidents). Then Ekin had a baby girl and things got more serious. :)

We realized it was essential to add functionality that would monitor the baby’s environment. Air quality and temperature are important ways to ensure your baby remains happy and healthy when you aren’t there.

Our founder team brings 45 years of combined experience to the table. We’ve produced four different working prototypes in the last 2.5 years and have successfully solved the problems that arose along the way... Our beta users have been rigorously testing our most recent prototype for the last 6 months and have been giving us excellent feedback to help us improve Invidyo. We’re confident that our design is the top child monitoring solution out there.

Because the percentage of mums going back to work is decreasing year after year, we’re committed to making sure that parents, especially mothers, can return to the workforce guilt-free after childbirth. Our mission is to connects parents with their children while apart, and give you peace of mind that everything is under control in your absence.

Our team has been working hard to bring you a monitor that will serve you for years to come. We now need your support to go full-scale production, so no parent will miss another precious moment again.

Our moldings and packaging are complete, and we’ve already done our first test production run!

A portion of funds raised will be dedicated to further refining of the technology so we can deliver the very best product to you. The remaining money will be spent on streamlining the production process and reducing manufacturing costs.

We look forward to sharing our passion with the Indiegogo community as we head into production. Backers will play a vital role in the development of Invidyo, and we welcome your feedback on how we can make our product even better. Together, we hope to shape the final features and bring our vision to life, delivering the very best baby monitoring solution for working parents.
